results.description:
This is a special tour created for this holiday season
We will visit Columbia University campus, Barnard College campus and then go West to Riverside Church and Grants Tomb.
We will see several holiday lights on 125th St. and end up at a lovely non profit workshop/store(located near the 125th subway station) where you can pick up low cost hand made items at the special holiday fair.

Please note the $15 MeetUp Member charge per person for this special tour. This tour's value is actually $250 (for 10 people) as that is my charge for most of my private tours. Kindly provide me with exact payment at the venue. Discount price for students and senior citizens is offered at $12.

Like my other walks, I do not plan to cancel the walk as this is a multi group event. Also since I set a 30 person limit, please cancel your RSVP if you decide your initial plans have changed. Please feel free to text or call me at[masked] with any questions.

Thank You
results.name: Holiday Lights and Fun in Harlem Tour

results.description:
We'll be hosting another Dungeons & Dragons Expedition in October.


Expeditions are longer, more involved sessions when compared to Encounters.

The Expedition will be organized by one of our DM's, Ann.

The Expedition will run for approximately 4 hours, with a small break in the middle of the experience.

Ann will be there an hour before the event to help with character creation or level adjustments.
The Expedition is contingent upon having enough players show up, so if you're planning to come be sure to RSVP here on Meetup.

results.description:
This Event:


The aim of this weekly event is to offer a place where fellow Python developers and learners can come and asks questions and/or code with some company! This event is free. 


Resources:

Here are some learning resources and free text editor / IDE suggestions.

https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst 

Detailed Directions to us:

As you enter the building located at 568 Broadway, New York, NY 10012 you will need to provide ID and your destination (Fueled Collective, 11th Floor) to the front desk. They will provide you with a sticker badge. Take one of the elevators (located to the right of the front desk) to the 11th floor. We will be in the Deerbrook conference room.
results.how_to_find_us: Show ID at front desk, come up to 11th floor, we are in the Deerbrook conference room!
results.name: Sunday Office Hours

results.description: Jnanaprabha Jennifer Bobbe (ryt-200) (http://.scarsdaleaikido.com/yoga-teacher-bios.html) will teach a full Integral Yoga basic class incorporating a complete yoga practice. The class is appropriate for all levels including new beginners. The goal of the class is an "easeful body, peaceful mind, useful life." It is intended as preparation for seated meditation and we will take this opportunity to engage in an optional seated meditation practice immediately following class. All welcome. No prior experience necessary. Class by donation.
results.name: Yoga & Meditation

group.name: White Plains: Still Mind Martial Arts & Yoga

results.description:
A great spot for practicing, FPV training, and shooting video


There are also two rows of small tress that can be used to FPV race through.. 

Turn onto Cherry Lane....


Park in the 2nd parking lot (on the right by the porta-johns), cross the bridge at the NjDug sign (going west) and climb up the trial, following the cones, to the field pictured above.

We'll start at 1pm and fly 'till dusk (or batteries run out) - but if you'd like to fly earlier, send me a message (Slack or eMail) and I'll get there earlier for you.

                            (PLEASE don't fly without the group)

(we have a good rapport with the local police and don't want to mess that up)
results.name: Fly-In 'among the trees'

** SUNDAY AFTERNOON OPEN PLAY ** 

This is Open Play ONLY. No instruction for this one. Just pure fun. 

• 3+ hours of play time for Beginners & Intermediates. 

• Brandeis H.S.  (84th St. Between Columbus and Amsterdam)

• Intermediates - $14.00 (2 main courts)

• Beginners- ONLY $8.00 (1 back court)

• Time Sunday - 1:15 pm to 4:45 pm 

Bring your buddies or come alone and meet new friends. You must sign up online in advance. Please click the link to sign up. These sessions fill up quickly. 

http://nyurban.com/open-play-volleyball/


SIGN UP ON LINE NOW!


***Please note- RSVP'g on Meetup will not reserve your spot. Please go to our website to sign up.*** A credit card payment is required to reserve your space.

http://nyurban.com/open-play-volleyball/

venue.name: Cadman Plaza (Turf Fields)

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game for all levels. 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe, Please bring  $4 in cash to the game. 

RSVP closes at 11:15AM (2 hours before the game)

PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP BY MIDNIGHT THE DAY BEFORE THE GAME!

No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP by midnight the day before the game will be red carded after the second offense which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Williamsburg Soccer Training activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Williamsburg Soccer Training Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Williamsburg Soccer Training programs or activities.
results.how_to_find_us: Coach Moe will be wearing a neon yellow pinnie.
results.name: PICK UP GAME SUN 1:15 PM Cadman Plaza

group.name: Brooklyn Soccer Club - Adult Soccer lessons and pickup games

results.description:
Since we had such a good turn out to our first Holiday Hunt, we're doing it again!

The Amazing Holiday Scavenger Hunt is part hunt, part obstacle course & ALL FUN! A series of clues leads you around the city performing mental & (not-so) physical challenges along the way. 

It is a great way to connect with friends or meet new ones. Each member of the winning team receives a New York City gift package. This hunt will have a holiday theme to it!

GET TICKETS HERE ($25 early bird, price will go up to $35) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Dec-20-2015_at_0130PM

What to expect:  

• A fun day with with new friends 

• Knowledge about hidden parts of the city

• Mental and (not-so) physical challenges

• A memorable adventure with photos

• A story to tell

You can come alone and be placed with a partner or you can sign up with a guest. You'll do the scavenger in pairs of two. 

*Prepay Only Event (No tickets sold at door)

*BUY TICKETS HERE ($25, price goes up as date gets closer) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Dec-20-2015_at_0130PM

Who can attend? All are welcome. This is not an age/ethnic/gender specific event. 

What should I wear? Dress for the elements. Be prepared for to walk. Dress comfortable – Most teams wear running shoes. 

What should I bring? A fun attitude, A Smart Phone if you have (either Android or I-Phone - fully charged). The hunt is run through an app called ScanQuest. Best to download that before you come to the event.

Where do we go? There’s no set course. Find your own way. It’s a ‘choose your own adventure’ race. You will go around the city.

What if it rains? You won’t melt, we promise! The race still goes on. Races can actually be MORE fun in the rain!

Why does your RSVP say +40? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We usually have at least 40 members attend. 

Where do I get a ticket? You must prepay to attend. Tickets will not be sold at the door. We expect this event to sell out so get your tickets here ASAP - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Dec-20-2015_at_0130PM
results.name: The Amazing Holiday Scavenger Hunt (Prepay Required)

results.description:
Play 3v3 & 4v4 (without keepers), and 5v5 (with keepers) for an hour on the best turf product in the city.

[Please note: the number of players and the willingness of people to play in goal will determine the format. Also: If we have all 12 spots filled, we will have three teams of four, rotating every five minutes - so that one team plays for ten minutes, then sits for five - over 1.5 hours.]

Everything provided (e.g., EPL ball and pillowy soft pinnies) - including warm and dry-conditions.

Before coming, please read the facility rules here: http://www.thepitchbrooklyn.com/rules/

* No plastic molded cleats and no metal cleats are allowed on the pitch. You can wear rubber-studded cleats, indoor shoes and sneakers.

* Shin guards are also required.

* Cash-only payments this week.

Thanks!

Heather

Our second meet up is here :) Meet new friends both natives and non natives of the Stans and have some great native stan cuisine while making new acquaintances! can't wait to meet everyone who couldn't make it to our first round of meet up!
results.how_to_find_us: text or ask for Hadar/Hajar who is organizing the meet up.

group.name: TajikiUzbekiKyrgz Lovers! interested or from the STANS

results.description:
Bring a piece to workshop, up to 1500 words, any genre OK, including query letters etc. Make as many copies as the number of people coming to the meeting.


Note: If more than 8 people show up to this meeting, we may (or may not) divide the meeting into two groups to allow everybody enough time to present their piece and receive feedback.

Please arrive by 2pm because we try to begin promptly and finalize the decision to split into two tables at that time.
results.how_to_find_us: We are in a large booth in the back - not visible from the door.
results.name: New Providence Writers Meeting

results.description:
Join DM Noah Anderson in the third chapter of his Wildpig Exclusive RPG "Sailing Against the Wind"! A great game for both new and returning players of 6th Level.

The crew of the Salty Cormorant, now united by shared adversity, have arrived at the open-sea trading city of Stilt-Sands, but all is not as it seems. The colors of the Eye blanket the town, and terrible creatures prowl the piers, ignored by the populace. Join the erstwhile pirates and sailors as they attempt to discover and uproot the source of such horrors.
results.name: D&D 5E: The Eye Over the Stilt-Sands

results.description: Looking forward to seeing everyone on Sunday.
results.name: Pathfinder Rules/D&D World Campaign (Closed Group)

group.name: Astoria Queens Dungeons and Dragons/Call of Cthulhu Group

results.description:
Hello all, 
We will be meeting at the Spotted Owl this Sunday at 2 PM. If you are interested in networking and meeting local producers, come out! It's always a good time! All skill levels are welcome. Please email me at [masked] if you have any questions. Hope to see you on Sunday! 
-Steve

P.S. If you are going to join us, please be sure to purchase drink or food from The Spotted Owl since they are providing a welcoming space for us to talk music production!
results.name: Hanging Out With Local Producers

results.description:
All of NWU's members and friends are invited to our annual holiday party. This year we're thrilled to be partnering with the American Pushkin Society.

Come celebrate with us and hear about the new works by NWU members and short talks by our special guests, Marina Adamovich, the editor of the oldest Russian-language magazine “Novyi Zhournal” ("The New Review”) and Serguei Gollerbah, a Russian-American author and the Academician of the American National Academy of Design. (American actor Peter von Berg will read a short excerpt from Mr. Gollerbah’s book.)

Free event. RSVP required. Come enjoy Russian treats, refreshments, and much good cheer.

To learn more about the American Pushkin Society, visit http://www.americanpushkinsociety.com/. If you represent a local writers' group and would like to partner with the NWU for a future event, email [masked].
results.name: Annual Holiday Party

group.name: National Writers Union - New York Metropolitan Area

results.description:
This is a great venue for a meetup in my opinion. The karaoke rooms are comfortable and you can play all your favorite tunes. If you like to sing.... great. If you do not like to sing ....great. Where can you go and meet your friends in Mid town Manhattan - laugh, eat, drink, socialize - choose your own music - watch videos - and sing if you want to .....in a beautiful private room..... for 5 hours - for only $14.00. The answer is the Duet 53.

Even if you do not sing....If you enjoy music ...come on to the get together.  Bring food if you like.   (NO DRINKS).  This is a very relaxing  venue and a good venue for meeting others and making friends.  Duet 53 has food that you can purchase at modest prices and ALL DRINKS must be bought from them.....even water!
results.name: Musical Afternoon:  Sing-A-Long,  Sing Alone, Private Box Karaoke

results.description:
THIS BAND WAS VOTED ''2015 BEST LOCAL BAND'' BY MEETUP MEMBERS.

Join us as we watch and hear MEETUP's most popular band playing the sounds of fiber rock n' roll from the 60's, 70's, 80's while drinking and socializing with MEETUP members.

For more info. & watch you tube videos of this band, click below:

http://www.thekootz.com

http://www.facebook.com/thekootz

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****

Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 2:00. We typically start 20-30 minutes after 2:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
3DPrinterOS and Brooklyn Public Library will be sponsoring our next live class on the basics of 3D printing and how it's being used today at Brooklyn Central Public Library located at 10 Grand Army Plaza, Brooklyn, NY 11238.

This free meetup is ideally suited for someone who is brand new to 3D Printing, or someone more advanced who wants to have the chance to ask one on one questions about how the hardware, software and entire process works. All ages are welcome and encouraged to attend! 

The following topics will be covered at this meetup:

-What is 3D Printing and how does it work?

-How do we take an idea and turn it into a physical object?

One on one training and an open Q & A session on 3D Printing will also be provided. No materials or prior knowledge if necessary for this class. 

In addition, we have set the RSVP limit at 60 for this class as we have gone over capacity in the past. If you reach this limit please add yourself to the waiting list as people sometimes cancel at the last minute. Please feel free to reach out to us directly if you have any questions and we will be more that happy to oblige.

We will also be providing holiday themed 3D prints for everyone to take home, first come first serve! 

Happy printing! 

-

Aaron and Charles

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

During this meetup... we will be going through the main qualities of Socially Intelligent People.

Being Socially Intelligent makes a huge difference in everything from social situations to your dating life to your business or job.


People love others who are socially intelligent for seemingly no reason. It's almost hard to put your finger on it. "Why does everyone love Sam? What does she have that other people don't have? She gets along with everyone, she always gets invited to parties and everyone likes her. Even the boss, who doesn't like anyone!" This is what we will be going through during this seminar.


Join us and bring a friend. See all of you soon!

3:00- 3:45 we will write from a prompt provided by the organizer or one of the attending members.


Part 2:  

3:50 - 5:50 is dedicated time for free writing. Work on whatever you want.  We'd hope that work generated during these sessions will be submitted to any of the other Meetups or for broadcast on our podcast, Kaleidocast.

results.description:
It's the season for holiday treats, and that goes for GF folks too! 

Celiac (or being gluten free in general) can be awesome for resisting all the baked goods this time of year, but I do still love cookies (and good company and holiday cheer!). And sometimes I pass by a tray of cookies and fudge and cakes and treats and find myself feeling like...

So inspired by the lovely Cookie Swap Molly who hosted a couple of years ago, I'll be hosting a cookie party at my at my apartment! Here's your chance to try out that new recipe you've been eyeing, or bake up a batch of an old favorite you'd love to show off, and to sample everyone else's creations. I'll also provide some festive drinks (potentially involving cider, cocoa, and/or mulled wine - let me know if you have requests!), and baking up some treats of my own to share!

Please bring at least 2 dozen cookies (or other treats!) and a container for leftovers - that way everyone can go home with plenty of leftovers! 

Also, to make sure everyone has the information they need to feel comfortable choosing what to eat, I'll also have label cards, so please come prepared to note if your kitchen is totally GF or shared, and if the recipe contains any allergens (nuts, eggs, dairy, etc). Even better, share your recipe! 


In that spirit, I'll note that my apartment is not 100% gluten free, but my kitchen nearly is (I have a non-GF roommate who does not cook, but keeps some snacks and takeout around). Please feel free to reach out if you have any concerns about that - I'm a very cautious person when it comes to gluten so I completely understand!

My apartment is located off Franklin Ave in Prospect Heights/Crown Heights Brooklyn. For those not familiar with Brooklyn, it's about 20 minutes past Bowling Green on the 4/5. It's also convenient to the 2, 3, C, and Q trains. I'll send out my address to those who RSVP!
results.name: Holiday Cookie Swap Party!

results.description:
This is a weekly introductory improv class taught Sundays from 3:30-6pm.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking?

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers?

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life.

This class is $10.  If money is an issue for you, let me know and we can work something out.  The cost goes to pay for the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.

Hope to see you there!

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater. He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description:
Are you interested in deepening your yoga practice?
Do you want to learn a way to practice yoga when you can't do physical asana?

Then consider adding mantra and meditation to your yoga practice!

In this group practice you will learn the meditation practice outlined in "The Yoga Sutras of Pantajali", often referred to as the path of Raja Yoga. You will also learn the two most powerful mantras, the Gayatri and Maha Mrtyunjaya. The combination of mantra and meditation clears the nadis, chakras, and karmic knots which aids in the development of clarity of mind and deepens spiritual awareness.

Please join us on Sunday December 20th @ 3:45-5:30pm. No prior experience is needed. All levels are welcome from complete beginner to advanced practiioners.
If you have a copy of "The Yoga Sutras of Pantajali" with commentary by Swami Satchidananda, please bring it with you.

This class will be free through the end of the year for the holiday season and will be repeated in December (date TBD). We will be accepting monetary donations for City Harvest and winter coats for the NY Cares Coat Drive.

Nadine Boles is a yoga practitioner/teacher and Reiki Master Teacher who holds certifications in Raja Yoga, Meditation Teaching, and Gentle Yoga from the Integral Yoga Institute of NY.

This is a class in technique although, when you've conquered a song technically, then I will coach musicality and performance. Class size is limited. Fee is $20/per. You may audit the class once for $10. Let me know when you sign up if that's your intention.

Room assignment will be printed on the electronic billboard opposite the elevators on floor 16.

People at the front desk are helpful and friendly and the Cafe on the floor has great latte and cookies, sandwiches, <a>pizza</a>, etc.

I've been asked to post this:


Dear Members:  I am Mr. Harrington's agent/rep. Mr. Harrington teaches privately coaching established actors and singers. For years his private rate has been $120/hr for this service. He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. This demands tight scheduling of both his time and the room rental with Ripley-Grier Studios.For these reasons, I will be insisting to him that "no shows" be dropped from the group. The policy is this: If you RSVP you better show up. If you cancel you better do this by 4:00 pm the previous day.A word to the wise...Michael T. Harvey

Please note change of date. Prior to meeting please message with me with vocabulary you would like to discuss: 

Please review Hegel glossary at http://www.london.ac.uk/fileadmin/documents/students/philosophy/ba_course_materials/ba_19thc_hegel_glossary_01.pdf

Please note the link for Kojeve shown here worked As of February 10, 2015.


Please note that we are going to meet at a new salad place, Fresh & Company, 58 East 8th Street,  across the street from our usual place. This actually the location where we met for years when it was Au Bon Pain.

We are accommodating members who are joining late with reviews as needed of previous material We took a look at Sense Certainty last week. Suggest a review of Perception for the next meeting.

We should refer as always to the appropriate Bernstein tapes. Finally, in the Introduction to the Reading of Hegel: Lectures on the Phenomenology of Spirit by Alexandre Kojève, Raymond Queneau, Allan Bloom and James H. Nichols (Oct 31, 1980) we should read Chapter 5.


Note new resource:

Kojeve available used on Amazon for $9.94 plus shipping or free online PDF at: http://www.scribd.com/doc/36163876/Alexandre-Kojeve-Introduction-to-the-Reading-of-Hegel

Included here for review is the glossary available online:

http://www.london.ac.uk/fileadmin/documents/students/philosophy/ba_course_materials/ba_19thc_hegel_glossary_01.pdf


For those new to the group we are delighted that you are joining us. Please review the beginning of the Hegel text: A. Consciousness, I. Sense certainty with attention to Hegel's process and derivation of the universal.

results.description:
TOEFL/TOEIC Workshop・TOEFL/TOEIC対策の講座


What's going on?

JCAG offers TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) and TOEIC (Test of English for International Communication) workshops for all of you interested in preparing for the tests. The TOEFL tests and measures the ability to use English at the university level, and the TOEIC tests and measures the ability to use English in an international business environment.


(Details)


- TOEIC sessions are held once a month on the first Sunday, and the remaining Sundays are devoted to the TOEFL. This week, we are focusing on the speaking portion of the TOEFL test.


- The lessons focus on all the aspects of the tests (reading, writing, listening, and speaking) as well as other aspects such as pronunciation and composition ability in a focused yet fun and productive environment.

When & Where:

Date: Every other Sunday from 4:30pm-7:00pm

Location: Atrium at Citigroup Center
153 East 53rd Street (53rd Street and Lexington Avenue)
New York, NY 10022

Cost: These sessions are free of charge, but there is a suggested donation of $5 that will help to cover the cost of the printing materials.

To RSVP, email us at:　 [masked]


If you have any questions, please feel free to email us.

We look forward to seeing you soon!

 ****NOTE*****

1.) This event is run by JCAG organizers who are following a lesson plan that is prepared in advance, so we ask that native English speakers be aware of this when participating. 

2.) Due to the fact that the organizers dedicating their time to help with the event, we ask that people be considerate in terms of the time. Sessions will be cancelled in the event that students do not show up within 40 minutes of the start time.

皆様、

多くの方々のご希望や期待に応じて、我々JCAGはいよいよTOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language)・TOEIC (Test of English for International Communication) 対策の講座を開催致します。TOEFLは、英語圏の高等教育機関が入学希望者の外国語としての英語力を判定するための試験で、TOEICは英語によるコミュニケーション能力を検定するための試験です。


(内容)
レッスンはテスト(読解、ライティング、聴解、会話)に基づき集中したものになります。
又は発音、作文の強化等にも集中し、楽しみながら、効率的な環境でテストに励めるように指導致します。


日時と場所:


日時:日曜日の午後4時半～7時 (二週間ごとに二時間単位で行います)

場所: Atrium at Citigroup Center
153 East 53rd Street (53rd Street and Lexington Avenue)
New York, NY 10022

費用: イベントのご参加は無料ですが教材の出費を緩和致しますため、$5の推奨ドネーション額をお支払い下さい。

ご予約は以下まで: （予約なしでもご参加ＯＫです）
[masked]

ご質問のある方はメールまでお問い合わせください。

皆様のお越しをお待ちしております。

results.description:
I'm a big independent film fan, and if you've had trouble getting friends to join you for some obscure & subtitled film, I can relate. Here's my pick for the 1st film in our (hopefully) lengthy indie film series: http://filmforum.org/film/son-of-saul-film

Winner of the Grand Prize at the 2015 Cannes Film Festival, this acclaimed Hungarian drama, set in Auschwitz, is directed and co-written by László Nemes and stars Géza Röhrig as a member of the camp’s Sonderkommando unit (Jewish prisoners who were forced to lead fellow victims to the gas chambers). The film has been lauded for finding a shattering new visual and aural vocabulary for a subject that is excruciatingly visceral, yet so well-covered by other filmmaking ventures that audiences may assume, incorrectly, they’ve “already been there.” Critics in Cannes hailed the film as “galvanizing,” “strikingly formalist,” and “a powerful aural and visual experience.”

Presented with generous support from the Joan S. Constantiner Fund for Jewish and Holocaust Film HUNGARY • 2015 • 107 MINS. • IN HUNGARIAN, GERMAN, AND YIDDISH WITH ENGLISH SUBTITLES •

The showtime is Sunday, December 20th, @ 5:10 pm. I'll be out front (and likely on the lengthy line) by 4:30pm. I strongly urge you to buy your tickets in advance, due to all the Oscar buzz surrounding this film: http://boxoffice.printtixusa.com/filmforum/advance?v=2454&i=17206. If you wait until the day of, you will likely not get a ticket. Coffee or wine venue will be chosen for post-film discussion. I'll message confirmed members my phone number on the day of the meetup.

See you there!
results.name: Indie Film Series: 'Son of Saul' @ the Film Forum

results.description:
This meetup is to invite you to just read this article online, which is from Fr. Marina at Church of St. Francis Xavier and I really like this writing when I first read it. It sounds more like a conversation between friends than a preaching. So I think .. perhaps, you would like it too, especially at the time close to the end of the year ... Signing up means you've read it here. Thanks.

~~

Dear Friends in Christ, In January of 1996, a modern interpretation of Giacomo Puccini’s La Boheme opened off Broadway. The show, called Rent, enjoyed a successful 12-year run and many of the songs of its score still play on in the minds of its fans. One of Rent’s more popular tunes, entitled “Seasons of Love,” asks a simple yet provocative question: How do you measure a year? The lyrics go on to suggest a few ways: You can measure a year “in daylights, in sunsets, in cups of coffee.” In the next stanza, some other possibilities: “In inches, in miles, in laughter, in strife.” Finally, the song finds its way to the best possible means of measurement: Love. You can measure a year in love; by the way you love and were loved; and to the degree that you held love above every other gift and virtue. Who can possibly argue with that?


And so we, as a church (within a wider Church) within a world, begin a very special year that we would be wise to measure well --the Jubilee Year of Mercy. It was first announced by His Holiness Pope Francis in April 2015 in his letter Misericordiae Vultus. These Latin words mean “the face of mercy” and they are defined in the very first sentence of the Holy Father’s letter: “Jesus Christ is the face of the Father’s mercy.” The pope’s letter is stunningly beautiful. It’s over 9,000 words long and yet this first sentence seems to be more than enough: “Jesus Christ is the face of the Father’s mercy.” Francis could have stopped right there!

What does it mean to engage and celebrate a year of mercy? Well, we’re about to find out. On Monday, nine of my Jesuit brothers will make themselves available for what we affectionately call the “Confessions Marathon”, when we take our places in the church twice per year to be humbled once again by the holiness of people who approach us so sheepishly, seeking God’s mercy through the sacrament of Reconciliation. They seem so unaware of how much they teach us about mercy and yet these penitents always do more for the priests than we do for them.

Our website has been loaded with spiritual resources received from the Vatican and the Archdiocese of New York. His Eminence Cardinal Dolan recently sent us a beautiful banner that now hangs in the corridor between our lobby and the Mary Chapel. This thoughtful gift was accompanied by an Advent card wishing all of us a blessed Advent, a happy Christmas, and a year of mercy and grace. Please pray for our Cardinal. He has one of the toughest jobs in the world and is working very hard at it.

We will continue to share guidance from His Eminence and Pope Francis regarding the Year of Mercy. Also, I have asked our priests and all of our parish ministries to pay special attention to the theme of mercy and how it can be incorporated into homilies, meetings, communications, and activities. Early responses from Family Faith, Bible Study, Music, LGBT Ministries, and others are impressive. We have a year to dive deep and I suggest we maximize it as creatively as we can! Because, as Francis reminds us, “mercy is the very foundation of the Church’s life. All of her pastoral activity should be caught up in the tenderness she makes present to believers; nothing in her preaching and in her witness to the world can be lacking in mercy. The Church’s very credibility is seen in how she shows merciful and compassionate love.”

But, as we know so well, the effects of God’s mercy will go only as far as our hearts allow. A word so beautiful as mercy will be totally empty unless we choose to forgive, from our hearts, those who have hurt us and who wait to be forgiven. And, lest we be misled, mercy is most certainly a choice that we make with the help of God’s grace. We decide to forgive or we decide to hold on to our anger. This is true for bishops as much as it is for neophytes. So let’s plunge ourselves into the depths of God’s mercy as this most sacred year begins. So much can happen within a year! How can we possibly measure it? Let’s measure it in love…and in mercy!

results.name: How Do You Measure A Year?

results.description:
A few of us attended a meetup at Governor's Island back in September, where we tried Senegalese food from a street vendor and we all liked it!

One of the students I've tutored told me she works at a new Senegalese restaurant that opened in Harlem, and I thought it would be nice to try (no, we will not be getting a special discount).

Senegalese food is not something many of us had had before - I don't think it's too "weird" either. They have some familiar things like rice chicken, and if you love peanuts and spices, you'll probably enjoy this food.

It's a long subway ride for many, but if it makes you feel better, the restaurant is less than a bock from the train station and there's a Levain Bakery a block away.

Whoever wants to can come at 4pm and we'll explore the neighborhood a bit and walk around until 5pm. Harlem is a neighborhood I've always wanted to explore, but I never get the chance to go since it is so far away.

http://www.yelp.com/biz/pikine-senegalese-restaurant-new-york


http://www.levainbakery.com

results.description:
Hi, Everyone!

This weekend, the force isn't the only thing awakening. Each year, the holiday season brings with it fear and anxiety about the February LSAT. But Master Yoda told us that fear is the way of the dark side! Fear leads to anger. Anger leads to hate. Hate leads to suffering. 

Don't suffer under the wicked thumb of the imperial LSAC! Instead join our merry band of rebels and fight back! Prep with us this Sunday at 6pm on the Upper East Side. We'll be discussing formal logic and the logical reasoning sections from PrepTests 70 - 73 (We will send attachments on Friday). As always, feel free to also bring your own questions and insights! This will be a great way to dive into both formal logic basics as well as some of the trickier manifestations of formal logic on the LSAT. 

In addition, we'll probably have some great deals to offer attendees, including discounts on video lessons (brought to you by alphascore.com), free webinars (brought to you by lsatguys.com) and more!

Hope to see all of you soon! Happy holidays!

Sincerely,

The New York LSAT Meetup Team

results.description:
Celebrate and bring - yourself most of all! - a gift, a bit of food, a gift of performance to our Neolyth celebration of Winter Solstice.

When the nights are long and dark, a communal hearth fire, even as the symbolic candle in the center of a room, can become the experience of sharing the hearts' fire and fuel our feelings of hope and faith in Life.

Bring food such as seasonal cookies, winter pantry items - preserves, aged cheese, dried fruit and nuts. We'll provide hot cider and tea.

Bring gifts. Best gifts are home-made, so maybe it's something you've created as arts and crafts, from sewing to woodworking... You can look around your life and see what is a gift already and now calling to be set free and given away with Love… Maybe it's a poem, maybe it's a song - a performance or a hand-written text to uplift and inspire - can serve as great a gift.

A few words about such celebration from Mother Earth Living by Deena Wade (www.motherearthliving.com)

"Perhaps this year, with some preparation and planning, we can plant the seeds for a more intuitive, simpler, and natural holiday season. Winter solstice, which takes place in late December, can be a profound way to tune into the magic and beauty of the season. For people throughout the ages—from the ancient Egyptians and Celts to the Hopi—midwinter has been a significant time of ritual, reflection, and renewal. Creating a meaningful celebration of winter solstice, either in place of or in addition to other holiday activities, can help us cultivate a deeper connection to nature and family and all the things that matter most to us. Winter can become a time of feeding the spirit and nurturing the soul, not just emptying our bank account and fraying our nerves.

Pre-Christmas celebrations While we don’t know how long people have been celebrating the solstice, we know that ancient cultures built huge stone structures designed to align perfectly with the sun at specific times, such as dawn or high noon. And some ancient peoples performed sacred rituals and made offerings when the sun dipped below the horizon to ensure its daily return, especially during the darkest days.

Many of the traditions now associated with Christmas are believed to have originated centuries earlier with nature-based communities and indigenous peoples. For example, the idea of Santa Claus may have come from the story of the first shamans who were said to climb high into the upper worlds and return with gifts of wisdom and prophecies, postulates Tony Van Renterghem in When Santa Was a Shaman (Llewellyn, 1995). The word “yule” may derive from an Anglo-Saxon term that means “wheel,” and in pagan Scandinavia, village people sat around bonfires of burning yule logs throughout the night while drinking mead and listening to the stories of minstrel-poets.

Richard Heinberg, author of Celebrate the Solstice: Honoring the Earth’s Seasonal Rhythms through Festival and Ceremony (Quest Books, 1993) describes the solstices as “times of danger and opportunity; times for special alertness and aliveness.” In Iran, families often kept fires burning all night to assist the battle between the light and dark forces. In ancient Rome, where it was called Dies Natalis Invicti Solis, or the Birthday of the Unconquered Sun, masters even celebrated as equals with their slaves. Throughout history, celebrating the solstice has been a way to renew our connection with each other and with the numinous through acts of goodwill, special rituals, and heightened awareness."

results.description:
TRANSFORMATIONAL POETRY and Short Stories - Sunday at 7 pm


“The birds have vanished into the sky,

  and the last clouds  have drained away.

 We sit together, the Mountain and me,

 Until only the Mountain remains.”  Li Po  701_762 AD  (Chinese Poet)

We will read and discuss various Transformational Poems that Resonate and bring us to “Wonder, Mystery and Oneness”.  Among the poets we will explore are: Mary Oliver, Rumi, Ryokan, Li Po, Rilke, Basho, Antonia Machado, Hafiz, Lao Tzu, Chuang Tzu and many others. 

No previous experience is necessary.  If you have favorite poems, please bring their work with you to share. You could even bring your own poem, the more poems we have, the richer the experience will be.


TIMES 7:00 to 8:30 pm starting Sunday Dec 20th until Jan 17th. You can come to any session, they are not consecutive. We will start at 7:00 pm sharp, so please come at least by 6:45.

PLACE: All Souls Unitarian Church 80th Street and Lexington Avenue.

• These are one on one sessions held  via a private telephone conference line. You can call in from your home or office.

• You can choose the time and day of your session.

• We review your dating profile together over the phone during our private session.

Are you sending message & after message on OKCupid or Match and not getting any responses?

Here's what we're going to do:

You and I are going to take a tour of your online dating profile via phone. I'll tell you if there are any red flags or bad buzzwords that might be keeping someone from hitting that message button. We'll look at your profile text, your photos and any other details that you share. We'll review everything together, and I'll tell you what might be sending the wrong impression. Or I'll tell you everything is perfect and you don't need to change a thing!

After this session, you're going to have more control and can go back to those days when you'd get excited before a first date. Just pick a time slot and register.

results.description: We meet every Sunday night from 7:30-8:45 pm at South Mountain Yoga. We do a 20 minute guided meditation (usually one of Thich Nhat Hanh's), walking meditation, and a 20 minute silent sitting. Jean also picks a reading. At the end, there is time for sharing (optional) as a way to practicing listening and speaking about issues of mindfulness in our week, sittings, and daily lives. No experience is necessary.  There is a suggested donation of $10. Please try to arrive on time and refrain from wearing fragrances.  Cushions and folding chairs are available or you can bring your own. Please note: many sangha members attend the group without responding here on meetup.

results.description:
I want to thank everyone who came out for this, What a great show and an amazing meetup. Jay Pharaoh (from SNL) stopped by again which was a great fun surprise! And im happy everyone got to meet each other again meetups like this is the reason why we keep doing it. So this coming meetup is our last one for this year I hope all of you can make it, its a packed all star TV lineup as usual. For those of you who havent been to this, This is a special Meetup, we finally got a deal with Stand Up New York the hottest club in New York City to let us in free of charge and see comics like Amy Shumer, Godfrey, Kevin Brennan and top names, this is NOT an amateur show like alot of the meetups. I just ask that everyone who Rsvp's really do their best to show up AND MAKE IT ON TIME. as you know I dont charge for this meetup so come out see the hottest comedy show and maybe even make some new friends. this sundays line up includes the below.

Hosted by: Jonathan Randall, Joe List (Last comic standing, Comedy Central), Nick Griffin (Tonight Show), Carmen Lynch (Letterman), Chris DeStefano (MTV Guy Code), and Andrew Schultz (MTV Guy Code) and pretty much any comic you see on Comedy Central these days drops by and shows up on the lineup who knows who might drop by usually its Amy Shumer or Judah Friedlander or like last 2 weeks Jay Pharaoh.

I will be at the front end of the bar by the iphone charger as usual to meet with everyone and give you tickets for free admission and have everyone sit together so we can all share laughs. Try to be early the show starts at 8 and everyone sits at same table but i do this earlier so all of you can meet your fellow meetup members. This is a 2 show ticket, so if you show up for the 8 you can stay for the ten also which has a different but also comedy central lineup. Or if you would like to come for the 10 you can just say meetup at the door and they will point you to me.
results.name: Comedy Central at Stand Up NY Free, 2 drink min, Last meetup this year

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

Hope you are all well and enjoying the Fall.

I am offering an Energy Transmission on Sunday Nights at 10PM, especially for weight loss!

Good nutrition is the core, for good health and successful weight loss, and good energy nutrition is important as well.

This will help you to relax, recharge, replenish, and will help you with stress eating, cravings, and to keep focused, and to feel better about your body and yourself.

A special and delicious vitamin essence, will fill you up with good nutrition, which will help you fill up with the good stuff, therefore you will feel more satisfied with less food, and helps you to absorb the nutrients your body needs.

This will also relax and strengthen your adrenal glands, and help to revitalize all of your glands and organs.

I really hope you enjoy this gift, and if you have any questions  concerns, please let me know.

I will have this each and every Sunday at 10PM! And, in the comfort of your own home.

All you need to do is relax, and intend to receive the Weight Loss Energy Transmission from Jae.

It's that easy, and then you can just relax and enjoy! Do not worry about falling asleep, because the energies work great while you're sleeping. They will work even if you are distracted or if you forget.

Jae

This one workout will keep you amped up all week long. Seriously, give it a try and you will be hooked!


The exercises may change from week to week, but it is always a Tabata-style interval workout: 20 seconds of high intensity work followed by 10 seconds of rest. Then repeat! Exercises include sprints, burpees, squats, situps, box jumps, step ups, pushups, dips, and other “no-frills” exercises.

results.description:
Every week we will have a different prompt for our weekly photo project.  This week’s theme is Winter.

Each week beginning early Monday morning, you can begin uploading your photos to our meetup album for the week’s theme.  The group won’t actually meet for this event, it’s an individual online challenge for each of you to get your creative juices flowing, share photos in the group, comment and critique each other’s shots, and above all have fun. 

Albums will remain open, so you can upload photos any time after that Monday morning start time but you’ll get the most feedback during the initial week the theme is posted.  You also don’t have to restrict yourself to photos taken during that week for the theme, they can be from past shoots you have done or the weekly prompt can be used to motivate you to shoot something new. 

Please consider sharing your project photos with our other chapters on our Facebook group.

J-KURU

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.
results.name: Indie Coworking Space

results.description:
"It was deep it was soulful, it was techno, it was disco, a kaleidoscope of sounds, it was truly underground. It was an essential mix in the cloud where we could dance and sing out loud. It was New York, Ibiza and Miami all wrapped up into one. There were speakers the size of skyscrapers and the stars they flickered like strobes, and everybody loved everybody else...I must have went to house heaven, because nothing’s that divine."                                                       

—Roland Clark

That’s right, we’re calling on all our DJ's to contribute for our weekly radio shows broadcast www.soundboxonline.com. What better way to keep those decks moving and keeping them from stagnating by pooling the tracks that tickle your fancy and inspire you as a DJ.


A mix is a great way to showcase your talent, the tracks that get you bumping and the tracks that have inspired you on the path of DJ-ing. So think of the bedroom as your house of worship. Honor it, pay reverence to it and give us a damn good mix worthy of the pantheon of the DJ gods on Mt. Olympus. 


Some common ground rules to ensure a quality mix and ensure serious commitment:

•  House, deep-house, tech-house, techno, minimal, EDM or any other genre that fits into the house category.


• High quality mp3/wav 320kbps. 

• Record a 1 hour mix without peaks, in other words; no clipping!


• Transitions need to be well segued, near flawless

• Sample mix required to ensure DJ commitment and whether or not you make the cut for the radio show


• A great profile pic


So once you’ve ticked all these off the list, you’re on your way to getting your DJ mix broadcasted. We’re especially reaching out to our new and beginning DJ's looking to make their mark. Send us a link where we can download your mix. Also send us a picture, so we can add it to the visual in case your mix has been selected for the weekly broadcast. Looking forward to hearing some great mixes.


Ayelmer Veenstra --- LMR

A.D.G. 

~ pls. send the visual and the link to (download) your mix to: [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: http://tunein.com/radio/soundbox-radio-s154205
results.name: Send us your latest house set to contribute to our weekly radio show!

results.description:
Join other new mamas at these meetings tailored to moms of newborns up to 12 months old. We'll discuss the ups and downs of life with a newborn/baby -- all aspects of breastfeeding (successes and challenges), the realities of caring for a baby, navigating the new world of parenting, sleeping patterns (or lack thereof) for you and your baby, and much more. But most importantly, the hope is that you will meet other Rivertown/Westchester moms of babies who will become treasured new friends. This is a group for all new mamas, including second-timers and formula-feeding mamas. The group size varies from week to week, but it's typically 6-10 moms. Further information is available here:

http://www.rivertownmamas.com/groups.html

The group operates on a pay-what-you-wish model, and payment is made anonymously (unless paid by credit card). Suggested: $20 per meeting.
results.name: New moms' discussion group

results.description:
MoMA Presents: Simone Rapisarda Casanova's The Creation of Meaning

One of the most adventurous new filmmakers from Italy, Simone Rapisarda Casanova presents the MoMA weeklong theatrical run of his second documentary-fiction hybrid, winner of the 2014 Locarno Film Festival’s Best Emerging Director prize and a major discovery in the 2015 edition of New Directors/New Films. Though its title arcs toward grand philosophical inquiry, the stirring power of The Creation of Meaning lies in its intimacy of detail and wry political observation. Shot with a painterly Renaissance beauty in Tuscany’s remote Apennine mountains, where memories of Nazi massacres and partisan resistance remain vivid, the film centers on Pacifico Pieruccioni, an aging but defiant shepherd whose very livelihood and traditions are threatened by a New European reality of Berlusconi-caliber corruption (hilariously evoked in a profanity-laden radio-talk-show rant) and German land speculation.

For admissions and visitor information  click here: http://www.moma.org/visit/plan/index#filmticketing
Be advised that MoMA members can now reserve tickets 2 weeks in advance.
Everybody, members and not, can reserve a ticket online.

If there's interest let's discuss the film over coffee.  There are two Starbucks within walking distance.

IMPORTANT. READ CAREFULLY BEFORE YOU CHOOSE TO RSVP.

1. If you RSVP and DO NOT SHOW UP for TWO events, you will be REMOVED from this group.

2. If you RSVP and change your status to "not attending" AFTER THE RSVP HAS BEEN CLOSED, you will be marked as "no show".

3. We DO NOT WAIT for late people. If you are late, you will be marked as "no show"

4. If less than 5 people RSVP for this event, it MAY be cancelled. If it is cancelled meetup.com will automatically send you an email to inform you of the cancellation. Make sure your email preferences for this group allow for you to receive communications for "Changes to a Meetup I'm going to"
results.name: MoMA Presents: Simone Rapisarda Casanova's The Creation of Meaning

Join Robert Caplin at the Adorama Event Space with two LIVE back-to-back podcasts with Sacha Lecca and Michael Ip. They'll talk about the business of photography, their careers, share work, and much more! Join us in person or watch online at PhotoBrigade.com/LIVE!

Sacha Lecca is the Deputy Photo Editor at Rolling Stone magazine with over 20 years experience in magazine publishingstarting as a low-level photo researcher and moving up the ranks as a photo editor at Newsweek, CMP Media, and to his current senior photo editing position at Rolling Stone. ➟ http://instagram.com/sachalecca

Michael Ip is a freelance photographer and photo editor based in Barcelona. He was previously the Senior Photo Editor at Newsweek. He has also edited at the New York Daily News, ABC News, Daily Mail and Maxim. Nowadays he focuses on portraiture and fashion. He has an unhealthy obsession with cats, shoes and Leicas. ➟ MichaelIp.com

Biography:

http://www.adorama.com/alc/sites/default/files/styles/bio_image/public/PhotoBrigade_HEAD%5B1%5D.jpg?itok=bKADUApv

The Photo Brigade is an amazing blog and resource for freelance photographers that showcase the amazing work of their talented network of photographers through features, guest posts, gear reviews, and podcasts, on the business of photography.
results.name: Photo Brigade Podcasts with Sacha Lecca and Michael Ip

results.description:
Let's take up one or more of your business problems and discuss it with the group until you have a plan to proceed.

I recently picked up the book “Think and Grow Rich” and was surprised by how inspiring the book is even after 80 years. For the uninitiated, it’s Napoleon Hill’s philosophy of success that he spent 25 years developing based on Andrew Carnegie, Henry Ford and other successful people. Throughout the book he talks about creating a master mind group which is a council of people who can apply their minds to a business problem and come up with a plan of action. Since everyone has their strengths and weaknesses, this group will fill in the areas you, the startup owner, is deficient in with our combined expertise. At every meet up, we will take up one or more startup/business problems that you are facing and discuss it with the group until you have a plan to proceed.
results.name: Come up with a plan of action

group.name: Think and Grow Rich : Master Mind

results.description:
Here is our first chance to get together and talk about LeSS and its impact on organizational/system design and structure.  If you are in NYC on Oct. 21st, please join us and bring colleagues/friends.

I was given an unexpected opportunity to bring LeSS to light for this group on October 21st at another Agile event.
Please note that this is not LeSS-dedicated event. This is bigger, more general Agile panel discussion, with the panel being composed of agilists that come from different backgrounds and with different (potentially) focus. 

For details about the event and registration, please visit this page (attendance fee is not by LeSS meetup):
http://www.pminyc.org/content/what-does-being-agile-mean-you

Agenda: 
-The first hour is mini-presentations by the panelists and Q&A.
-The second hour: is break-out sessions. This is where I will be happy to take anyone interested into a deeper discussion on LeSS.

Agenda is audience driven! Come with more LeSS questions and you will get more LeSS answers :)..

Hope to see many of you there.
gene
results.name: LeSS Q&A, during Agile Panel Discussion (Dec 21st)

results.description:
Route to be determined that day.  This is a fast paced workout, less of a social event due to the cooler temps and darkness, therefore will be limited in size. Everyone goes on the waitlist. Please read the event in it's entirety and respond to the questions asked when you rsvp.

Make sure you have a copy of the map, a headlamp, and minimum 1 liter of water.  If you fall behind during the hike, you must be prepared to finish on your own. Faster hikers are not obligated to wait for slower hikers. You must feel comfortable hiking on your own should you fall behind. We would love to have everyone join but due to the nature of this event we can not make accommodations for those who are unable to hike independently. This is not mean, it is for your protection as well as the safety of the group. We will hike a minimum of 4 miles and 1200 EG. If you are unsure whether or not this is for you, please email me with any question.


Heavy rain may cancel and would be determined that day if necessary.

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike

results.description:
Come for the sheer joy of moving to the music, in a nurturing and supportive setting.

Whether you have never danced before or want to continue, this is a class for you.

The classes are one hour and half in length and provide quality instruction.

Ballet is one of the most healthy and intense forms of dance.
It can provide a complete full-body workout, increasing your flexibility, range of motion and strength.

It’s also a great alternative to aerobics.

The classes are on-going, join in anytime.

PRICES Walk-Ins: $20.
Package: $180 for a card of 10 classes (over a course of 6 months).
Talk to us about multiple class per week discount!

ABOUT THE INSTRUCTOR
Bruce Weitzmon is a choreographer, dancer and teacher. His work has been presented in the U.S.A. and Canada. Bruce was the director of the Theater Dance Center, a non-profit dance education and performance organization in Rockland County, founded in 1981. After many years directing TDC, he returned to New York City to teach. Now after more than 10 years there, he is returning to offer a weekly schedule of classes in Nyack, NY.

VISIT US ON FACEBOOK
For more about the Dancers’ Art class schedule, rates or any additional information please visit and like Dancers’ Art on Facebook at www.facebook.com/DancersArt or call[masked]-1973.

results.description:
This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will experience!  Whether, you are in business or looking to create a start-up or get funding for one, this is the event for you. This FREE event brings together entrepreneurs, decision-makers and investors to network and build new business relationships in a great venue. You will find many who are open to share information about their business and are willing to build a future business relationship with you!...Better than Facebook, Twitter and Linkedin!

Remember to bring plenty of business cards.

The Lexington Lounge at The Court Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere. The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

What: Interesting After Hour Networking Event
Hosts: Roger
Why: Establish new contacts and/or reconnect with old ones.
Cost: FREE admission
Atmosphere: The dress code is business casual. 

Cocktail Hour till 8 PM - Select Beer 6.00 - House Wine 7.00
   - Well Drinks 8.00 - 25% off Appetizers.


Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

THIS IS A MULTI GROUP EVENT. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A PORTION OF THOSE ACTUALLY ATTENDING. We look forward to see you networking with the best business professionals that New York City has to offer. We ask that you put your name and industry on the name tag that we will provide.

VOLUNTEERING: We will need extra hands. Anyone that would like to assist us with registration, please call or email me.  

SPAM: Please don't spam our members with your products/services or company name/website because your message will be deleted and you will be banned from this group


Want more business from events? If you are interested in sponsoring our groups or this event, please email me or go to http://businessonashoestring.com/sponsoring.htm 


Comments from past events: 

"For all those who couldn't make it you missed a great night! Lots of great conversation and lovely people to meet Thanks to Roger for his great organisation" - Julia Meyer 

"It was a great meetup, good mix of people and made plenty of new contacts, hope to attend again" - Berni Moestafa 

"Really enjoyed talking to the people I met. Good group. Very open. Welcoming. Will definitely come again!" - Fahd Ansari

"Thank you for hosting the wonderful meet up, I made a lot of new friends over there and I believe people attended are very much enjoy the conversations and the time. I can't wait to be part of the next event!" - Wei Zheng

“One of the most valuable evenings I have experienced in a very long time!” - Rob Friedman 

“Excellent. Diverse and welcoming group of people doing interesting things in the startup world. I look forward to future events” - Amanda

“Great group! Very interesting and diverse start-up biz people, a lot to learn from each other. Very positive experience - looking forward to upcoming events and lectures.” - A D 

“Really enjoyed the personalized yet structured atmosphere the organizers created. I thought this was the most useful meetup I've been to in the past couple months.” - Bill Katz 

"I got a new client, plus I really enjoyed meeting many of you. Thank you!" -Thomas Kant 

============================== 
This event is organized by Roger Kuperways 

Our family of small business groups have over 7,200 members, inside and outside meetup, and still growing! http://www.businessonashoestring.com

results.description:
Dear friends,

Thank you for making our weekly Social Monday's a great success.

Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to socialize, and make new friends.

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members: you guys rock! Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes.

Come and get rewards by:


1. Dressing super nicely

2. Playing our games

None of which are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH MONDAY'S/SOCIAL MONDAY'S/ (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last events

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

<a href="https://www.facebook.com/RendezVousnyc"></a>

We look forward to meeting you.

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will experience!  Whether, you are in business or looking to create a start-up or get funding for one, this is the event for you. This FREE event brings together entrepreneurs, decision-makers and investors to network and build new business relationships in a great venue. You will find many who are open to share information about their business and are willing to build a future business relationship with you!...Better than Facebook, Twitter and Linkedin!

Remember to bring plenty of business cards.

The Lexington Lounge at The Court Hotel in the heart of midtown, you will be able to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere. 

What: Interesting After Hour Networking Event
Host: Roger
Why: Establish new contacts and/or reconnect with old ones.
Cost: FREE admission
Atmosphere: The dress code is business casual. 

Remember this is a FREE event, there is a one drink suggested minimum, because the venue is turning away other business to allow us to host our event. 


Cocktail Hour till 8 PM - Select Beer 6.00 - House Wine 7.00
   - Well Drinks 8.00 - 25% off Appetizers.


Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

THIS IS A MULTI GROUP EVENT. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A PORTION OF THOSE ACTUALLY ATTENDING. 

We look forward to see you networking with the best business professionals that New York City has to offer. 

We ask that you put your name and industry on the name tag that we will provide.

VOLUNTEERING: We will need extra hands. Anyone that would like to assist us with registration, please call or email me. 

SPAM: Please don't spam our members with your products/services or company name/website because your message will be deleted and you will be banned from this group.

Want more business from events? If you are interested in sponsoring our groups or this event, please email me or go to http://businessonashoestring.com/sponsoring.htm 


Comments from past events: 

"For all those who couldn't make it you missed a great night! Lots of great conversation and lovely people to meet Thanks to Roger for his great organisation" - Julia Meyer 

"It was a great meetup, good mix of people and made plenty of new contacts, hope to attend again" - Berni Moestafa 

"Really enjoyed talking to the people I met. Good group. Very open. Welcoming. Will definitely come again!" - Fahd Ansari

"Thank you for hosting the wonderful meet up, I made a lot of new friends over there and I believe people attended are very much enjoy the conversations and the time. I can't wait to be part of the next event!" - Wei Zheng

“One of the most valuable evenings I have experienced in a very long time!” - Rob Friedman 

“Excellent. Diverse and welcoming group of people doing interesting things in the startup world. I look forward to future events” - Amanda

“Great group! Very interesting and diverse start-up biz people, a lot to learn from each other. Very positive experience - looking forward to upcoming events and lectures.” - A D 

“Really enjoyed the personalized yet structured atmosphere the organizers created. I thought this was the most useful meetup I've been to in the past couple months.” - Bill Katz 

"I got a new client, plus I really enjoyed meeting many of you. Thank you!" -Thomas Kant 

This event is organized by Roger Kuperways 
Our family of small business groups have over 7,200 members, inside and outside meetup, and still growing! http://www.businessonashoestring.com

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

<a href="https://www.facebook.com/RendezVousnyc"></a>

Nyeek Drinks are our game nights at Amity Hall. They're pretty regular, but always check the listings before coming in case we have to cancel or change dates.

Most of the places we play at don't charge us a rental fee. So please keep in mind not to bring outside food or drink, to purchase something from the establishment and to be respectful of the space in general.

There is a game night special that runs from 5 PM to 11 PM for people playing games. In addition to $5.00 drafts on select beers it is also $10.00 for sliders, wings, chicken strips, nachos or traditional pizza. Please note that it $10.00 for the individual items, not for all five.
