results.description:
It's the end of the year and we wanted to throw one last Happy Hour before 2016. Come on out to our new dedicated indie coworking space at the AWS Pop-Up Loft for networking, food and drinks. We'll have games to play and prizes as well.

Games being demoed:

Watergate - iOS & Android
by Will Carlough

Description:
Like Pac-Man, if you had to control two Pac-Mans at the same time, and also about the Watergate scandal, but not really.


Neon Krieger - http://lionplex.net
by Dong Lee Yamato

Relive the arcade era! 

Select from 8 unique characters and brawl your way to victory in Neon Krieger Yamato - solo or with a friend! What happens when you mix a platformer, fighting game, and beat 'em up? Find out when you combine stylish combos, fast paced action, and twitch combat puzzles, presented in a pixel art cyberpunk world harkening to the days of 16 bit.

Liege - www.codagames.com/liege. 
by John Rhee

The game is a story driven, turn based tactical RPG with a simultaneous execution mechanic. More recent combat demo: https://youtu.be/XBH_32qKN4o
results.name: Game Dev Happy Hour Holiday Extravaganza

results.description:
JC Writers writing marathons are about setting loose your inner writer-athlete and really getting some words down. You’ll be amazed at how much you can get done when you leave the distractions of home and spend a few hours in the company of other writers pounding away at their novels, short stories, screenplays and other works. The ensuring endorphins of accomplishment and sense of community with other writers will make you feel like you just ran a marathon, minus the jello-legs and carb cravings!!

Note: There is free parking for Zeppelin Hall!!

On Monday, December 12st, please join us in Harlem as we welcome our special guests, for the last cryptoharlem of the year.

we will talk about some of the issues of the day. 

- - -

you are under surveillance right now! - data & goliath 

"WHISLEBLOWERS WELCOME"
presented by CRYPTOPARTY HARLEM

Thursday November 12,2015 · 5:45 PM* 
@ Creative Workspace (inside Harlem Business Alliance) 
275 Malcolm X Blvd. (aka Lenox Avenue )
NY, NY 10027
* we have a lot to cover so we will start promptly.

@cryptoharlem @cryptopartynyc @cryptoparty


OPEN TO ALL! NO PREVIOUS UNDERSTANDING OR KNOWLEDGE NEEDED & 

THANKS FOR TAKING THE TIME TO READ THIS!

Save the date! Bring your questions & thoughts. This month we will do our best to cover some of the security issues and hacker news of the day. We also will have a special guest (who will talk about their work).

#harlemcryptoparty

# I AM A PRO & WANT TO SPEAK, PRESENT, HELP OUT

security pros interested in helping out? volunteering? contact: 
geminiimatt[at}protonmail.com via secure email &/or otr 
pgp signature: 381A B2F[masked] B00C  467F 0B87 70AA[masked] 
pgp pubkey: <a href="http://pgp.mit.edu/pks/lookup?op=get&search=0x0B8770AA07046231"></a>http://pgp.mit.edu/pks/lookup?op=get&search=0x0B8770AA07046231 

# WHAT'S A CRYPTOPARTY ## ## ## ## 
Cryptoparty Harlem: 

Sorry no chips, dip, awesome music or drinks. Just food for your mind. Ever wonder how to stay private, safe, & secure in today's digital age? What is a cryptoparty anyway? A CryptoParty is free, public and fun. People bring their computers, mobile devices,  and a willingness to learn! In the time of the event, people will learn and teach how to use basic cryptography tools. Cryptoparties are decentralized global events that are organized to answer questions and instruct people on technology & privacy. Cryptoparties are always free to attend, public, commercially and politically non-aligned and absolutely against sexual harassment and discrimination.

There are no dumb questions, you do not need to know anything about this subject, nor do you even need to bring a computer or phone. However that will help you get the most of it. For more information see the global cryptoparty website:

<a href="https://www.cryptoparty.in/"></a>http://www.cryptoparty.in/

# WHERE ## ## ## ##

Creative Workspace @ HBA 
@CreativeWrkspce 
The #Harlem co-working space located at 
275 Lenox Avenue (also known as Malcom X Blvd) 
NY,NY 
10027

"Power to the Creatives!"

* always free $

closest train 2/3 to 125th Street Station

short wallk from A/B/C/D/ 125th Street Station

ok walk from 4/5/6 125th Street Station

# WHEN ## ## ## ##

Monday, December 21st, 2015 @ 5:45pm (-9pm)

# WHY ## ## ## ##

we will be available to answer, discuss, teach, and learn about secure mobile use, secure browsing (using tor), secure email (using gpg), and secure chat (using otr).  

# BUT WHY HARLEM?! ## ## ##

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EDq-OzMWQwg

 A lot of people don't know that back in December of 2013 NYC lauched The Harlem WiFi network (</a>http://harlemfreewifi.com/) rolled out by Sky-Packets ( <a href="http://www.sky-packets.com/muni-wifi/">http://www.sky-packets.com/muni-wifi/ ) it extends 95 city blocks, from 110th to 138th Streets between Frederick Douglass Boulevard and Madison Avenue making it at the time the largest continuous free outdoor public wireless network in the nation. The internet is literally all around us and free in Harlem! Throw in the fact that african americans over index on mobile phone usage (92% of African Americans own a cell phone, and 56% own a smartphone). So what better place to learn about using tech safely.

@geminiimatt has lived in harlem for over a decade and has seen it change for the good & bad. However one thing that has stayed the same is the high level of surveillance & scrutiny faced by residents.  ONLINE: Please read Ben Popper's examination of the fallout from NYPD's Operation Crew Cut ,  "How the NYPD is using social media to put Harlem teens behind bars" (http://www.theverge.com/2014/12/10/7341077/nypd-harlem-crews-social-media-rikers-prison) , ON THE CORNER: Via official nypd cctv surveillance cameras & private owned cameras & FROM UP ABOVE: via SkyWatch tactical platform units and shotspotter (</a>https://www.aclu.org/blog/free-future/shotspotter-ceo-answers-questions-gunshot-detectors-cities), gunshot detection devices. 

WHO: 
===== 
a random assortment of decentralized volunteers and organizers.

# EXTRA CREDIT ## ## ## ##
OR

# IF YOU CAN"T MAKE IT, YOU CAN CHECK THESE OUT ######

5) READ... THIS WELL WRITTEN "PLAIN ENGLISH" ARTICLE on secure communication. <a href="https://firstlook.org/theintercept/2015/07/14/communicating-secret-watched/">https://firstlook.org/theintercept/2015/07/14/communicating-secret-watched/

TWO FACTOR AUTHENTICATION: 
</a>https://twofactorauth.org/
the above link takes you to a list of sites that use 2-step verification.  2-step verification uses your name, password, but then another unknown to piece of info to log in. It can be provided by a hardware token, a texted code or via apps like Google Authenticator, Authy, etc. you can also use the site to help by requesting groups start using 2-step verification.

results.description:
Come learn computer aided design and 3D printing techniques while making your own custom cell phone case, keychain, charm, jewelry or small trinket.   In this course we will cover the basic functions of TinkerCAD, a free online CAD program that you can use from anywhere to design your minds imagination. Depending on time you will go home with your 3D printed project as well. This class is for any beginners all the way up to advanced. 

Please bring you personal laptop if possible with a USB mouse as well. Don't forget your AC adapter to charge it as well.

*Participants will need an email address to register for TinkerCAD.

*The cost of this course is $25 and will be collected at the Door.

Basic computer skills recommended, ages 10 and up

Take a look at Thingiverse for some ideas before the class. http://www.thingiverse.com/
results.how_to_find_us: We are located in the Adult and Continuing Education building. The Makerspace is located to the right of the main building (towards Boston Market)
results.name: 3D Printing with TinkerCAD   (Easy, Computer Aided Design software for all ages)

results.description:
Hey Meeples!  This Meetup on December 21 will be our annual holiday party. 

First, we will hold our annual Dirty Santa grab bag and gift swap.  If you want to participate, please bring a wrapped boardgame related gift costing approximately $20-$25 to this meet up.  You can find the rules here: http://dirtysantarules.blogspot.com/

Also, I will ask Scotty's  to provide an appetizer platter for the group, paying out of the group's funds.  If you'd like to chip in for this, please consider a contribution to the group. Thanks to everyone who's contributed so far.

Please RSVP for this meet up, so I know how much food to order.

Our weekly Meet Up will take place at Scotty's Steakhouse and Comedy Cove in Springfield, just a bit off of exit 9B on Route 24! The address is 595 Morris Ave, Springfield.


There is a world of gaming outside of the traditional Monopoly, Scrabble, Risk, etc. Whether you're looking for something new and different, or you're a seasoned gamer, you'll find a friendly and welcoming bunch of friends to game with.  Be adventurous , come learn some new games or play your favorites!

We begin gathering around 6:30 pm and are fully underway by 7pm.

Because the event takes place at a restaurant that serves alcohol, there are strict rules against gambling of any form.  Guests under 21 are welcome, as it is a restaurant. Since they are letting us use the space for free, they expect that we will order food and drink, so there are some rules:

1.  No outside food or drink, not even bottled water.

2. Please plan on ordering food and/or drinks.  Support the venue.

3. Tip the waitstaff generously.  15% is standard, but 20% is even better. We want them to love having us there, and in this case, money does buy you love.


4. If you plan on attending regularly, please consider a small contribution to cover The Tipsy Meeple's costs for using Meetup.

We bring some of our games, but feel free to bring your favorites, or learn one of ours! And don't be shy about learning new games, we are more than willing to teach a new player! Can't wait to see you there.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be around the corner from the bar!

results.description:
There is plenty of hype surrounding "reactive programming" these days and with hype comes confusion. Wikipedia reflects a dated definition that talks about UI and networking code. The reactive manifesto is more relevant but it reflects the end goal and not how to get there.

The goal of this talk is to provide a no-nonsense introduction to the world of reactive programming for Java web developers. After the talk you should understand what reactive programming is, what tools you might use as a programmer, and what it means for existing Servlet-based applications.
results.name: Reactive Programming for Java Developers

results.description:
If you are new to Entity Framework, Microsoft’s framework for integrating data access into your .NET applications, this is the place to start. You will gain an understanding of what EF is for, how it works, where it belongs in your software architecture, and how to get it there. You’ll gain hands on experience with the basics of using EF from designing a simple model to interacting with that to persist data from your application. In addition to getting developers started with EF and prepared to learn and take advantage of more advanced techniques, this course will provide managers with the info they need to help them with decision making when planning a development stack. We’ll be using Visual Studio 2015 and .NET 4.6 for demos.

About the Author:  Julie Lerman has been programming and mentoring other developers for over 25 years and brings a wealth of experience and knowledge to share with Pluralsight subscribers. She is the leading independent authority on the Entity Framework and has been using and teaching EF since its inception. You may be familiar with her highly acclaimed series of "Programming Entity Framework" books, including the Code First and DbContext editions. Julie is well known in the .NET community as a Microsoft MVP, ASPInsider, and conference speaker around the world and she has authored the monthly MSDN Magazine Data Points column since 2010. Pluralsight brought Julie on as an author in 2010, and since then she has created many courses on Entity Framework as well as introductory courses on Domain-Driven Design and Unit Testing.

Julie lives in Vermont where she has run the Vermont.NET User Group since 2002. You can follow Julie's blog and other industry activities at thedatafarm.com and keep track of her every thought on twitter at @julielerman.
results.name: Getting Started with Entity Framework 6 Week 2 of 3

results.description:
NOTE: This will be an extra-special, small personal tour with Frank DiPrisco, Executive Director of the Winter Village at Bryant Park. We will take our time, see the whole park, and hang out with Frank and each other. And, I have even heard there may be free goodies for us. Only those who are on the regular RSVP list may attend. If you are still on the waiting list when the tour starts, you may not attend. This was specifically planned as a very small tour.


I may be somewhat partial, however, there’s no place like New York City during the holiday season. During this annual festive period, the streets and shops are buzzing, the iceskating rinks are filled with figure eights, arabesques and camel spins, while onlookers cozy together sipping on hot chocolate or mulled hot apple cider.

At Bryant Park you may witness such events and perhaps even partake in them. The park is set up like a fairytale winter wonderland, with a sparkling tree, a delightful skating rink, beautiful holiday decorations everywhere, and holiday, artist and food vendors in charming kiosks throughout the park -- these do beautifully add to the holiday spirit of the place, you will see (while you are sipping on your hot apple cider with cinnamon stick). 

MOREOVER, AS IF ALL THAT WEREN'T ENOUGH, BRYANT PARK IS -- AMAZINGLY -- A *VEGAN* WONDERLAND. HERE'S WHAT YOU'LL SEE. (AND WHERE YOU WILL EAT!): One 100% Vegan food vendor (Chimney Cakes), right next to another 100% Vegan food vendor (Pickle Me Pete), which is a few feet away from another 100% Vegan food vendor (Marty's V-Burger). Across the way is another 100% Vegan food vendor (Lucky Sailor), which is right next to another 100% Vegan food vendor (Soup for the Soul). Nearby is This Pie is Nuts (delicious 100% Vegan pies from the amazing Diana Cornell). Near This Pie is Nuts is a delightful newcomer: Kaleidoscope - they are 100% Vegan! Across the park is Vegushi -- 100% Vegan sushi! Right next to Vegushi is one of my longtime favorites -- Big Apple Cider: hot apple cider, with or without a cinnamon stick -- I say with! -- which is also of course 100% Vegan!

Then there is 100% Vegan newcomer Super Mac + Cheez, which is right next to Saj Mahal (100% Vegan). And finally, there is the 100% Vegan newcomer Vedge. All together Bryant Park features twelve 100% Vegan food vendors, along with other food vendors that have vegan options!

Is this the future of the world? Yes, it is!! But how did it happen in 2015? Two words: Frank DiPrisco!

Frank DiPrisco is Executive Director, and one of the owners, of the company that organizes the Winter Village at Bryant Park. He is a vegan. And he loves welcoming vegan businesses to Bryant Park!

Frank is my new hero. Over 100 of the the 127 vendors at Bryant Park are 100% vegan. (This also includes vendors who sell merchandise rather than food.)

Frank will actually be leading us on an eating and shopping tour of Bryant Park! He is thrilled and very pleased to be doing this for us. I say: Thank you one million times Frank, for what you are doing to help the animals, for what you are doing to improve New York, and for what you are doing by expanding all of our minds: giving us a glimpse of a vegan future yet to come!

Where To Meet: We will meet at 6:30pm right on the corner of 42nd Street and 6th Ave (the Bryant Park corner of this street intersection). I (David Greene) am 6' 4" will be holding a sign that says "MEETUP". We'll be waiting on the corner till just 6:45pm, so don't be late! At 6:45pm we will enter the park and will be given a vegan eating and shopping tour by Frank DiPrisco, Executive Director of the Winter Village at Bryant Park!

I am so looking forward to this beautiful holiday evening. Come join us.

David

P.S. I am beyond thrilled that our close friend Marty Krutolow, a veg meetup member and a vegan activist, is coming to be a vegan vendor at Bryant Park for the first time this year! Marty has already been enjoying tremendous success with his Marty's Vegan Fast Food featuring Marty's V-Burgers. They are out-of-this-world delicious. Marty, we are all so delighted at your success, and I am looking forward to getting your burgers at Bryant Park all season long!


David
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet at 6:30pm right on the corner of 42nd Street and 6th Ave (the Bryant Park corner of this street intersection). I (David Greene)  will be holding a sign that says "MEETUP". At 6:45pm our tour will start - don't be late!
results.name: Bryant Park-A Vegan Heaven - Small Personal Tour w/Exec. Director Frank DiPrisco

Hi everyone,
Our friends at Perdition have reached out to ask us to participate in a fun event/fundraiser a few days before Christmas with some other groups.

The fundraiser will be for Ali Forney Center. There will be some beer related prizes and some other items you can buy raffle tickets for. If you have something of value you'd like to donate for the raffle, let me know. I know we have some generous folks in the group who have donated things in the past. Also, if you'd like to make a donation of needed goods to the Ali Forney center, gift cards from Old Navy, Starbucks and McDonalds are welcome and you can also visit their "wish list" page on Amazon. http://www.amazon.com/gp/registry/wishlist/QMLEI6NWOW47/ref=cm_wl_rlist_go_v/192-1964799-1426303?

Secondly, the bar will also have a "Re-Gift Extravaganza" where you can bring a gift that someone you that is unopened and not your style, and you can exchange it for something else, hopefully less horrible!

And to make it festive, please feel free to wear Santa hats or reindeer antlers or anything else that would make the evening jolly.

If you want to donate something to the raffle, let me know. Also, if you want to help with set up and coordination, let me know. Cheers

Bill
results.name: Let's drink beer, give gifts and raise some funds before Christmas!

results.description:
Living in a city where one is constantly ‘on’ and looking to do more and more, a workshop that will recharge you and open you up to tap into a practical way to refresh every day, so you can do more of the things you love doing.

Each one of us possesses the ability to calm the mind and recharge the body within minutes. The secret lies in the breath. 

This 90 min workshop is an introduction to the Art of Living Happiness Program.  We will explore breath and meditation as well as other tools which are taught on the Happiness Program. 

When: Mondays 6:30pm-7:45pm.  Please arrive early for seating and registration

No need to bring anything but yourself – Yoga mats, water, back-jacks, pillows and blankets are all supplied at the center.

No fees for Newbees

Repeater fee-$10(Cash only)

results.description:
Free swag, fun-drinks, junk food and more!

Tenaya Hurst, Education Accounts Manager for Arduino.org and Linino.org

RSVP Now at http://www.meetup.com/robotic/events/226757281/

Join us for an exclusive meetup evening to see the best creations from a year of workshops, hackathons, and makerfaires.  Try the Rogue Making wearable tech activity Tenaya brings to every event and see what the excitement is all about. 

Tenaya's unique perspective comes from teaching students in workshops all over the U.S. (and Guatemala!) and also interacting with the adult IoT community at conferences and expos.  Whomever she reaches, she evangelizes for everyone to wear LEDs!  Just kidding, the idea is for people to have the chance to be makers at any age, which is character building, and gives those with the affinity for electronics and programming an opportunity to get started. 

We know it's Christmas week, but don't miss this rare cross-country visit from the LED queen!  Kids are welcome!

Tenaya Hurst, Education Accounts Manager for Arduino.org and Linino.org

Remember Ms. Frizzle from The Magic School Bus? Tenaya Hurst is kind of like that, but from California and super passionate about electricity and making!

Tenaya is a Rogue Maker.  From finding out about the Arduino microcontroller technology on March 16th 2013, she's taken off with the electronic fever of making.  Originally from Berkeley California, Tenaya attended Indiana University Bloomington obtaining a B.A. in theatre, geology, and anthropology as well as being awarded Phi Beta Kappa.  Many years of successful theatre and film work lead Tenaya to work for the Tech Museum of Innovation in San Jose where she first discovered Arduino and Make magazine.  At her first Makerfaire, Tenaya found a position as education accounts manager with Arduino.org and Linino.org microcontrollers for the Internet of Things.  She also created her own company, Rogue Making, to teach maker workshops in Wearable Technology and more!  Lastly, check out Tenaya’s music videos on Youtube, “I’m so Maker” “Happy Making” and “This Is How We Make”

RSVP at http://www.meetup.com/robotic/events/226757281/

Swag giveaway + food/drinks at 6:30pm
Power-Networking at 6:35pm 
Presentation starts at 6:40pm

You can save children from homelessness through the Techie Youth program! 
Please learn how you can save the life of a child at http://www.TechieYouth.org 
(saving child's life is very easy!)

RSVP: http://www.meetup.com/robotic/events/226757281/
results.name: Where Wearable-Tech is Going & Arduino Epicness!

6:30 PM: Doors Open, people socialize, catch up, enjoy a cuppa and perhaps some nosh.

Speaking of nosh, this evening we encourage everyone to contribute a small dessert item to our potluck holiday dessert buffet. Whatever your tradition, we all have treats from our past that put us in the mood for good cheer: fruit cake, sufganiyot, ribbon candy, figgy pudding, dreidel cookies, popcorn balls, candy canes...bring it!

7:00 PM: Open Talk begins in the library. This discussion group is open to everyone 18 and older, regardless of sexual orientation, preferred sexual position, political affiliation or religious ideology. This week's facilitator will be none other than our Chairman of Discussion Group Resources, our perpetual hipster, Gordon.

8:00 PMish: Holiday Show & Social – Mr. Scarlett O’Hara has been lured (encouraged? cajoled?) out of retirement to host GAAMC’s Gala Holiday Show! Mr. Scarlett has been preparing for months and so have our roster of current performers including Ed with a surprise from our most recent $1.98 Winner, Sherr with her “special” version of Santa Baby and a duet on “Suddenly Christmas” that will resonate with everyone. Got something you’d like to perform? Let Sherr know by dropping her a line at [masked]. Do you read poetry? Play an instrument? Be part of the celebration!

results.description:
Join us for our discussion on the Spiritual Significance of the Winter Solstice.

We will be referencing Winter: Herald of Rebirth, an essay from Master of the Rose Cross: a Collection of Essays By and About Harvey Spencer Lewis.

You can download the e-book free here!

About the Book

Harvey Spencer Lewis was born in New Jersey on November 25, 1883, of Welsh heritage and Methodist parents. He received an excellent education and a fine upbringing. From a very early age, he underwent mystical experiences which already indicated his exceptional destiny. For several years, he was the president of the New York Institute for Psychical Research, and was considered an authority in this field. In 1909, he made contact with the European leaders of the Rosicrucian Order.

Having given proof of his integrity and of his knowledge in philosophical and esoteric matters, he was initiated in Toulouse, where he officially received the mission of reactivating the Order in America. Despite encountering numerous obstacles and difficulties, he carried out his mission well, and in conformity with the instructions that were given him by the Rosicrucians of France, he began to put into writing the Rosicrucian teachings.

In order to demonstrate the traditional and authentic foundations of the Order, he made it known under the name, "The Ancient and Mystical Order of the Rose Cross." In 1915 he was named Imperator, that is, the international leader. After having dedicated his entire life to the service of the Order, Harvey Spencer Lewis passed through transition on August 2, 1939.

This work, which is dedicated to him, is presented so that you can discover his thoughts through his essays. Though written in the past century, their message is always fresh. They demonstrate the modern spirit and avant-garde nature of this great philosopher and humanist.

All are Welcome!
results.name: Spiritual Significance of the Winter Solstice

results.description:
Like our Facebook Page!:

    facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.


Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.25 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.25 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy:


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway  

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 


I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. results.description:
This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will experience!  Whether, you are in business or looking to create a start-up or get funding for one, this is the event for you. This FREE event brings together entrepreneurs, decision-makers and investors to network and build new business relationships in a great venue. You will find many who are open to share information about their business and are willing to build a future business relationship with you!...Better than Facebook, Twitter and Linkedin!

Remember to bring plenty of business cards.

The Lexington Lounge at The Court Hotel in the heart of midtown, you will be able to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere. 


What: Interesting After Hour Networking Event
Host: Roger
Why: Establish new contacts and/or reconnect with old ones.
Cost: FREE admission
Atmosphere: The dress code is business casual. 

Remember this is a FREE event, there is a one drink suggested minimum, because the venue is turning away other business to allow us to host our event. 


Cocktail Hour till 8 PM - Select Beer 6.00 - House Wine 7.00
   - Well Drinks 8.00 - 25% off Appetizers.


Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

THIS IS A MULTI GROUP EVENT. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A PORTION OF THOSE ACTUALLY ATTENDING. 

We look forward to see you networking with the best business professionals that New York City has to offer. 

We ask that you put your name and industry on the name tag that we will provide.

VOLUNTEERING: We will need extra hands. Anyone that would like to assist us with registration, please call or email me. 

SPAM: Please don't spam our members with your products/services or company name/website because your message will be deleted and you will be banned from this group

Want more business from events? If you are interested in sponsoring our groups or this event, please email me or go to http://businessonashoestring.com/sponsoring.htm 


Comments from past events: 

"For all those who couldn't make it you missed a great night! Lots of great conversation and lovely people to meet Thanks to Roger for his great organisation" - Julia Meyer 

"It was a great meetup, good mix of people and made plenty of new contacts, hope to attend again" - Berni Moestafa 

"Really enjoyed talking to the people I met. Good group. Very open. Welcoming. Will definitely come again!" - Fahd Ansari

"Thank you for hosting the wonderful meet up, I made a lot of new friends over there and I believe people attended are very much enjoy the conversations and the time. I can't wait to be part of the next event!" - Wei Zheng

“One of the most valuable evenings I have experienced in a very long time!” - Rob Friedman 

“Excellent. Diverse and welcoming group of people doing interesting things in the startup world. I look forward to future events” - Amanda

“Great group! Very interesting and diverse start-up biz people, a lot to learn from each other. Very positive experience - looking forward to upcoming events and lectures.” - A D 

“Really enjoyed the personalized yet structured atmosphere the organizers created. I thought this was the most useful meetup I've been to in the past couple months.” - Bill Katz 

"I got a new client, plus I really enjoyed meeting many of you. Thank you!" -Thomas Kant 

This event is organized by Roger Kuperways 
Our family of small business groups have over 7,200 members, inside and outside meetup, and still growing! http://www.businessonashoestring.com

results.description:
Awaken the Healing Power within Your Body and Mind ·  Awaken your body and mind’s innate healing power


·  Develop healthier and more fulfilling relationships


·  Learn to work constructively with your own emotions


·  Stimulate your minds innate problem solving capabilities


·  Develop new resources and capabilities


·  Become clear about your life’s purpose


Our bodies communicate with us all the time. Many of us are so over stimulated and stressed out that we cannot hear what our bodies are saying. We age faster and suffer many health problems when we do not know how to listen to what our body is telling us.


Discover the amazing wisdom that resides within your own body. Ben will show you how to develop your sensory awareness. Learn to truly listen to your body and care for its needs.


Stimulate the mind's creative problem solving capabilities by learning to "digest" issues, emotions and stresses


Many of us have never learned how to work with difficult issues and emotions. We tend to push these things down inside of ourselves. Undigested thoughts, issues, emotions and the stresses of daily life create a residue that accumulates within the tissues and organs of our bodies. That creates a great deal of additional stress upon our body and mind. These stresses can arrest our process of development, disconnect us from the divine creative intelligence of the universe and shut down our intuition. It also causes our bodies break down at a more rapid pace and that accelerates the aging process.


Learn to use your body-mind's innate healing power to "digest and assimilate" your thoughts feelings, emotions, issues and life experiences. You will begin to release the stresses that are held within the body and to heal the painful emotions associated with anxiety, depression and emotionally traumatic experiences. You will also learn to go right to the source of the issues to bring about a resolution that allows you to really move forward in your life.


Working with these practices helps to increase your intellectual and emotional range, improve memory, initiate new cycles of growth, awaken inner passions, spark creativity and deepen intuition. You will develop the strength and resilience that will make it easier for you to adapt to the demands that life places upon you.


Discover the passion and power that resides within you


Chinese Martial Arts Masters emphasize the development of a base of power known as the "dan tien". The stress of living in such a fast paced world can cause us to disconnect from our foundation. Undigested food, emotions and the stresses of daily life begin to accumulate within the abdomen. We may experience bloating and suffer from various digestive problems. Some of us begin to lose touch with our drive, passion, inspiration and the sense of knowing that reveals our true purpose as our instinctual base shuts down.


You will learn to become fully present within your body, to develop greater personal power, and to awaken the inner passion and sense of knowing that will bring give you a greater sense of clarity about your life's purpose.


Activate the healing intelligence that resides within the body and mind


We all have a powerful healing intelligence that resides within our bodies and minds. This innate healing power helps to mend our bodies any time we suffer an illness or injury. Our innate healing powers are often compromised by the stress and toxins that accumulate within our bodies.


Learn to activate the generative healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Awaken the consciousness of the individual organs. Access and heal the emotions and core issues that are held within the body. These practices are very effective for healing digestive and respiratory disorders and a wide range of other health issues.


Alternate Tuesdays at 7:30 PM at Unity of Somerville, located at 6 William Street at the corner of College Avenue


Call (913)[masked] to learn more


Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.


Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

results.description:
About This Class:


It's Christmas-time in New York and it is an exciting time to be in the city.

But with the holiday season are some peculiar new words and new topics of conversation that can be confusing for English language learners.

Learn and use 15 seasonal vocabulary words about Christmas from some basics to advanced words. Complete some fun exercises to help you remember these words.

And then get a quick cultural lesson about Christmas and the holidays in New York.

 After the classroom session is finished, let's walk past the windows at Macy's, and then walk along Fifth Avenue from 34th St to Rockefeller Plaza (at 49th St and Fifth Ave) where we can see the 78-foot Rockefeller Center Christmas Tree. This gorgeous and gigantic tree is covered in 5 miles of Christmas lights. Along Fifth Avenue there will be many other Christmas decorations and lights to see and take pictures of.

Who Is This Class For:

This class is for beginner to advanced English language learners who are:

·  curious about Christmas and its place in American culture 

·  want to practice their holiday conversation skills

·  want to see the Macy's Christmas window display and the Rockefeller Center Christmas Tree.

Schedule:

One Session

Estimated Duration: 2 hours and 30 minutes

Date: Monday, December 21, 2015

Starts: 7:00 pm

Location:

Ripley Grier Studios; 520 8th Avenue; 16th Floor

Price:

$15 per person for students who pay before Monday, December 21

$20 per person for students who pay in cash on the day of class

How to Pay:

Method 1: Before class - students may pay via Meetup when registering.

Method 2: Before class – students may register and then pay by visiting www.cash.me/dwightd and paying $15

Method 3: On the day of class – students may pay $20 in cash

Refund Policy: Persons who register and pay before class will be issued a refund when they notify the instructor that they cannot attend at least 24 hours prior to the class. No other refunds are offered.

Takeaways:

* New Christmas and holiday English vocabulary

* Cultural notes about Christmas and Hanukkah

* Cool pictures of New York City Christmas sites

About the Instructor:

Hi, I’m Dwight. I am an English language tutor with seven years of experience who is patient, and passionate about making learning fun. As a native English-speaker, I specialize in helping students improve their English with intensive language lessons based on fun practice exercises so that they can be more confident in their day to day lives. 

And I also CELTA certified, which means I have earned an internationally recognized credential in English language teaching from Cambridge University. When I am not tutoring, I have a day job in college admissions and I like to learn to Spanish, attempt to learn to speak Mandarin and to learn about Japanese culture.
results.name: English Class: Christmas Vocab, Culture Note and Walking Tour

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

This is a class in technique although, when you've conquered a song technically, then I will coach musicality and performance. Class size is limited. Fee is $20/per. You may audit the class once (without participating) for $10. Let me know when you sign up if that's your intention.

Dear Members: I am Mr. Harrington's agent/rep. Mr. Harrington teaches privately coaching established actors and singers. For years his private rate has been $120/hr for this service. He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. This demands tight scheduling of both his time and the room rental with Ripley-Grier Studios.For these reasons, I will be insisting to him that "no shows" be dropped from the group. The policy is this: If you RSVP you better show up. If you cancel you better do this by 4:00 pm the previous day.A word to the wise...Michael T. Harvey

results.description:
Join us for our weekly figure drawing session at The National Arts Club.

This session is open to all levels. Open to the public.

<a>Let us know you're coming.</a> 


We operate on a first come first served basis. Arriving by 6:45 is a good way to guarantee a seat.

• Bring your own drawing supplies.


• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break.

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp!

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes.

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there.

Simon

results.description:
• Heal the emotional wounds of past relationships
• Transform deep seated patterns of abandonment and rejection
• Let go of unhealthy dysfunctional relationships
• Develop the ability to remain centered in the core of your being
• Become truly loving and accepting of yourself
• Develop a warm magnetic presence that will draw others to you
• Cultivate inner beauty
• Increase your capacity to give and receive love
• Attract a healthy and loving partner
• Create healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Develop a stronger connection with the higher power
• Learn to evolve spiritually through your relationships

 

 


My friend Sema was telling me about how she had fallen for a man, but he had not called her in some time. Sema told me that she felt this man would come back to her somewhere down the road. Yet she also acknowledged that on another level she was experiencing a fear of loss and that she didn’t feel that there was much hope for the relationship. Sema told me later that evening that she could never seem to hold onto the men that she truly wanted to be with.

Sema was obviously strung out on the man, but she was very disconnected from the underlying pain that was driving her. Sema’s head was just spinning in circles as she analyzed everything the man said or did and why he wasn’t with her at that time. I could see that the hurt buried within Sema was keeping her attached to the man in a very unhealthy way…

Does this sound familiar?

Many of us are struggling to find love. But no matter what we do, love always seems to evade us.

I’ve been there myself and I didn’t know if I would ever find the love that I desired. But I persevered because I was very determined to heal and have someone special in my life. I discovered a series of practices that have enabled me to heal the emotional wounds and to develop a magnetic presence. These practices are making it possible for me to attract more loving partners and to create healthier and more fulfilling relationships. I have now decided to share these practices and understandings so that others can also create more love and intimacy and to attract someone truly special.

Open Your Heart by Healing the Emotional Wounds That Carry Over From Childhood and Past Loves
Most of us are still carrying the emotional wounds from our childhood and our past loves. We try to block the hurtful feelings and memories out of our awareness. But these feelings and experiences remain trapped within our body and mind. We then give off a vibe that causes us to attract and become attracted to dysfunctional people who create even more confusion, pain and suffering in our lives.

Learn to “digest” the emotional baggage that keeps you trapped in unfulfilling relationships. Transform the deep seated patterns that cause you to attract people who are negative or abusive or who do not have the capacity to truly love you and be present with you.

Heal the loss of past loves. Heal the shame and the feelings unworthiness, rejection and abandonment. Become clearer about what you really want in life and in a companion. You will naturally attract and find yourself attracted to healthier people as you heal the wounded parts of yourself. More and more love will flow to you as you begin to experience true love and acceptance for yourself. Working with these practices will make it possible for you to cultivate inner beauty and to develop a presence that is very healing to others.

Develop the Kind of Warm Magnetic Presence That Will Attract a Healthy and Loving Partner
Many of us have learned to disconnect from our emotions and are not very present within our bodies. The stresses, emotions and life experiences that we fail to digest accumulate within our body and mind. These stagnant energies and emotions can extinguish our inner fire and passion. Stagnant energies decrease our desirability which makes us less attractive to others.

A body that if full of vital life force is infinitely more desirable. Become powerfully present while remaining centered within the core of your being. Exude warmth, passion, sensuality and desire.

Develop Your Intuition and Sensory Awareness
Heightened intuition and sensory awareness lets us know when it is safe for us to open up to another person. It helps us to understand where people are coming from. Our intuition also guides us to the people that we are meant to be with.

Use Your Relationships to Evolve Spiritually
Healing the hurts and resolving the issues awakens the part of the soul that resides within your body. Awakening your body-mind will enable you to develop a stronger connection with your higher self and the universal consciousness.

Develop Chi Power
Many systems of Chinese martial arts emphasize the development of the dan tien, which is our base of power in the lower abdomen. You will learn specific chi gong practices that will enable you to continually cultivate the chi/shakthi in the dan tien. Developing Chi Power enables you to create a powerful magnetic presence that draws others to you.

Create Healthier and More Fulfilling Relationships
Relationships have a way of bringing our core issues to the surface. Buried emotions and unresolved issues create barriers between ourselves and others. Our love grows stronger and our understanding deepens as we learn to “digest” our emotions, resolve important issues and express our feelings and needs in a healthy way.

Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

I'm working out in the field much of the time and I have very limited access to the internet. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can heal from the loss of a love and develop a more attractive presence. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

Sign up for my free monthly internet journal at http://www.doiohm.com...

Please go to http://www.facebook.com/healthyandlovingrelationships

and click on the LIKE button at the top of the page to join the community and gain access to new articles.

results.description:
Some of us hackers and friends are reading through a Shakespeare play the third Monday evening of every month. We started with Lear on November 28th, 2013, and, in what has become a tradition, sent out for pizza between Acts III and IV. So arrive with a copy of the play of the month (or some device that will allow you to access it online), your stentorian voice, some spare change for a slice, a couple of bucks for beer, and join the culture wars.

Our schedule includes a list of the plays we have not yet read and when we expect to read them. Thanks to Jesse Lansner for suggesting the remaining schedule.

Coming up over the next few months:

January 2016      Winter's Tale

results.description:
Dear Friends & Troublemakers!

Let's step into our greatest adventure and live in the fullness of who we truly are - together! Let's release that which no longer serves us and liberate our true and greatest selves - open, vulnerable, infinite, loving and free!! Let's lean into our edges and our vulnerability.  Face our fears and leap into the unknown of our greatest yet to be!!! Let's play in the field of Great Spirit!!

Join us in a powerful and joyous group healing process that will allow you to release internal barriers to happiness, love, empowerment, liberation, joy, success and abundance with ease, grace, fun and laughter! Permanent positive change, expansion and growth occur as layers of repressed pain, fear, limiting beliefs, unhealthy behavior patterns and trauma are released from the body, mind and emotions in a process that combines elements of traditional counseling with a sacred transmission of the divine healing energy of Spirit - to release in one session that which takes years to heal in traditional therapeutic modalities. This all happens in a fun, loving, safe, supportive and completely confidential community setting that we will be recreating every other Monday night .   

Our work with our teachers Don and Jen Hanson http://www.donhanson.com/ has catalyzed truly momentous growth and transformation in our lives, and we feel blessed and grateful to now be certified to share this truly miraculous and amazing, love and light-filled healing journey with all who are interested in being liberated from that which holds them back in order to be all that it is their sacred destiny to be. We are relatable, real world folks who have discovered something that has so transformed our lives, for which we are so grateful, that we want to pass this on to as many people as possible. In keeping with the great mystical traditions, TCM opens hearts and minds, teaches tools, and builds internal structure that allow each participant to cultivate and build their own relationship with Spirit and Sacred Energy, and far from creating any dependency on us or the process, liberates all to deepen and follow the calling of their own unique relationship to Spirit.  
With Love, Marc Anthony

Fee:$30.00 per class ,first timers are free 

Marc Anthony Chiaramonte is a Certified TCM facilitator who has been trained by Don and Jen Hanson for almost a decade. He has been facilitating TCM groups in New York, Florida and Connecticut. Early on Marc Anthony devoted his life to the journey of self discovery and personal growth. Working with the Spirit and Divine Intelligence of the Universe he helps unlock and transform old beliefs, behavior patterns and resistance to allow a deeper connection with the Divine.  

In his work Marc Anthony also brings various modalities such as Tantra, Sacred Sexuality, Psychodrama, Bodywork and Energy Healing.  He is a successful businessman and owns a Contracting and Management Company. He is also a father to a beautiful son Nicholas. Marc Anthony lives in New York City and New Jersey and is available for private healing sessions with individuals and couples.

results.description:
**There are 100 people signed up for the league who are there every night REGARDLESS of who is signed up from Meetup - so don't worry about how many people have RSVP'ed just here on Meetup.  We just leave up the Meetup for any new people (that's you!) who would want to come join us.  There are ALWAYS a ton of people.** 

Who: Exactly 1 buttload of good people
What: FREE Dodgeball!
Where: Manhattan, Upper East Side, St Joseph School, 420 E 87th St
Why: Fun n stuff
How: read below...

Oh hi there person reading this.  My name's Ari.  You should come play dodgeball with us.  That's a fun game.  Remember that from grade school?  Yeah, apparently when you're an adult you're still allowed to do that.  Who knew?  Oh, and now we get to go to a bar afterward instead of back to math class.  So there's that.  Adulthood has its perks.

See, here's some photos of shenanigans:

Doesn't that look like those people are having good times?  That could be you having good times!  You're a people!  And good times are the best kinds of times.

---

FAQ

SO WHO ARE YOU?
So the deal is that we're the group in NYC that gets together to play dodgeball every week...because we are overgrown children.  Sometimes old school rubber playground balls, sometimes little soft jello ones, sometimes some foam ones.

ARE YOU SOME BIG ANNOYING SOCIAL SPORTS COMPANY?
Nah.  We're not here to F you.  That's why it's FREE for new folk.  It IS a company technically because we needed to take out insurance to rent out gyms - and then pay for the gyms.  But we're more a community than anything (but how legit does our website look?!) and just a good group of people running around with a childhood sport...and then, you know, a bar after if that's your thing.  

I WANT IN!  BUT WHAT IF I'M BAD/SCARED?
We don't just throw you to wolves - we'll introduce you around, explain everything, and no experience or athleticism necessary!  No one's gonna bully you or not want to play/hang out with you for being "bad" - no one cares about that...that's what a dick would do.  And we're not dicks.


WHAT IF I'M LATE?
It's just dodgeball, relax.  Come and go as you please.  The earlier you get there, the more you play of course, but no worries.

WHAT ABOUT MY STUFF? WHAT DO I WEAR?
There are bathrooms to change in if you need to.  Everyone leaves their stuff by the side of the court.  Plenty come straight from work.  Whatever you'd want to run around in is cool for clothes.  You wanna come in your work suit?  Rock on.

THIS IS AWESOME.  IS THERE A LEAGUE?!  I WANT MORE!

There is a full league that goes on too, if you're interested.  Same deal - good or bad all welcome!  More formal with teams and schedules and trophies and costume themes and karaoke and drink deals and all... More info here: www.sandlotsportsnyc.com/register , but any questions just lemme know!

Any questions, don't hesitate!  We'll get back to you! 

facebook.com/groups/NYCDodgeball
www.sandlotsportsnyc.com


A firm embrace,
Ari

<a href="http://www.sandlotsportsnyc.com"></a>

NYC's hottest open mic in one of NYC's hottest performance venues - The Inspired Word @ the newly renovated Parkside Lounge!

Age limit: 21+ (Must bring valid ID)

When: EVERY Monday Night

Where: The Parkside Lounge
http://www.parksidelounge.net/
317 E. Houston Street
Manhattan, New York 10002

Time: 7pm

Full backline. Honky-tonk piano (feel free to bring your own keyboard). Cool stage. Comfy cabaret-style seating. Cheap drinks, including the Bailout Package (shot of whisky + 22-ounce beer) for only 8$.

Purchase advance tickets for a guaranteed performance slot @ https://nycmondayopenmic.eventbrite.com

Cover charge:


$7 for solo performer or audience member online, $8 @ the door.

You can pay online (to guarantee a slot) or at the door. 

***1 DRINK MINIMUM INSIDE VENUE PER PERSON***

Produced by the long-running Inspired Word open mic series, which has featured Grammy winners, American Idol finalists, Golden Globe Award winners, Obie Award winners, Emmy nominated actors, and HBO stars, The Inspired Word open mic is open to ALL types of performing artists - comedians, musicians, storytellers, singers, poets, fiction/nonfiction writers, playwrights, spoken word artists, performance artists, dancers.

25 slots, 7 minutes apiece for anything spoken, 8 minutes for singers/musicians (if you have backing tracks bring them on either mp3 player or smartphone).

A warm, supportive community of artists. Real crowds. And a great place to network.

This is a very popular open mic. We STRONGLY suggest you purchase a ticket in advance to guarantee a performance slot. https://nycmondayopenmic.eventbrite.com

*****

Directions

By Subway: Take the F to Second Avenue. Go up the 1st Avenue stairs and head East on Houston Street.

*****

Produced by Mike Geffner Presents The Inspired Word

results.description:
PLEASE READ:

Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7-7:05 - chat

7:05-7:30 - introductions (please be on time for intros)

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 4,000 words or 15 pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 4 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

See you there,

Dan

347 - 743 - 1854
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description:
Add some variety to your running -- do some speed work on the track! Think you're slow? This is the best way to get faster. Nobody is too slow to try a track workout. This is how you will improve.

We encourage runners of all ability levels to join. You are not too slow! If you are a even a little bit intimidated by the thought of running laps at the track we want to challenge you to come join us and find out just how awesome it actually is. You will feel great (and exhausted) at the end of the workout. Guaranteed!


The East River Park Track is just across the FDR highway at the end of 6th street. Just walk across the pedestrian overpass and the track will be right there.


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. We pile all our stuff together and are (relatively) nearby for the duration of the workout. We have never had a problem with theft, but that doesn't mean it won't happen.


After the workout join us for beer at ABC Beer Co. at Ave C between 6th and 7th.

results.description:
How to be unconditionally happy?

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.

What can get you to that state?

The rest you gain by reposing in yourself is deeper than the deepest sleep. The deeper your rest, the more dynamic your activity is. By being peaceful and happy you can turn your body into a power-house by generating an inner source of energy.

Meditation is simple and is a practical way to recharge and rejuvenate; empowering you to do more of the things you love.

Come join us for free guided session and experience the power of meditation.

Workshop Contents:

- Understanding the nature of the mind
- Relaxing Breathing Techniques
- Guided Meditation
- Introduction to the Happiness Course and Sudarshan Kriya

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

results.description:
Real Self Defense is Offensive in nature. 

KravMaguy offers a true, authentic Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) training experience emphasizing hand-to-hand combat, tactical and warrior training for both men and women. The Head instructor was featured in the History Channel – The Human Weapon- a documentary about Krav Maga in Israel. His last assignment was as Tactical Security Team Leader working off the coast of East Africa. 

In this basics class you will learn to defend yourself and survive knife wielding assassins, sexual assaults or any would be attacker looking to take your life using the basic principles of kravmaguy level one system. In the end only your are responsible for your own protection. You cannot rely on others when split seconds count.

Topics covered in Level One 8 week course:
Jab cross 
Fighting Stance
Weak body spots
Hook uppercut
Basic footwork
Punching jab cross
Elbows regular
Knees
Groin strikes- knees, shin to groin, groin jab (lead leg)
Knife hands
Escape- RNC
Escape guillotine
Escape schoolyard headlock (requires matted area)
Physical requirements to pass level one:
20 pushups
35 sit ups
30 squats
Level 2 training prep


check out this youtube video to see kravmaguy knife defense in action, these techniques are used by murderers and terrorists to kill countless innocents and knowing these basic defenses can save your life and the ones you love

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BbzLjAUlyzU

the eye rake to elbow to the spine: a kravmaguy classic:

results.description: The purpose of this group is to establish a safe place where people can deal with the pain and isolation brought about by the ending of a significant relationship. We are not a singles group or a dating network. Instead, we are a family where it is safe to be ourselves. The goal of the meeting is to help members to develop into healthier, more complete, independent, loving men and women. We hope that by being together, listening to each other, and by sharing our experiences, strength and hope, we will learn to see the value of life in a new context. For the first hour of each meeting members share their experiences. The second half of the meeting is reserved for a guest speaker relating to either the legal or emotional aspects of separation/divorce. We meet every Monday eveing at the Church in the Highlands, 35 Bryant Ave. White Plains, New York. We are a mixed group of men and women. There are about 50 members, with approximately 20 attendees per meeting. There are no fees, new members are welcome, no reservation is necessary. We pass a basket at each meeting and suggest a five dollar donation per meeting to cover the cost of the meeting place and coffee/cookies served at the meeting.
results.name: Separation and Divorce Recovery Group Weekly Meetup

Throughout her work, Nicole has expanded the horizons of sexual experience, which has earned her invitations to share the stage as a speaker alongside other luminaries such as Neil Stauss, Tony Robbins, Naomi Wolfe and Esther Perel, as well as inclusion in Tim Ferris’ breakthrough book “The Four Hour Body.” 


Nicole brings a no-nonsense, empirical approach to the question most of us ask, “How do I have a better sex life?” But much more than that, her life has been spent exploring the impact our full human potential in the arena of sex and what benefits that can bring to not just individuals and couples, but to communities, organizations and societies as a whole. What becomes possible for our lives, our health, our happiness, and our prosperity when we learn to live in a continual state of orgasm? This is the territory Nicole continues to explore today.


Orgasm is the willingness to sacrifice control in order to access the best and the worst that this existence has to offer. In other words, Orgasm doesn't just create life, Orgasm IS life.

results.description:
Student Testimonial:

"Bodhi meditation has a focus on healing energy, you can experience this at each session. Much higher level of meditation in group than I can achieve doing my own practice. I was very happy to find a meditation group that was focused on bringing together community members to practice meditation. Bodhi meditation is unique because they offer free sessions to the community. Nan is a wonderful teacher, and very compassionate person. You can sense that she has extensive experience in oriental medicine including acupuncture, herbal medicine, and energy healing,. Thank you Nan. ” Joe, Bodhi Meditation class Wednesday October 29, 2014 

"It's like looking into the eyes of Pure Love. I've been around meditation, acupuncture, and "Spiritual Healers" for over 20 years. In that time I've worked with several healers. Not until I had privilege of meeting Nan Ni did I experience a true healer. Having a session with Nan Ni or "Nan" is like looking into the eyes of Pure Love - the kind of selfless Love that you hoped was "out there", but didn't really expect to find. Nan has a profound sense of commitment to her patients and students. Her caring, genuine smile comes from deep within and warms you the moment that you meet her. Nan's healing, insightful ways never cease to amaze me and fill me with gratitude. Nan can look at you and know what you need. How many times was I shocked when, without my uttering a word, did she know exactly was what troubling me. I wish I were eloquent enough to express my sincere appreciation for the gift of meeting and working with Nan. Nan's answer to that would be to greet each and every person I meet with an open and loving heart. It is my hope that if you are searching for a healer and/or a meditation practice and come across these words, that you will know that you've found what you've been searching for. Thank you, Lynn" Bodhi Meditation Class Saturday March 14, 2014 

“ Very strong healing energy tonight. I got there feeling very tired. I had stomach pain all day, and during the first meditation of the evening it got a lot better. By the end I wasn't thinking about it at all. I left full of energy. ” Pam, Bodhi Meditation class November 22, 2013

“ I didn't realize I would be reaping the benefits of Bodhi Med so quickly after attending only two classes. After my second class I felt even more relaxed. I have insomnia, but after the second session I fell asleep faster and deeper which has not happened for a long time. ” Dee, Bodhi Meditation class September 18, 2013

It was enlightening!!! Every time I practice Bodhi meditation, it feels like my Chi increases more and more! Thank you everyone for sharing this to NYC." Javoski (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013) 

"Nan emits healing energy -- the meditation is wonderful" Linda (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013) 

"Very calming and energizing. I did not have any negative thoughts or worries last night in bed like I always do. I felt my mind was clear. I will definitely go to another class" Dee (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013) 

"I Walked In With Lower Back Pain, Listened, Opened My Heart And Relaxed My Mind And Walked Out Feeling Better Than I Have In Almost Two Weeks. Thank You So Much. Looking Forward To Friday's " Ed (Bodhi Meditation class Tuesday July 30, 2013)

-----------------------------------------------------------------


Thank you all for participating in your Bodhi Meditation class.

Between May 14,2013 and June 2015 over 3,000 people attended our classes in NYC, Westchester and Long Island.


Date: Monday

Location: Freeport Recreation Center

130 East Merrick Road Freeport, NY

Time: 7:30 - 9:00pm

Class Price: FREE


Come and experience how this unique meditation can help you purify your body/mind and unleash the creative power within you.

* Increase self-awareness

* Stronger emotional intelligence

* Greater mental clarity, focus and inspiration.

Bodhi Meditation

Energize your body

Strenthen your mind

Bodhi Meditation is a form of energy healing.

Bodhi Meditation is unique in the following ways

1). It channels universal energy rather than working with what’s within one person. It transcends the genetic and physical limits of just one being by relying and drawing energy from the entire universe.

2). The entire human body is the receiver of this energy. The energy’s effects on the body do not rely on certain meridian paths or pressure points of the body, which are the common requirements for many types of the Qi Gong practices.

Students will experience two forms of Bodhi Meditation.

* Seated

* Movement

Your class instructor is Nan Ni Gilbert. Nan is a NYS licensed acupuncturist and Chinese herbalist. Nan is also one of the most advanced Bodhi Meditation energy healer in North America.

Feel free to ask Nan your personal health questions after the class.

Please arrive early for class intro/setup.

Class basic info:

* Loose fitting clothes is recommended but not required.

* Some people bring their own yoga mat for the seated meditation part. This is not a requirement as we have chairs for everyone.

* Cellphones needed to be turned off during the class.

Contact: [masked] Here is the internet link if you are interested in purchasing the meditation music.

http://www.bodhimeditationsociety.org/digit-audios/?PHPSESSID=bdc7699b94b966a513c5c67e7cfc8ed1
results.name: Bodhi Meditation  - Freeport Long Island (FREE)

Time:. 7:30 PM – 9:00 PM

Day: Mondays

Where: Room #102, Freeport Recreation Center

130 E Merrick Rd, Freeport, NY 11520

Contact: Nan, [masked]

**The Bodhi Meditation classes at the Freeport Rec Center are free but all participates are required to have a Freeport Rec Center Activity Card.  The cost is $5.00 for Freeport Residents and $10.00 for Non-Residents. It's a one time annual fee payable to the Freeport Rec Center. If it's your first class please arrive early to purchase your activity card.

 -------------------------------------------------------------------

I leave you with Master JinBodhi's Golden Words:

(Editor's note: The following phrases were suggested by Master JinBodhi and subsequently introduced to his students as a daily practice. Starting your day by loudly reciting these phrases three times, either all of them or a select few, will bring you energy and joy. Give it a try and experience how uplifted you feel...)

1.Self-Confidence

I am most compassionate.

I am most confident.

I am most tolerant.

I am most courageous.

I keep my word.

I am most punctual.

I can do anything.

2. The Power of Knowledge

I am full of wisdom.

I am most knowledgeable.

I love reading.

I love observing.

I love listening.

I love thinking.

I take decisive action.

3. Life Purpose

 I am a gift from the Universe.

I am most charming.

I am most talented.

I can sing most beautifully.

I like challenge.

I am responsible for my actions.

I will fulfill my life purpose.

4. Cause and Consequence

（not for reading loud）

What you give is what you receive.

Care for others, and you are taken care of.

Smile at others, and they will smile at you.

Treat others with sincerity, and sincerity will be given to you.

Make trouble for others, and trouble will find you.

Frequent generosity begets abundance.

Seek to give, not to be rewarded.

This will be the official intermediate Korean class. The class material will be provided. We will go through grammars, vocabularies, speaking, and practice with fun activities. - For members who has taken beginner plus classes can continue here.

If you know how to read & write Korean letters(Hangul) you can join the class. What we cover for the class is tense, verb conjugation with practical phrases.

Since I need to book a space ahead, please consider your RSVP seriously and let me know if you can't make it after you said YES to come.

The location will be either near Bryant park. The exact location will be sent to members privately. Please, email me at [masked] with your contact number if you can come. I will send mine so we can communicate better when the meet up happens.

The class fee will be $15 per person. Once you commit for 4 weeks series of classes it will be $40. Please, note you won't get a credit if you cancel your attendance on the same day. Be prepared for the class! :)

We may hang out and mingle after the class. I'm very excited to see you all and look forward to it! 
If you have any questions,please leave a comment.

results.description:
We'll learn about those, who found guilty of unspeakable acts, but deemed unable to recognize the difference between right and wrong, or to conform their behavior, were consigned to new facilities built exclusively for their care and confinement.The first and most famous of these being Broadmoor in England, and Bellevue Hospital, in the United States.
We’ll explore the different definitions of Legal Responsability then and now, meet some famous residents, including artists and writers, examine treatment approaches, and what it was like to celebrate Christmas in the Asylum.
Judy Jackson interned at Bellevue while obtaining her BA/MA in Forensic psychology from John Jay College of Criminal Justice. She is the founder and CEO of FullForce Forensics LLC, a platform for consulting on creative projects with psycho-legal narratives

Time: 8:00 pm - 10:00 pm

Cost: $8 Event

Meeting place: 424A 3rd Av, Brooklyn, NY

Transportation: Take Q or R to Atlantic Station. Then
walk (only 12 minutes) along 4th avenue 

This is very curious lecture illistrated by trully genious artists.
Please, come 10 or 15 minutes before lecture, so we can sit next to each other

My cell#[masked]
results.name: Criminally Insane: From Bedlam  and Beyond- An Illustrated Lecture
