results.description:
Greetings Beautiful Beings Of Perfect & Radiant Health, 

Are you tired of feeling drained, depleted & exhausted absorbing toxic energies from people, places, or situations that are not serving your highest good in this reality? 

Our bodies are infinitely aware & conscious of everyone & everything around us & are always sending us messages and signs that we don't always pay attention to. When we tune in & listen to its wisdom, we get to speak to all of our body parts & ask for clarity and to be shown what needs to change so we can enjoy living in our bodies (not our busy brains) all the time! 

So when was the last time you communicated with the eternal & ancient wisdom of your body? 

On this call, we'll be re-visiting the origin of the trauma that created your pain, & unlock the energetic blockages held in your tissues & systems. Once you become aware & allow yourself to feel those buried feelings & unresolved emotional content, you can release the dis-ease & dis-harmony to the vastness of infinite consciousness just by embodying the energies of ease, grace, and flow.

To receive free access to this live class or listen to the video recording later, visit:https://spirit.learnitlive.com/class/7725/Accelerated-Pain-Healing# 

Join Vandana to receive powerful clearings to transmute pain, stress, and trauma into peace, joy, and harmony. Your birthright is to experience vitality, infinite energy flows, & radiant health. Once you choose to consciously release all the debris and clutter you've been storing in your luminous light body, you can raise your vibration higher than you ever dreamed possible for you and your ancestors. 

During this 1 hour healing activation & divine light transmission, you can restore your pranic life force energies & feel rejuvenated, regenerated, & revitalized!!! 

Most of us are feeling intense shifts & experiencing some pretty challenging times this year. We desire to break free & get unstuck from unconscious programming of stress, struggle, & limitations but don't know how or haven't been shown the way out of the matrix into co-creating a greater reality. 

If you're tired of being sick and tired, then this is the perfect class to sign up for & claim your perfect health again...your natural state of being:) 

It's your divine birthright & spiritual inheritance to naturally vibrate from the state of self-love, peace, joy, and gratitude as everything is truly a gift and a blessing no matter how we tend to judge it. 

You have the power to change anything that limits the quality of your life!!! 

In this class, you will receive a powerful self-love & gratitude healing attunement with powerful symbols, colors, and sounds from the accelerated light healing beings who are always available to accelerate your health and well-being. 

All you have to do is lie back and receive! 

Here's to your perfect & radiant health & well-being! 

See you on the call! 

Enjoy this video to get you through the holidays with ease, joy, & grace: 
https://youtu.be/sy91JG7ng3s 

Accelerated Light Blessings, 
Vandana Atara Aura 
Co-Creator Of Accelerated Light Healing 
Http://Vandanalighthealing.com

results.description:
Mondays from 8 – 9:30 pm with Yasuko Kasaki & Chris Pelham

A Course in Miracles and A Course of Love classes are $20 each

Know your life purpose and the meaning of your current situation clearly. Communicate with your Inner Teacher. Heal yourself and others.

These ongoing classes focus on mind training designed to help you to experience the lessons and wisdom of ACIM. 

Each Monday class contains some lecture from the ACIM Textbook and/or Urtext, some discussion and Q&A, and typically 20 – 30 minutes of meditation, creative visualization and/or spiritual reading practice in order to experience mind change.

Thursday classes skip the lecture to devote more time to discussion and practice.

Our primary goal in these classes is for each student to learn to listen to the guidance of Holy Spirit and live his/her life with certainty and peace. Slowly, you will re-train your eyes to see the world around you without judgment. You will learn to communicate with your holy spirit.

It is OK to attend without having done the reading, but we highly encourage you to do the reading (and the workbook lessons on your own) if you can! This course is meant to be experienced rather than simply talked about. You can find the text online here, among other places.

Students of all experience levels and backgrounds are welcome!

Yasuko Kasaki has been teaching A Course in Miracles and offering spiritual counseling and healing since 1999. She has approximately 1,000 students and clients. In 2004, she opened CRS, the first and only spiritual center in New York City devoted to the study and practice of ACIM. Ms. Kasaki is the author of 21 books published by major publishers in Japan. Read more...

You can listen to a sampling of Yasuko's recent guided meditations here:
http://crsny.podbean.com

Christopher Pelham currently serves as teaching assistant for the Monday class and will sometimes lead the group when Ms. Kasaki is away. He is the Director and a co-founder of CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing). He balances his time between overseeing the growth and health of the CRS community, producing arts/cultural/educational events at the Center, and working as a CRS Healer and student and teacher of A Course in Miracles. In addition to studying ACIM with Yasuko Kasaki since 2003, he studied the Spiritual Psychology of Acting with London-based teacher John Osborne Hughes and Keith Johnstone-based Improvisation with the late Gloria Maddox. Read more...

Another great way to get a taste of our approach is to attend one of our free Healing Events, each of which is open to the public:

Spiritual Healing Clinic 
M 7 – 7:50 pm, Tu 7 – 7:50 pm
Sundays 12 – 1 pm preceding Jon Mundy's Miracles in Manhattan lectures
Healing Clinic suggested donation $20, nobody turned away

Guided Meditation
Tu 6:30 – 7 pm
Free!
results.why: It's a concrete and energizing way to develop the ability to meditate and to come to know your life purpose and the meaning of your current situation more clearly. You can also learn to communicate with your Inner Teacher and find peace!
results.how_to_find_us: It's located one block east of Broadway, one and half blocks south of Union Square, above Think Coffee shop.

results.description:
Join us, as we explore the basis of Meditation & Self-knowledge, Mysticism, Kabbalah, Esotericism, Astral Projection, Sacred Sexuality, Alchemy, and the mysteries of The human Consciousness. 

Every Monday & Wednesday Nights at 8pm. (Rsvp required)

Topics to study:


- Introduction to Gnosis: The term "Gnosis" & it's foundations; Science, Philosophy, Art and Mysticism.

- Foundations of Gnostic Psychology: The Consciousness, The Personality & the Ego. The Human Machine & the 3 Brains. The human mind & the Universal Mind.

- The Awakening of the Consciousness: Mindfulness, Self-observation & The fourth dimension. Lucid Dreams & The Astral World.

- Universal Laws and the Ray of Death: Return, Recurrence, and Reincarnation. Law of Karma and Dharma. The Mysteries of Life and Death. Evolution, Involution, and Revolution.

*** Guided Meditation for beginners and intermediate levels after every lecture***

"The mission of Gnosticism in this age is provide the methods and tools to rescue the highest values of the human being in order to pursue transcendence and the self-realization of the Being." Samael Aun Weor
results.name: Introduction to Gnosis (Mondays Nights)

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

[masked]

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.

Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, get a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

results.description:
We are an independent referrals group dedicated to the business growth of each of our members.  We welcome one member per business category in our membership.    Our 15 members are friendly and focused on supporting one another.  We'd like to grow to 20-25 members - will you join us?

This Meetup group helps us reach business professionals like you.  We welcome guests to visit us in order to network, get to know us, and decide if there's a membership 'fit'.

As an independent group, our dues stay with us and we use them to invest in our weekly meetings with a hot breakfast - as well as public networking events and member-only professional development programs.

Our 'rules' are relaxed compared to other referral groups.  For example, we don't require a sub if you can't make a meeting and our attendance policy allows for an occasional absence.  Instead of fines, we reward our members when they bring in guests.


We don't have a 'requirement' to bring in a referral every single week because we only want qualified introductions - and we know that a connection for another member may not show itself every single week.

We meet weekly to generate solid business referrals for each other. Join us and we’ll talk up your business, too. Partners in Business members have one focus . . . to exchange qualified business referrals.

We cater to the early morning professional, meeting on Tuesdays from 7:00-8:30am.  RSVP and be our GUEST at the next scheduled meeting. For further details, please see our website at Partners in Business.

We are BNI-affilliated, and value the philosophy of "Givers Gain". We are committed to help one-another succeed. Somewhat like having a part-time sales/marketing/mentoring/resource team. If you will. "If I help you, you'll want to help me, and we'll both benefit".

RSVP now and come promote your business at an upcoming Tuesday morning meeting!

results.description:
Professional Business Networking Event in Elmhurst, Queens.

The BNI Dream Team. 

As a reminder here's why we wake up early Tuesday mornings. 98% of businesses rely on referrals to build new business. ONLY 3% of businesses have a strategy to generate those referrals. Our BNI networking meetings are a proven word of mouth marketing referral generating strategy. Last year, members of BNI (Business Networking International) passed millions of referrals that generated billions of dollars of business for each other. Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of salespeople representing your business, and in return you are representing their businesses. What goes around comes around. If I help you, you’ll help me and we will both benefit as a result.

The reason  BNI is so successful is that there is only one person per profession per chapter. If your profession is listed below we invite you to come check us out and show you how we can help you grow your business.

BNI Dream Team is currently looking for these professions to pass a boat load of business to. 

IT Professional, Title Insurance, Moving Company, Reverse Mortgage Broker, DJ Entertainment Company, Florist, Photographer, Caterer, General Contractor, Event Planner, Personal Trainer, Architect, Hair Salon, Nutritionist, Life Coach, Commercial Real Estate Broker, Business Broker.

If your profession falls under any of the above titles I strongly encourage you to come check us out!

Here are the details for our next meeting Tuesday, October 20th 2015

Meeting time is from 7:00AM to 8:30AM

Our Location: Nevada Diner 80-26 Queens Blvd, Elmhurst, NY 11374 (718) 426-2229.

Plenty of Parking, trains: M & R, Grand Ave station

The cost is $15 which includes breakfast.

Please bring 30 business cards to pass out.

STOP LETTING BUSINESS PASS YOU BY AND TAKE ACTION NOW!

results.description:
Come join us for an invigorating breakfast and networking event.

There will be at least 15 members at each meeting, regardless of how many people RSVP on Meetup.

Meet successful business owners from different professions to give and pass referrals and grow your personal network.

BNI, the largest business networking organization in the world, is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.  Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that!  

For 28 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain," or, "what goes around comes around."

 Last year alone, Business Network Int'l generated over 7.1 million referrals resulting in more than $3.3 billion worth of business for its members!

In Manhattan, BNI currently has more than 1250 members in 53 Chapters. 

BRING LOTS OF BUSINESS CARDS!!!
Cost is $20, which includes breakfast.

results.description:
This NYC Make Peace with Cash Flows Meetup group might be ideal for you if you are interested in developing peace with your current personal cash flows and professional networking.  Even if you are in a good place with your current situation, here is a good opportunity to optimize for the future while also helping others. This group was formed as my life was growing in different areas, and it took time for me to be at peace while being on the same page with my loved ones. Once I found that peace and meaning in my life, I felt the need to pay it forward.  It is great to know where you want to go by having goals and while savings and investments are certainly important, they are not everything.  Now let’s take it a step further and gain some peace of mind by getting totally clear about our current personal cash flows.  Let's do this without having destination disease - curious about what that is? Show up and learn how to move past that phase.

Space will be limited so join and RSVP today for the impactful event.

10:30am Professional Networking with Social Innovators with motivating projection visuals as the back drop

10:50am Go Deep Iceberg Make Peace with Cash Flows Presentation with Discussion

11:40am Professional Networking with Social Innovators

Noontime Event Concludes

Let's be present in the movement and transparent about our future actions.  Let’s be proactive, be the catalyst to change and always be prepared to react to the new unforseen events that affect our lives.  Let's build with like-minded people that are thinking clear and concisely about their current cash flows. 
We will then continue by disecting some case studies of life situations that might cause one to lose that said peace of mind and then best practices on how to move forward with a safe and sound mindset.  While we go through our presentation, we will discuss hidden current costs that can effect your current monetary situations.  We will also be sharing solutions to create a sanctuary in ourselves by getting clear on our cash flow realities. We suggest you share issues and solutions throughout the process. We always make sure to leave at least 15 to 30mins for networking encouragement and questions.
results.name: Using Organically Build Technology to Organize our Personal Cash Flows

group.name: NYC Peace with Cash flows Meetup

Our membership is 280,000 strong. Our members improve their speaking and leadership skills by attending one of the 13,500 clubs like Bryant Park Toastmasters Club Membership in Manhattan

Toastmasters is one of the greatest investments you can make in yourself. At Bryant Park Toastmasters we provide a safe environment to overcome fear, try new speaking tactics, or practice that upcoming sales presentation. Visit our website

MEETING TIME: Tuesday, 12:10pm to 1:15pm

VISITORS WELCOME: In order for you visit our club you need to register to this meeting and RSVP with your FULL NAME  AT MOST  SUNDA. Please arrive by Noon to allow extra time for security check-in.

** PHOTO ID a must!!

** Bring your confirmation email from a Bryant Park club member having added you to the security list is a must!! 


A Toastmasters Meeting always for follows the same agenda:

• Opening of the meeting by the president and presentation of the guests


• Welcoming by the Toastmaster of the Day and presentation of the watchtowers


• Speeches and Evaluations (up to 4)


• Club Business


• Table Topics Session - Guest can participate if they want to


• General Evaluation


• Closing of the meeting

** Do NOT bring any outside food to the shop.  La Casita sells refreshments & snacks. **

 

We are meeting at La Casita Yarn Store at 253 Smith St between Douglas & Degraw from 2-4pm. The Carroll Street F stop is the closest and the 57 bus stops at Douglass St.

The yarn store is small and cozy and has a cafe with yummy snacks, small meals and drinks - including wine and beer!  In order to support LaCasita, who generously hosts our weekly meeting, we ask that you buy something while attending.

As always with meetups, you'll probably want to leave your more complex projects at home...

Attendance for this meet up is limited to 10 people due to the size of the venue. Please be sure to RSVP if you plan to attend and change your RSVP if your plans change.

results.description:
Field Trip: HOLIDAY LIGHTS PHOTO WALK of 5th AVE: Tuesday 12/22/15 - 5 PM!

Join us at this Holiday Lights tour of 5th Avenue on Tuesday December 22 at 5 PM. We'll meet at the Apple store and walk and shoot our way down 5th Avenue.   Please be prompt as we start our tour at 5:10 PM.  Street decorations and all the major stores will be competing for our attention! Highlights include the windows at Bergdorf Goodman, Tiffany, Bulgari, Harry Winston, Saks as well as Rockefeller Center, the skating rink and the tree! Other locations include Lord & Taylor and Bryant Park and its skating rink and shopping area along 42nd St. Too crowded for tripods but the scenes are well lite and you'll be able to handhold your camera especially if you have a F2.8 or faster lens.  You will also probably have to use higher ISO's to be able to stop the lens down for good depth of field and use a decent hand holdable shutter speed; even better if your lens has IS or VR.  There are always great shots to be taken at this time of year. Hope to see you there, Ed.

RSVP at right.  


We can decide to meetup later and grab a bite to eat.


There is no charge for this event!

results.description:
Anime tuesdays are back. Rosario & Vampire will be playing on the two big screens. SUPERFIGHT card game! Walking dead Superfight & ANIME super fight.

We will also be playing two card games: Cards against humanity and the new game SUPER FIGHT card games. Those who aren't familar with the new cool superfight game, here is the video showing you how to play it:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oftjijhP-fs


____________________________________________

Meetup happy hour specials at Action Burger:

Meetup Happy hour specials:
3 shots for $5.
32oz rum and coke $10.
Buy a beer, get a free shot.
$20 Rum & coke, open bar for 2 hours. Unlimited 16oz rum and cokes for one person for two hours.
Cheese Burger fries & Soda $8. Comes with up to 5 of the free toppings.

_______________________________________________
See you there. Written rules for SuperFight:

SUPERFIGHT BASIC RULES

The Setup:
Separate the white-backed cards
(characters) and the black-backed cards
(attributes).

Youngest player goes first. Player one
starts by drawing three white cards and
three black cards. You can look at them,
but don’t let anyone else see them.
Player two (the next player to the left) does
the same.

Each player chooses one white card and
one black card from their hand to create a
fighter and places those cards face down.
Then they discard their remaining cards
into two separate piles (one for characters,
one for attributes).
Next, both players turn over their cards and
reveal their fighters.
Each player then draws a random black
card from the deck and adds it to their
fighter.

The Superfight:
Both players argue and plead their cases
about why their fighters would win the fight.
Once the arguing is done, the table votes
for a winner.

In the event of a tie, both players draw a
random white card and fight to the death
with no attributes. The table votes again. Do
this until there is a winner, then discard the
white cards from the tiebreaker fights.
The winning fighter stays on the table for
the next player to fight and will not get any
new attributes in the next fight. The player
who won the fight earns one point.

The Next Match:
Player three (the next player to the left) now
creates a fighter to battle the winner from
the last match, following the same rules for
fighter creation as in The Setup. Then The
Superfight begins again.

ALTERNATE RULES

Villain Battle:
Separate the white-backed cards
(characters) and the black-backed cards
(attributes).

Every player draws three white cards and
three black cards. You can look at them, but
don’t let anyone else see them. The least liked
person at the table takes the first turn
as the Villain.

The Villain chooses one white card and one
black card from their hand and places those
cards face up on the table. Then the Villain
draws one random black card from the
deck and adds it to their fighter.

All other players choose one white card and
one black card from their hands to create
fighters to defeat the Villain. When everyone
is ready, reveal the fighters one at a time and
announce them to the table. Starting with the
player to the left of the Villain, play an
additional black card from your hand onto
any fighter on the table (including the Villain
or yourself!) and then discard the rest of your
hand.

Next the Villain picks who would do the best
against his or her fighter. That fighter wins
the battle and gets one point.
The player to the left of the current Villain
becomes the new Villain. Every player draws
three new white cards and three new black
cards, and a new battle begins.

Battle Royale:

Separate the white-backed cards
(characters) and the black-backed cards
(attributes).

All players draw three white cards and three
black cards. You can look at them, but don’t
let anyone else see them. Each player places
one white card and one black card face
down on the table. One at a time, players
reveal their fighters and announce the
fighters to the table.

Before playing the second black card, select
one of the following game modes:

A) Each fighter’s second black card is drawn
randomly from the deck.

B) Players may play one additional black
card from their hands onto any fighter at
the table (including themselves).
Everyone votes on which fighter would be
the last one standing.

Pacifists:
Follow any of the rules outlined above, but
this time choose the winner based on who
is the funniest, or imagine it’s a dating
website and you’re picking the best match.
Pick who would be the best construction
worker, or nanny, or use your imagination!

Finally:
Unlike other judge-based games, this is not
anonymous. If a player is being biased, for
whatever dumb reason, never play with
that person again. They are lame, and
should go play charades with their cats
until they learn how to play with people.
Imagine the fighters are fighting on an
island or anywhere you want, but New York
is a good default.

results.description:
2016 is around the corner and it’s time for New Year resolutions! Let’s resolve to build an MVP for our potential products in 2016. Come with an idea for an app or project -- or join forces with someone who has one. Bring your laptops (with Meteor installed) and let’s kickstart those resolutions early.

*Thank you Tom and WeWork for sponsoring the event! *

AGENDA


6:00 pm  Food & Drinks sponsored by WeWork


6:15pm  “MVP Starter Kit”, Nitya Narasimhan.

Let’s look at a potential starter kit using Meteor, React and Material-UI. The kit should provide authentication/authorization, routing, data model support and form validation. We’ll also talk about deployment and testing options to explore.


7:00pm “1-minute Pitch Fest”, Christie Ewen.

Let’s take 1 minute to share our ideas for an app or startup we want to develop in 2016. We will provide a basic pitch template you can use.


7:30pm Hack Time

Clone and edit the starter repo, start hacking to incorporate your ideas. Join the Slack channel to share insights, ask questions and stay in touch on MVP progress in 2016.


8:00pm Wrap Up.

----


Facilitators:

Christie Ewen is the founder of Vitarch LLC, interested in education, bioinformatics, and communication.  She co-organizes for Kids Technology Lab, Meteor NY and PyLadies.

Nitya Narasimhan has been a Meteor advocate and developer since 2014 and is using Meteor for building the MVP at a Social Good startup. She also co-organizes the Meteor Hudson Valley meetup and Google Developer Group chapters in NYC and HV. She is currently interested in React, IoT, Polymer and CS Education for kids.

Recommended Preparation: 
* Install Meteor, git/github

results.description:
• Great intro to Arduino

• Shows some of the capabilities of the Arduino

• Self paced, ask questions as you play !

• Continue where you left off last Class 



This is a fully hands on class. Just connect your Arduino and we will walk through example code together. This class will focus on getting you up and running with Arduino quickly, so that you can begin to explore the world of Arduino on your own.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YCqFHuyT7qc

This class will be run using the Basic Kit by Sain Smart which can be purchased for $25.00, so you can continue to work on  projects at home.  See below for details. 

We can also provide you with a Sparkfun’s Inventor Kit which will be available for use during the session.

Examples & PDF can be found here: Zip file with PDF instructions & Example code with Data sheets

We will be walking through the following example codes


Circuit Examples:

Circuit 1: Blinking an LED

Circuit 2: Reading a Potentiometer

Circuit 3: Driving and RGB LED

Circuit 4: Driving Multiple LEDs

Circuit 5: Push Buttons

Circuit 6: Reading a Photo Resistor

Circuit 7: Reading a Temperature Sensor

Circuit 8: Driving a Servo Motor

Circuit 9: Using a Flex Sensor

Circuit 10: Reading a Soft Potentiometer

Circuit 11: Using a Buzzer

Circuit 12: Driving a Motor

Circuit 13: Using Relays

Circuit 14: Using a Shift Register

Circuit 15: Using an LCD

Circuit 16: Simon Says


Before the Workshop

Please bring your laptop. Arduino runs on Windows, Mac OSX, and Linux. Download the (free) Arduino software prior to the workshop from http://arduino.cc/en/Main/Software, and install as much as you can. Instructions at http://arduino.cc/en/Guide/HomePage

*A limited number of laptops will be provided if you choose not to bring your own.

*An Arduino kit will be provided for use during the workshop or you may bring your own. Purchase your own kit to take home, see details below.

If you have questions prior to or after the workshop please contact the instructor Brian Cook @  [masked]


We will also be selling small basic kits if you would like to purchase your own. Here are the kits we will have available. Please bring cash or check for the materials if you would like to purchase your own kit. Please RSVP with the specific board you would like so we can make sure enough kits are purchased. We have attached the link to the kits for more information and to take a look at what's included or specific specs for each kit.

Feel free to RSVP or comment with questions, comments or concerns.

Thank you

There are other ways to get to my place but I think this is the simplest since you only take the 7 train and walk straight down 89th street to my apartment.

This Improve with Improv workshop will focus on environment. Knowing where you are and being active in and responding to your environment enriches an actor's performance. Many actors and improvisers find themselves doing scenes in a void where there is no sense of place. In this workshop you will do exercises and scenes in specific environments and discover how it can inform your acting.

A fun safe and non-competitive environment is created in which each participant will learn how to work through inhibitions and tap into their imaginations.

results.description:
At this festive time of year, what better way to celebrate the good intentions of all faiths (as well as the noble thoughts of agnostic and atheistic philosophies), by doing something positive in accordance with our own vegan/vegetarian concern for animals. Our meetup group will have its own VEGAN ACTIVISM event in Union Square Park, where we will be distributing pamphlets in order to persuade people to go vegan.

In Union Square Park, we'll meet at the southwest corner of the park itself, right on the park block at E. 14th St. & Union Square West.  Look for the "Veg Meetup" sign.


This Dec. 22nd event will be outreach to the general public to promote and encourage a vegan diet & lifestyle. We will hand out literature in a welcoming manner so our audience will be open to seeing how great the benefits of veganism are for people, the non-human animals who share our world, and the planet itself.


We will meet at the designated location in Union Square at 6:30 pm (please arrive on time!). After a brief discussion on strategy and positioning of people, along with a few reminders for the group, we'll leaflet from 6:45 pm to 7:45 pm. Then our group will reassemble at the designated location and walk over to a nearby, all-vegan restaurant to have dinner, discuss our experiences and thoughts, and socialize.

We know that not everyone in our group is vegan, but on this day we will be promoting veganism. You are very welcome to join us even if you are not yet 100% vegan, but please understand that the literature we will hand out will promote a purely vegan lifestyle. Mostly on this day you will be handing out literature rather than talking to people, but if you do happen to speak with people, we are promoting a vegan diet and lifestyle for their tremendous benefits.

Where to meet: We will be meeting at the extreme southwest corner of Union Square Park, where Union Square West meets East 14th Street. We'll meet on the actual park block, right on the corner. You will see us holding a "VEG MEETUP" sign. We will meet right at 6:30pm. You may want to plan on being there early in order to be on time. Don't be late! We will talk for 15 minutes and then disburse to various nearby locations in the park.


We believe that grass-roots activism is vital in advancing the ideal, practice, and potential normalization of veganism in our world. So let's come together and do this, and also have fun while doing it!


Thank You All

Saurabh Dalal and David Greene

results.description:
Become the best damn hypnotist you can – Tuesday night* Practice Group

NEO-ERICKSONIAN HYPNOSIS PRACTICE GROUP – Join us for our regular on-going Practice Group and become the best damn hypnotist you can be!

*Every second and forth Tuesday evening of the month. Continues May 12th and 26th for 2 hours, 7 PM to 9 PM at the TRS Suites in New York City.

Each meeting will focus on something new or in need of practice so we can improve our skills and expand our range. We’ll watch videos of Milton Erickson in action and take the time to dissect them and really learn from them. You’ll learn and share new techniques. We’ll swap scripts. We’ll swap books and other media. Above all, we’ll PRACTICE and get GOOD.

One benefit you get from attending is the group support of learning. Last time we met we watched a couple of hours of a newly available DVD set called “In the Room with Milton Erickson.” It’s how Erickson taught Ericksonian Hypnosis. Up to maybe a dozen people would squeeze into his office and listen to him speak and watch him do demos. Now YOU can be in that room too. It’s pretty amazing, really, and SO instructive. I love it.

AND – it’s only $20 a night! (Amazing deal.)

Open to graduates of Doug’s NLP or Hypnosis trainings or students who have received similar training from other reputable training centers.

TUESDAY evening, May 12th

TRS Professional Suite, 40 Exchange Place, New York City, NY

7:00pm – 9:00pm

* NOTE – Please arrive EARLY so we can start at 7:00


CLICK HERE - ONLY $20 (via PayPal)

Doug O'Brien
Certified Master Practitioner and Trainer of Neuro-Linguistic Programming; Ericksonian Hypnotherapist
</a><a href="http://www.dougobrienhypnosis.com/">http://www.dougobrienhypnosis.com
http://www.ericksonian.com

As a Hypnotherapist, Doug helped found the Department of Complementary Medicine at Columbia Presbyterian Hospital in the mid-nineties, under Dr. Mehmet Oz. Doug worked directly with pre-operative and post-operative patients on stress management and pain reduction as well as long term behavioral change to generate healthy living.

Doug O'Brien, is an NLP Master Trainer - originally given that designation by Anthony Robbins over 20 years ago - and is called a modern Shaman by some. He is also a musician and composer and a Trance Master Guide.

He is the guy who gave Tony Robbins an insight that completely changed Tony's approach to his second book (it was going to be called "The Niagara Syndrome" and became, instead, "Awaken the Giant Within")

Doug is the guy who has been the success coach to two of the top internet marketers in the country as well as corporate executives, top musical artists, fashion designers and professional athletes.

He has helped literally tens of thousands of people quit smoking in one session.
He has helped similar numbers lose weight and keep it off through the power of Hypnosis.

He can help YOU, too.

Endorsements/Testimonials
“I have attended all three of Doug’s Trance Night sessions. Each experience has been extremely powerful with noticeable results and the impact has lasted. I am definitely looking forward to attending the future Trance Nights.”
– Jackie

results.description:
There are new rules and <a>regulations</a> concerning the Tuesday <a>night</a> games. Please scroll down and read them all before signing up for the event.


There may not be space for you if you don't.


<a>Table</a> Top Role <a>Playing</a> Game Night!


This is the official <a>RPG game</a> night of the NY SciFi/Fan Meetup Group.

Every Tuesday night we get together to indulge in <a>Table Top RPGs</a>. There are <a>multiple games</a> going on at once, so getting involved in a game is <a>easy</a>.


For those of you unfamiliar with the term, a Table Top RPG (Role <a>Playing</a> Game) is a type of game where the players create characters based on the  story/system available and one person acts as a storyteller. Everyone interacts and works together to <a>create a story</a> and have a few laughs as well.


New Rules for Signing Up:


How to <a>sign up</a>: There will be at leas two <a>games running</a> each week.  You will be able to see who is running, what games are being <a>played</a>, and who is <a>playing</a> below. There will be a total of six spots <a>open</a> in each game, so if a game has filled up you will not be able to join that game. 


When you <a>sign up</a>, leave a comment stating which game you would like to participate in and your name will be added to the roster. If you would like to leave a game or switch over to another game in <a>progress</a>, simply speak to Justin or Cat. They will let you know if there is <a>open</a> space to do so.


If it is your first time <a>attending</a> a game, we have pre-made characters for you to <a>select</a> from. Beginning on your third RPG event, you may choose to make an original character for whatever game you're currently participating in.


Can I run my own game?: If you would like to run your own game, please contact Justin or Cat to reserve a slot.


Need Dice?: Please bring yours if you have some if you need extra I will provide some.

Games Currently Running:

Jutin: Full Steam Ahead 

A new steampunk-inspired RPG by Justin.

Cat: Monster of the Week

A game of investigating and fighting the things that go bump in the night. This campaign is set in a fictional California city a few years after WWII

Current Roster:

Liz

Joseph

Mike

Alden
results.name: NY SciFi & Fantasy Tabletop Role Playing and Game Night

Hope to see YOU at the movies!   Love, Cassie


Ok who LOVES the movies as much as me? Who has a limited entertainment budget like me? LOL Well this is the event for YOU!

My local theater has discount Tuesday every week and if you sign up online they will even send you a coupon for the concession stand, each week a different one (this weeks is free small popcorn with a drink purchase). They also have those awesome new reclining seats! And you get to choose and pay for your seat in advance so there is no rushing in at the last minute and sitting in the front row and straining your neck!  Here is the link to the theater for more details: http://www.cinemark.com/theatre-detail.aspx?node_id=83854

If you purchase tickets online and can’t make it to the theater, just respond to the email address you receive the confirmation email from ([masked]) and they can refund the payment remotely.

So here is how it's going to work each week. I will choose a movie when the new schedule goes out (Thur/Fri) and choose the movie and showtime. I will buy my seat online and post what row and number. Those of you who wish to join me can buy your seat near me. There are two ways to buy seats: 1) online in advance is your best bet but there is a $1.25 service fee per ticket unless you buy a gift card at the theater and pre-load it. 2) At the theater no service fee but you really need to driver there in advance if you want seats near us. OR you can just show up that night and sit wherever there is space available.

 Hope to see YOU at the movies!!  Love, Cassie

if you can't make it, no need to post why. We understand and will catch you next time!

results.description:
Maximize your potential with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your FALL with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call 

<a>[masked]</a>

.- numbers may not show- phone number in words:

-nine-zero-eight-three-zero-three-five-zero-three-one-


Looking forward to training with you!

results.description:
Friends,

It is that time of year in New York. Come and join us for our Holiday Lights Tour. We will check out all the amazing lights display in Midtown Manhattan.

From mechanical window displays, synchronized light and sound shows, Santa Claus, toy soldiers, Snoopy and lots more.

Apart from walking during the tour, we will also use the NYC subway.

Some of the venues  include:

Rockefeller Center Christmas Tree

Macy's Department Store

Bergdorf Goodman 

and lots more.

We will meet in front of Hotel Pennsylvania from 7pm. The tour will start at 7:30pm. (2 hours duration)

After the tour the group will go for dinner and drinks.

You are also welcome to invite your friends and colleagues to this event.

This tour is absolutely free.

Please bring your subway metro card and your holiday smile :)

Contact us if you have further questions.

Cheers,

Events Organizer,

Rory

results.description:
Let's meet for a coffee, study, & practice Korean. It will be $2 to attend this language event. Absolute beginners are welcome!
**If you are Korean & want to practice your English you should come. You can explain Korean words, culture & phrases in English to Americans!**

Phrases & vocab we learned last week:

Hello! (Ahn young ha say oh!)
What? (Mo?)
Where? (OH. DEE. YEAH. YO)
It wasn't me (Na ani ya)
Do you wanna die!? (Chu gu let?!)
Lettuce (sahnkchu)
Egg (get on)
Nice weather (Nal shee chota)
Hungry (Pego pah)

We also learned some slang and phrases too inappropriate for this humble event description.

Please sign up only if you are serious about coming. We have a 3 strikes rule. Write what you speak & what you are learning!
results.name: KOREAN Night, Coffee in KTown, study & practice time!

results.description:
Big City Invites You To Our


Spiking/Serving/Setting Clinic - OPEN TO ALL SKILL LEVELS

This Adult Chirstmas week clinic is open to ALL skill levels and will focus on three of the more dramatic shots in the game of volleyball.  Everybody wants to serve aces or win a point with a powerful spike from a great set!  

Click below to Register

http://www.bigcityvolleyball.com/page/christmas-adult-spiking-serving-setting-clinic


Serving - Players will practice proper serving techniques, focusing on footwork and arm movement to make consistent contact with the ball.

Spiking - In addition to developing proper arm swing and footwork, players will learn how to approach different kinds of sets, focusing on ball placement from all positions on the court.

Setting - learn to develop clean and consistent sets in this class. Drills will also focus on helping setters put their team in the best position to attack plus we will work on court awareness and footwork.

Date: Tuesday December 22nd

Time:  7pm-10pm

Location: High School For Environmental Studies (444 West 56th Street btw 9th & 10th Avenues)

Cost: $25
results.name: Spiking/Serving/Setting Clinic - OPEN TO ALL SKILL LEVELS

Are you game for something new? Do you enjoy playing Board Games? Here is your chance to join up to 50 members in the ultimate smackdown of Board Game dominance. 

This is our last one of the year so don't miss it! Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/boardgame/dates/Dec-09-2015_at_0700PM

We'll have up to 20 teams (2-3 players each) competing in Taboo, Charades and Pictionary. The top teams will then compete in a sudden death version of Jenga. Winning team takes all! Prizes include tickets to shows/events.

You can either come alone and be placed with a partner or you can sign up with a guest. It is not meant to be gender balanced or age/ethnic specific.  

*Prepay Only Event (No tickets sold at door): 

$15 for 1 ticket - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/boardgame/dates/Dec-09-2015_at_0700PM

$28 for 2 tickets (use discount code "2" at checkout)    

*RSVPing alone will not get you into this event. You must also purchase a ticket in advance (NO tix will be sold at door). 

Multiple Meetup groups are co-organizing so don't just go by the RSVPs you see here. Up to 50 members attending. 

Get tickets at this link - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/boardgame/dates/Dec-09-2015_at_0700PM

results.description:
Our Tuesday night Central Park training workouts are typically tempo runs or hill repeats.  These workouts are usually very well attended with a wide variety of paces.

The meeting spot is at the 72nd street transverse by Bethesda Fountain. There we'll give the full workout details, including distance, pacing groups, expected run time, and where we plan on meeting at the end. You can expect a typical workout to be between 5 and 8 miles (or less during hill workouts).

A note on warm ups: We do not do a full warm up as a group in Central Park, so we encourage you to show up at 7 p.m. having jogged an easy mile or two ahead of time.

If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage
results.how_to_find_us: We meet on 72nd transverse at the point that overlooks Bethesda Fountain
results.name: Central Park Training Run

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Join Irma StarSpirit Woman & The NY Shamanic Circle, at our Annual Winter Solstice Event at the Open Center on Tuesday, Dec. 22 at 7pm - 10 pm
SIGN-UP TODAY!

Come celebrate one of the most powerful moments in the annual cycle with a fire ceremony, drumming, music, songs and movements. As our ancient ancestors did, we will honor the rebirth of Tata Inti (Father Sun) from the depth of the longest, darkest nights in recognition of our own struggles to overcome our shadows and mirror within ourselves the triumphant return of the light that empowers our Spirit. 

<a>Register with the Open Center: Details</a>

22 E 30th St, New York, NY 10016

Note: A $5 materials fee will be paid to instructor for materials (candles, etc.). Bring a rattle, drum and candle.No previous shamanic experience necessary. 

AN EVENING EVENT Tuesday, December 22, 7–10pm 15FSH10M Members: $40 / Nonmembers: $45 Location: New York Open Center

 ______________________________________________________________________Happy Solstice! from NYSC Core Members—Itzhak, Irma, Sage, Andrea, Jacques, Karen, Cristina Maria, JD & Susana

results.description:
Tech Tuesday is Hack Manhattan’s weekly general interest open house. Don’t worry, it’s not just about technology—any kind of project is welcome.

Tech Tuesday is the perfect opportunity to visit Hack Manhattan and check out what it’s all about.

Bring a project and get to work, drink a homebrew beer, hang out, and draw on advice from our wonderful community. All visitors are strongly encouraged to bring a project to work on, or at least a laptop.

If you want to join Hack Manhattan as a member, we expect you to have visited us at least thrice before applying.

Find out more about Hack Manhattan at our website, hackmanhattan.com. Not everyone can come in every Tuesday, so most of the community happens on our mailing list.

Note: The last Tuesday of the month is our monthly business meeting. It usually lasts less than 30 minutes.
results.how_to_find_us: We’re on the second floor of the building in the far end
results.name: Tech Tuesday Open House at Hack Manhattan

group.who: Students of A Course in Miracles

results.description:
******PLEASE NOTE: WE ARE MEETING AT A NEW VENUE FROM NOW ON, TGI FRIDAYS ON AUSTIN STREET******


Join us for our weekly Boardgaming Meetup.

We're a friendly group of gamers that play everything from Carcassonne & Ticket to Ride to Zombicide & heavier Eurogames! Everyone is welcome - all ages (must be over 21) but must be young at heart!

If you don't recognize the games, don't worry, everyone is happy to teach new players the rules.

We usually go for about 3-4 hours but people drop in any time and leave when they need to. If you're looking for a chill, fun way to spend a Tuesday night - come!

To support our gracious hosts, please purchase a bite to eat or a few drinks (soda is fine!).

If anyone has a specific game they wish to play, feel free to ask. I am sure between us all, we should have it.

We also have a Facebook group. Everyone in the Meetup is welcome. Just click the link and ask to join. Someone will add you once they can.

Forest Hills Board Gamers Facebook Group
results.name: Tuesday Night Weekly Game Night at TGIF

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
Sun 1 – 2 pm (12 – 1 pm on 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles
results.how_to_find_us: CRS is located one block east of Broadway and one and a half blocks south of Union Square, above Think Coffee shop.
results.name: Walk-In Spiritual Healing Clinic

results.description:
Come with your intentions and questions and journey to find the answers. This will be an open Journey where you come with you own needs and plans. We will open our sacred circle, introduce ourselves and share our goals. Then we will journey for 20 minutes and search our sacred pathways for our own answers.

We will then gather again as a community the support each other and hold space for each other.

Admittance $10
results.name: Shamanic Journey Night

results.description:
For those who attend meet ups a lot, we will be charging a $50 Monthly fee and you can attend all the meet ups you like, we will Definitely have every Tuesday & Thursdays 7-8:30PM & Fridays 8-930 PM Weekend slots will Vary & Monday, & Wednesdays  will be added once we get more members attending. NO CONTRACT NO REGISTRATION pay the months you attend! unlimited soccer $50 (First 20 people to sign up only)

Want to play soccer, burn some energy? Release some stress? Play the sport you LOVE? Then come join us at SOCCER R US Indoor soccer facility, catering services to all you soccer players! COED PICK UP SOCCER. Come experience an awesome YEAR ROUND Indoor soccer facility in Brooklyn NEW YORK. Prospect Park train station on the Q OR B Train or S shuttle. Buses close by are the B41, 43, 16, 48 &  49


Indoor Soccer Facility with Real Turf Right by Prospect Park (Elevator available for bike riders)

FUTSAL In the Morning Before Work, During Lunch and Late Evenings

MUST RSVP ONLINE

You can RSVP for multiple players until slots are filled. 

Start time Vary So stay Tuned and look out for the time slots that suit you best

Real Turf, Please wear flats. 2 flights upstairs from entrance door or take elevator to 3rd floor

No goalies, so NO GOALKEEPING 

We will play 10-minute round-robin matches (winners stay on). There will be 3 teams of 5 players (4 and a sub). First team to score 3 goals wins the match. Winners must continue to win to stay on. Consecutive tied matches will be decided by coin flip. 

 Absolutely no Slide tackling is allowed. 

Please understand that in order to keep this meet-up active, we must enforce a No Fighting policy. Anyone fighting will be removed from the group.

That's it. So, let's do this! For any questions please contact me via Meet-up.
results.how_to_find_us: Text or call 7187348469
results.name: Play Indoor soccer (Real Turf)

venue.name: Trend Coffee and Tea House LLC

results.description:
Come join the NJ Young Sierans' Club, Nice in New Jersey, NJ/NY Writers & Artists, Let's Hang Out New Jersey, and Montclair Friends for a night of good friends, fun games, great conversation, and creative fun.  In addition to comfy couches and awesome tea, Trend invites us to bring our own board games, has an open mic performance stage, has FREE WIFI in their store that works very well, so please come with laptops if you'd like.

We hope to see you there!

7:00 - Socialize and meet each other
7:20 - Introductions
7:30 - Join us in gaming, socializing some more, writing, drawing, working, or just continue to chat

WHERE: Trend Cafe, Bloomfield Avenue, Montclair, NJ. 

Writers & Artists Session (for those interested)

Meets every week - if interested in joining up with our weekly writers and artists group, they meet here tonight too, and will be joining in for the fun!  You'll feel better showing up because you'll make friends and get something done. No one will see what you've done , or give you unsolicited advice.  Shut Up and Write! (or illustrate) is a place to create in the company of others on a regular basis. Writing (and art), whether as a profession or as a hobby, is an isolating activity.  We provide these meetings as a way of developing a community of creative people. We welcome people who are serious about their craft, or just having trouble staying focused or looking to get started, and are looking for the companionship of other writers.

It's always an empowering and rewarding experience. You will see progress in your writing or creative project with friends and while having fun.  After everyone's socialized and had a nice time getting to know each other for about half an hour, the facilitator will lead introductions and possibly discuss personal creative successes such as getting published or overcoming resistance in some small way.  No critiquing, exercises, lectures, ego, competition or feeling guilty.

Suggested Donation:   $1 to help cover meetup costs.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll have a meetup sign
results.name: Great tea, coffee, games, unplugged performances, writers, and artists!

group.name: Young Sierra Club - Socials, Arts & Outings!

Spice is a popular Thai restaurant with multiple locations in New York City, featuring an affordable and solid menu with a lot of choices. We will be going to the location in Union Square.

Everyone will order their own food, and payment will be calculated based on what you ordered plus 30% (about 10% for tax and 20% for tip since we are a large group) and a meet up fee of $3.00. Since restaurants sometimes limit the number of credit cards that they are willing to take, please bring cash if you can in order to facilitate the transaction. Hope to see you there!

results.description:
Explore some of the most interesting styles of beers on Earth with our Belgium beer class! From lambics to saisons, the Belgians have been brewing creative and unique beers for centuries. If you don't like ordinary "beer," then sign up for this class!

Highlights of this 1-Hour Beer Class experience include:

- Tastings of lambics, gueuzes, saisons, and much more. 
- Tips and advice on how to taste beers and differentiate between them. 
- Learning about the history of beer, brewing, and how beer is categorized. 
- Instruction on the art of open fermentation.

And so much more!

More info and tickets: https://goo.gl/nEBNO0

Sparkling and Dessert Wines.

Standard procedure.

Bring a bottle and/or an appetizer.  Ballpark spending for both together is $40 + a little for the location.


Or you can bring me the cash, and I'll do all the work for you.

I'll get some cheese appetizers; and a wonderful sparkler. 


Ice wines are great.

Sauternes, YUM!


Admittedly, the word "yum" appears very rarely in either Wine Spectator or Wine Enthusiast magazine, but it's appropriate.


I'll have some music. 

RSVP Letting me know if you need anything.  I'll be checking as I shop.

results.description:
We'll meet just inside the park entrance at 52nd St. and 39th Dr. at 7:00 p.m. for our 3.4-mile loop around Woodside, Sunnyside, and parts of LIC. You can run at your own comfortable pace and know that we'll never leave you behind.

We usually head to a local pub for beverages and/or snacks afterward, so bring some cash if you'd like hang out after the run.

For our evening runs, we will wait up to 10 minutes to allow for late arrivals. This can mean we will wait for 2 minutes or 10. Please be prompt.

As always, if you have any comments, ideas, or suggestions, please let us know!

results.description:
How often do we take the time to really focus on releasing all the tension and stress that we accumulate in our body?

Not very.

Instead, we just keep on trucking, hoping it all will magically disappear.

But we know that won't be the case unless we do something about it.

Enter Osho's powerful Kundalini meditation, a kind of active meditation specifically designed for modern life that helps us to release stress and unblock our energy.

Comprised of 15 minutes of shaking, 15 minutes of dancing, 15 minutes of stillness (sitting or standing), and 15 minutes of silence (shavasana), this meditation is a really amazing way to shake everything off, get past self-doubts and limiting beliefs.

Because it's both invigorating and relaxing, it gets us out of our mind and reminds us of how incredibly good being an embodied being can feel like when we get out of our way. 

This practice creates a release of pent up emotions, tension and blockages in the body, and it's energizing, uplifting and calming at the same time. It's often a really amazing way to make room for inspiration because once those doubts are removed, creativity flows like whoa!


Join us every other Tuesday as we shake it all off, and leave it on the floor.


Shake It All Off! Active Meditation for Tension Release and Well-Being

Tuesday December 22, 7-8:30 pm

580 Broadway, Suite 510 (Manhattan)

$10 donation

Register


NOTE: in order to cover costs, this event requires at least 5 people to be signed up per date 24 hrs prior for it to happen. Please RSVP mindfully so I know what size room to book for us in advance.



---------------------------------------------------------------------------------


"After attending Melody’s “Shake It Off” and “Embodiment” workshops, not only was my personal way of relating to my physical, mental, and spiritual enhanced, but it motivated me to seek out entire aspects of the human condition that have supported my growth as a social worker deeply. Prior to working with Melody, I had been enamored with the mind and aspects of intelligence that caused me to completely disconnect from my body; I did not take care of it, and it did not take care of me. I feel so fortunate to have experientially learned with Melody’s guidance, that the body holds many of the keys to inner peace, whether for my self or my clients."

Abbi K., New York, NY


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

MELODY KIERSZ

Melody Kiersz wants you to stop trying to prove yourself worthy and start living the life that makes you happy.

Melody holds a degree in Happiness from the prestigious New York University, is a Certified Holistic Health Counselor graduated from the Institute for Integrative Nutrition, a member of the American Association of Drugless Practitioners, and a Certified Yoga Teacher through Jungle Yoga Ashram.

Melody is a deep listener and reads between the lines to guide you in discovering the ways you're holding yourself back from your true expression. She specializes in healing our relationship with our bodies, our selves and others, improving body image and self-esteem, increasing our ability to speak up, share, and allow ourselves to be seen and loved as we are. As the Founder of Naked Wellness, her goal is to guide you as you peel all those layers of resistance so you can turn yourself on for a life full of health, passion, power, freedom, joy and pleasure.

Based in New York City, Melody offers in-person and long-distance private sessions, and is really passionate about everyone really getting that they are absolutely perfect exactly as they are.

She can be reached at <a>[masked]</a>.
results.name: Shake it all off! Active Meditation for Tension Release and Well-Being

results.description:
Explore some of the most interesting styles of beers on Earth with our Belgium beer class! From lambics to saisons, the Belgians have been brewing creative and unique beers for centuries.

Unrestricted by the German beer purity law, Belgium beer was unique in that it has always incorporated fruits, herbs, sugars, and various other flavors into the brewing process. Coupled with an open fermentation process, the results are both surprising and innovative.

If you don't like ordinary "beer," then sign up for this class!

More info and tickets: https://goo.gl/wBLtOL

results.description:
Since Christmas Eve falls on our regular Thursday meeting, I thought we'd move this one to Tuesday.


Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! We'll be in the cafe. Look for our red Meetup sign. Please feel free to arrive late or leave early. It's great if you can RSVP in advance, but in case you can't, come anyway.

As a reminder, this group has two goals. The first is to explore the relationship between happiness and goodness. The second, much more fun, goal is for us to become much happier just by getting together and talking about happiness. The theory behind this second goal comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll often have set topics, like gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group, and those are our goals. It's also very, very important that we have fun. With that in mind, let's get ready to get good and happy!

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

results.description:
In this group, you'll learn new ways of communicating in order to share more vulnerably and openly, bring attention more fully to the present in order to discover the richness of whats happening in relationship with others, and begin to see and co-explore aspects of yourself you may have been unaware of before in service of greater self-understanding, expression and awareness. You'll have the opportunity to learn and use new tools to participate in circles by sharing yourself, understanding others, and growing in both enjoyment of and capacity for presence and deep connection.

The more Ive seen people Circle the more genuine, " in the moment" conversations Ive seen become possible for them.

Likewise, the more Ive seen them become comfortable in their own skin, get clear on what their feeling, wanting or needing in any moment, grow in a sense of presence and natural interest in others, and generally embody a deep capacity for presence and authenticity.

If connecting profoundly with others, developing present moment awareness, and learning new communication skills inspires you, come try Circling out! The cost is $20

To ensure a full experience for everyone, the meetup will start promptly at 7:00. Please arrive no later then 6:55 to set up and be ready to begin.

results.description:
Masterminds

Happy Holidays from Business Model Generation,

It has been a good year for startups in Brooklyn/NYC and even better for the acceptance of the Business Model Canvas as a part of an Entrepreneur's toolbox.  The Business Model Generation Workshop was founded 2 years ago with the simple goal of introducing the collaborative dynamics of the Canvas to Brooklyn and the NYC business community at-large.

Organic growth is not easy, yet the Business Model Generation Workshop stands at approx. 950 members in just two years.  Devoid of fanfare, our DIY approach puts the participants in control of shaping their future business endeavors.  A sampling of this year's results include:

• Steve Pipenger launched his own disruptive entrepreneurial focused law practice

• Mark Seward founded ValueCrunch

• Brian C. is actively designing a new business model for the independent film industry

• A host of Intrapreneurs became canvas sketch artists

As you can see, there is much to celebrate.  This month marks the Workshops second anniversary so come out, business cards in hand, and celebrate the Season with your fellow Masterminds at our Annual Holiday Mixer.  We look forward to seeing some old friends and new faces.

Place:  Superfine (www.superfine.ny)

Address: 170 Front St DUMBO/ Brooklyn

Date:  December 22

Time:  7pm - 9pm

Directions:  2 minutes from York St stop (F)

Co-leading the Workshop has been a rewarding experience and we are looking forwarding to a prosperous and innovative New Year.

Stephen & Dan

ps...

You can learn more about the book, methodology, author, and the Canvas :

>> here <<

results.description:
Come join the NJ Young Sierans' Club, Nice in New Jersey, NJ/NY Writers & Artists, Let's Hang Out New Jersey, and Montclair Friends for a night of good friends, fun games, great conversation, and creative fun.  In addition to comfy couches and awesome tea, Trend invites us to bring our own board games, has an open mic performance stage, has FREE WIFI in their store that works very well, so please come with laptops if you'd like.

We hope to see you there!

7:00 - Socialize and meet each other
7:20 - Introductions
7:30 - Join us in gaming, socializing some more, writing, drawing, working, or just continue to chat

WHERE: Trend Cafe, Bloomfield Avenue, Montclair, NJ. 

Writers & Artists Session (for those interested)

Meets every week - if interested in joining up with our weekly writers and artists group, they meet here tonight too, and will be joining in for the fun!  You'll feel better showing up because you'll make friends and get something done. No one will see what you've done , or give you unsolicited advice.  Shut Up and Write! (or illustrate) is a place to create in the company of others on a regular basis. Writing (and art), whether as a profession or as a hobby, is an isolating activity.  We provide these meetings as a way of developing a community of creative people. We welcome people who are serious about their craft, or just having trouble staying focused or looking to get started, and are looking for the companionship of other writers.

It's always an empowering and rewarding experience. You will see progress in your writing or creative project with friends and while having fun.  After everyone's socialized and had a nice time getting to know each other for about half an hour, the facilitator will lead introductions and possibly discuss personal creative successes such as getting published or overcoming resistance in some small way.  No critiquing, exercises, lectures, ego, competition or feeling guilty.

Suggested Donation:   $1 to help cover meetup costs.

results.description:
Please Join us on December 22nd

Guest Teacher


Irene Edelmann

We are fortunate to have Irene Edelmann visit with us and share her experience at two Bearing Witness Retreats.

Irene has participated in training for Council groups and for assisting in Bearing Witness Retreats.

This year, she had the honor of attending the Native American Bearing Witness Retreat in the Black Hills of South Dakota, as well as receiving a scholarship for the Auschwitz/Birkenau Bearing Witness Retreat in Poland.

Irene Edelmann is a member of the Zen Peacemaker Order, and has been studying Buddhism for many years. As a Community Psychiatric/Mental Health Nurse, Irene tries to practice compassionate awareness and action in her work, and has an interest in Intergenerational and Historical Trauma as it relates to Native American people.

A grateful member of the Hudson River Zen Center and White Plains Zen, Irene also feels connected to Native American spirituality and Tibetan Buddhism.

Irene took refuge with Khenpo Pema Wangdak, and has a Tibetan Dharma name of Ngawang Kalsang Dolkar.

Please join us!

Questions or comments? Contact us at:
E-Mail: [masked]
website: whiteplainszen.org
<a>[masked]</a>

St. Bartholmew's Church
82 Prospect St.
White Plains, NY 10606

results.description:
WHAT: ice skating with the optional bite to eat afterwards.

WHERE: Winter Village rink at Bryant Park (the park is located in the square block between Fifth and Sixth Avenues and between 41st and 42nd Streets in Midtown Manhattan) WHEN: Tuesday, December 22, 2015 at 7:30 PM COST: Skating is free if you have your own skates, otherwise there is a charge for skate rentals $19 (if you came last time- the price went up to $19 after Nov 20th)
Lockers are free if you have your own lock, to buy a lock there it cost $9;
There is an option to check your bag, it costs $8-$10 depending on bag size.
So in reality your cost will depend on whether you have your own skates, your own lock, and whether you bring a bag or not. (There is also a skate sharpening service for $20.)

THE PLAN
The plan is to arrive at around 7:30 PM (you can arrive later if you need to) to meet up in the lobby, i will come prepared this time with a name tag on my jacket.
Hit the ice around 7:45 and skate until around 9:00 or so and head to someplace to eat if there is interest.


IMPORTANT FRIENDLY TIPS
-Leave extra baggage at home.
-If you have your own lock, bring it and save yourself the lock purchase fee.
-There is a safety rule against skating with any type of bag on, including backpacks, which is strictly enforced by the staff on the rink.
-Bring your friends!

For more information about Bryant park and Olympic pita:

http://www.nycgovparks.org/facilities/iceskating/3

http://www.bryantpark.org/things-to-do/wintervillage.html


I hope you can join us!
