results.description:
http://photos3.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/5/6/b/b/event_7042203.jpegCome join your peers from Westchester County and the surrounding areas (hello Bronx, Connecticut, Orange and Putnam Counties) in a lively, friendly, facilitated discussion group for men, women, genderqueer, transgender, and not-quite-sure people, as well as people who fall on different places along the monogamous to polyamorous dimension, as long as you inhabit the space between totally straight and totally gay somewhere (i.e., bisexual, bi-curious, questioning, queer, “I don’t label myself,” bi-friendly or some other non-monosexual identity).

People who wish to understand their bisexual loved ones are also welcome.

This group is for people over 18. It is NOT a hook-up group. As the name says, we meet to talk about bisexual issues. People whose behavior makes other group members uncomfortable will be asked to leave.

The group meets at The LOFT, the LGBTQ safe space in White Plains, Westchester County, New York at 7:30 PM on the 2nd and 4th Tuesdays of every month.

Even if you can't always make it to the group meetings in person, please join us on line, ask questions, chat, make some "net-friends" and keep up with what is happening in the Westchester County and surrounding bisexual community.
results.name: 4th Tuesday Westchester Bisexual Discussion & Support Group

results.description:
ПРИГЛАШАЕМ ВСЕХ ЛЮБИТЕЛЕЙ АКТИВНОГО ОБРАЗА ЖИЗНИ В СПОРТИВНУЮ СЕКЦИЮ ПО БАДМИНТОНУ!!!

Проведите время весело и с пользой! Сами, вместе с детьми. Вспомните, как играли на пляже, во дворе, на даче... А здесь - с опытным инструктором, по - настоящему.


Возможно, в вашей жизни не хватает чего-то?

Бадминтон даст вам не только хорошую физическую форму! Вы заведете новых друзей, избавитесь от стресса, утолите спортивный азарт и сможете выплеснуть всю накопившуюся негативную энергию на бадминтонном корте. Особенно это важно для нас, жителей столицы мира, где ритм жизни особенно высок и нервные перегрузки стали привычным делом. 

Обеспечиваем ракетками и воланами. 


Немного о Бадминтоне.


Настоящий спортивный бадминтон по своей идеологии напоминает восточные единоборства со всеми их контрастами - жестким давлением и мягкой уступчивостью, гибкой хитростью и настырной агрессивностью, взрывными безудержными атаками и затяжными розыгрышами волана. Но при этом вместо обмена тяжелыми неприятными ударами - опосредованное взаимодействие партнеров через легкий волан. Поэтому не случайно бадминтон приобрел колоссальную популярность и распространение в азиатских странах.

Спортивные историки сходятся во мнении, что некое подобие игры в бадминтон (состязание с воланом) существовало несколько тысячелетий назад в ряде регионов мира: Греции, Китае, Японии, Индии и странах Африки.

Однако корни бадминтона в его современном виде уходят в Индию, где эта игра называлась «роопа». Ее правила были предельно просты: дети с ракетками в руках вставали в круг и перебрасывали друг другу пробку с воткнутыми в нее перьями. Целью игры было продержать волан в воздухе как можно дольше.


Занятия проходят  вечером по Вторникам и Четвергам  .  

Записаться и получить дополнительную информацию можно по тел.

<a>[masked]</a>

маил:

[masked]

сайт клуба:

www.brooklynbadmin.com

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

results.description:
The Trans-Pacific Partnership text is now officially available.

It's NOT a done deal!

It's even worse than was feared. Some of the leaked chapters have been re-written to make them worse for all of us. TPP will override clean air laws, clean water laws, the endangered species act, fracking bans, food labeling laws, food safety laws, indigenous rights, and labor rights. It will take away generic drugs, internet freedom, banking reforms, renewable energy goals and hundreds of other hard-won freedoms and protections.

Opposition is from democrats, republicans, liberals and conservatives. So is support.

I'll have a panel of experts, which is still in formation. Pete Dolack from www.tradejustic.net will be talking about local opposition. Patrick Woodall, Research Director/Senior Policy Advocate of Food & Water Watch have confirmed so far.

The full text is available on:
http://www.mfat.govt.nz/Treaties-and-International-Law/01-Treaties-for-which-NZ-is-Depositary/0-Trans-Pacific-Partnership-Text.php

This is from Public Citizen, long-time activists against TPP:
TAKE ACTION NOW: Please urge your Congress members to vote NO on the TPP. <http://org.salsalabs.com/dia/track.jsp?v=2&c=Yf6X3LVPs7c8AFYqLdkaXqDM%2BESiMGhE>;;

Environment TV has several videos of varying lengths and detail, including a music video:
http://theenvironmenttv.com/?s=TPP

This is from Food and Water Watch:
http://www.foodandwaterwatch.org/news/tpp-text-reveals-broad-new-powers-attack-food-safety-food-labeling-laws

This is from National Sierra Club (includes links):
http://www.sierraclub.org/trade/trans-pacific-partnership

A Huffington Post article:
http://www.huffingtonpost.com/dave-johnson/what-to-look-for-when-the_b_8473562.html

Here is a compilation of press releases from many groups and news articles:
http://www.flushthetpp.org/tpp-text-released-11515-media-coverage-and-press-releases/.
results.name: An hour of TPP info on the radio

results.description:
How signing up works: There are 4 spots besides myself for this meetup.

Please sign up on the waitlist. After 24 hours, if there are less than or equal to 4 people (excluding myself) signed up I will move everyone to the going list and afterwards signing up will be like normal. If there are more than 4 people, I will give priority to those who have previously been on the waitlist and were not able to attend a prior meetup. 

The Place:

As Zagat reports: “Not your run-of-the-mill Greek”, this “more upscale” East Villager offers “unbeatable” cuisine that’s “lovingly prepared” and “well priced” for the quality; with a “wonderful” team overseeing a “memorable” space boasting a ceiling lined with terra-cotta pots, it’s a “real find.”

http://www.pylosrestaurant.com/


RSVPs:


Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event.

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I always give priority to people on the waitlist if spots open up. If there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will try to get more seats, although for reservations made far in advance I am unlikely to be able to do so. At very least it will let me know what kinds of restaurants are popular so I can schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.
results.name: Pylos - Greek Food

results.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_T-p7GKzWiQ

This time of year brings a special energy to the Tuesday Night Open Jazz Jam at Crossroads. Something about the season seems to bring out the best musicians and the finest vocalists.


As far as the menu, bring an appetite: the Creole-themed menu will take you straight to the heart of Louisiana. (grilled alligator tail anyone?)


There is no cover charge and beers are just $2.50 (I believe you have to purchase these at the bar, as table service prices are a bit higher.)

NOTE: The jam starts at 9pm and runs clear through to midnight or later, but you do not have to stay the whole time. I generally leave around 11pm, but I'll stick around with anyone who wants to stay a bit longer.

** Location **

Crossroads is located on North Ave (Route 28) in Garwood, between Cranford and Westfield. Here's an exterior shot to help you identify it. 

If you're driving west on North Ave from Cranford, it's on the right about 1/4 mile after you pass the stop light at Lincoln Ave. If you see a McDonald's, you've gone too far.

** A Note On Parking **


If the lot is full, park out front or down one of the side streets. Do NOT park in a neighboring establishment's lot, as those businesses WILL have you towed. (It has happened before.)


If you're a musician, bring your instrument and get ready to jam with the band. And if you're a vocalist, get those pipes ready!


** How To Find Us **

Crossroads is not a huge venue, so you shouldn't have any trouble locating us, but if this is your first time joining the group, you might not recognize us right away.

Here are three easy ways to find us:

• look for the Jazzville, NJ Meetup sign: http://bit.ly/zBZxVL

• look for me: http://bit.ly/zP11QP

• ask at the bar for the "Jazzville, NJ Meetup" group

Come over and don't be shy! We are very friendly!

peace and jazz,

D.A.
results.how_to_find_us: See "How To Find Us", below.
results.name: Year-end Jazz Jam @ Crossroads, Garwood, NJ

group.name: Live, Old School Jazz with Jazzville, NJ!

results.description:
Mt. Beacon Fire ~Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE

 


 A steady pace all the way so we make the sunrise and can get to work after ,,,, not good for a first time hiker .


4 miles 

Hiking Poles are helpful


Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding look out point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area.


Distance: 4 miles round trip

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.
On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).

We leave right at 6:00AM.  Don't be late.

+++

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike
results.name: Mt. Beacon ~ Fire Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE ~

results.description:
Travel with Miyar Adventures through multiple climatic zones to the formidable Kilimanjaro. Take the Machame route and enjoy the most impressive vistas that Africa has to offer, other than the wonders of Serengeti and endless savannas. Summiting the Rooftop of Africa is a once in a lifetime opportunity. After completing your summit, celebrate with a journey through many of the Wildlife Safari Tours with Miyar Adventures and check off two incredible experiences from your bucket-list. 

More information here: http://miyaradventures.com/kilimanjaro 

To Reserve please email [masked] or call Sandeep at (425)[masked]

Kilimanjaro Climb Price: $2985 

Included in the price: 

-2 nights hotel accommodation in Moshi (before & after climb), Breakfast at hotel 

-Group transport to and from Moshi to the trailhead 

-National Park fees, camping fees, and rescue fees 

-Guides: Very experienced guides. Guide-client ratio 1-2 

-Porters: 3 porters per client. You carry around 10 Lbs. 

-Accommodation in the Mountain in good quality tents and sleeping mat 

-Fresh meals cooked and served in dinner tent with table/chairs. 

-Private Toilets 

-Bottled oxygen, only for rescue/emergency use. 

-Information sessions and Trip preparation assistance provided by US based guide. 

Lead US-based Guide 

Sandeep Nain is the US-based guide leading this trip. He has 15 years mountaineering experience, including 3 first-ascents in the Himalayas and 5 years in a very active mountain rescue unit in the Pacific Northwest. Sandeep will be present for all portions of this trip, from pick up at the airport to the summit and back. Certified local guides will also be present for this trip, providing strong experience and knowledge of the route. 

About Miyar Adventures:  

"We wish to personally engage our clients and provide a stronger experience than other guide companies. We keep a low guide-to-client ratio, promote group collaboration, and are open to adapting our itinerary to the preferences of our clients. We organize group meets and hikes before big trips, which are a fun way to develop relationships between us and our hiking partners. We believe that by getting to know our clients and training together, all of us will have a successful, safe, and enjoyable experience. Our international trips are always led by US-based guides, which can provide an easier transition into a new culture."
results.name: Mt Kilimanjaro Climb via Machame Route

group.name: New York Outdoor and International Adventure Club

You may have attended networking group meetings before, but you haven’t seen ours!  We are a growing chapter that maintains a unique sense of partnership as well as camaraderie. Come to a meeting where you will meet other local business people as well as have an opportunity to tell us about your business.


We meet every Wednesday 7 :15am at the Maywood Pancake House, our meeting begins 7:30am.

We are seeking all professions to join our group. However our group is very unique and attractive as it is one seat per profession. We currently have the following seats filled:

 • Personal and Commercial P&C Insurance (Borbotko Insurance Group)

• Retirement Planner (Ameriprise) 

• Long Term Care and Life Insurance (Ameriprise) 

• Reverse Mortgage Banker (1st Constitution Bank) 

• Business Banker (Santander) 

• Mortgage Banker (Franklin First Financial) 

• Certified Public Accountant (KWC Partners, LLC) 

• Real Estate and Trust Attorney (Yaneixa Hermoso PC Attorneys at Law) 

• Realtor (RE/MAX) 

• Web and Graphic Design (Jersey Girls Creative)

• Promotional Items/Printer (Ramsey Graphics & Printing)

If your company is not part of the categories listed above and you're interested in growing your business with a local group on a weekly basis this may be a perfect fit! Come as a guest to see the power of our group!

Read more about us here www.LetipSaddlebrook.com

results.description: North Jersey Business Professionals is an efficient, very cost-effective way to grow your business. This is a selective networking group where there is only one business per category. We have openings for attorneys, contractors, health and fitness professionals, IT gurus and many other categories. The meeting starts at 7:30 am with open networking. The formal part of the meeting starts at 7:45 am. Look for us on the right side of The Hearth restaurant - the closed section. We usually adjourn by 8:30 am. Please contact one of the organizers if you are interested in attending a meeting.
results.how_to_find_us: Route 46 West, west of Van Houten Avenue, Clifton
results.name: Let's learn more about each other's business and share referrals

results.description: Group meets weekly to exchange new business leads, discuss growth opportunities and provide feedback to business owners in a Mastermind type of group.
results.name: Lead Group

results.description:
Reminder . . .

Professionals Exchanging Ideas and Referrals (PEIR), is an independent networking group of business professionals dedicated to the business growth and success of each of our members.  We meet in Berkeley Heights, NJ; our members represent businesses from the surrounding 15 mile radius. 

We are currently seeking new affiliates in business categories not represented by our present membership.  Note - we are not about handing out business cards, but rather we are about building trusted business relationships and sharing business acumen.  Please "opt-out" if not serious about a long-term professional relationship.

• We generally meet on the 2nd and 4th Wednesday mornings of the month (8:30am to 10:00am) with periodic evening networking and social events.

• We expect regular attendance at meetings, but understand that business (and life) will occasionally “trump” your attendance. 

• We seek legitimate business referrals and opportunities, and recognize these do not arise weekly.  Members should be “givers” as well as “takers”. 

• Our semi-annual dues are utilized for networking and member-only presentations and development. 

The following business areas are currently represented:

• Insurance – Property, Casualty & Life

• Mortgage Broker - Residential

• Financial Advisor – Planning, Investments, Life, LTD, & LTC, Employee Benefits

• Residential Realtor

• Attorney – Business /  Real Estate / Estate Planning

• Web Design / e-Marketing / Graphic Design

• Title Insurance – Residential/Commercial

• Property Restoration -  Fire, Water, Smoke

Examples of businesses we are seeking to join us (not all-inclusive):

Architect - Banking -  Business Consultant – Commercial Lender - Commercial Realtor - Contractor - CPA/Tax Practitioner- Florist – Handyman – Interior Design – Health & Fitness Professionals - Photographer – Printer - Recruiter
results.how_to_find_us: Use on-street parking (lot is for tenants)
results.name: Professionals Exchanging Ideas and Referrals (PEIR) - Networking Meeting

results.description:
Zev is a great music teacher. We love his songs, instruments and energy. The class starts at 9.15, so plan to arrive at 9am. $10 per family.

We love to have you join us for music, and stay for snack. we will have yummy muffins. please bring some fruit to share if you wish.
results.name: Christmas Sing Along - Music By  Zev

group.name: Playtime for little ones in New Rochelle

results.description:
Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who <a>signs up</a>.

Here's what separates this group from many others:

• Chill, positive attitudes. (People without forgiving personalities don't last long in this group, let alone in a given game.)

• Good quality equipment: $145 match balls; solid small goals - not pop-ups!

• Freshly laundered, adult-size, pillowy soft pinnies.

• We won't ever over-crowd a game. The size of pitch we use is best suited for 7v7. We're happy to make the pitch smaller if numbers are low. But we won't make it bigger or allow more than 7 players per team. 


• The small fee we ask of each player (at least $3 per session) supports a non-profit that we created and run: a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!
results.name: Sign-Up Soccer for Social Change

venue.address_1: 96th street and Central Park West entrance
venue.name: Playground Central Park entrance at 96th street and Central Park West

results.description:
How to find us: look for a Meet up sign and possibly a red balloon (if it doesn't burst). We will be visible from the gate when you walk in so will be easy to find.

Come and bring your babies or kids out to play and enjoy new friends and conversation!

Hope to see you all soon, you know you need some mommy time!!!!!
results.how_to_find_us: Look for a 'Manhattan mamas meet up' sign. I will do my best to set up just inside the front gate of the playground.
results.name: Mamas and babies playground meet up.

results.description:
Come join us at a dedicated space to make games, learn about game development and show off your own work to the local community. We’ll have our own room for developers looking to work on their games and Jesse Freeman, Amazon Game Developer Evangelist, will be on site from 10am – 3pm to also help you with any questions you have about making games and publishing to the Amazon Appstore.

You'll need to do the following in order to attend:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for this event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly
results.name: Dedicated Indie Coworking Space - Late December Event

results.description:
You can make jewelry by yourself at Ayaka Nishi Jewelry Design School in East Village. We provide semi-private classes with a small number of only four students per class.

We offer a one day class which is an experience for people who want to learn jewelry making. This can also be a perfect memory of New York City trip for visitors.

Under the guidance of the teacher, you will create a ring and set a diamond for 3~4 hours. It is possible to engrave your initials and a date to make this piece an origin.

More info and tickets: https://goo.gl/dR5L52
results.name: DIY Jewelry Class

results.how_to_find_us: We will be on field will goals, balls and bibs. Please bring $3 for donation.
results.name: Pick up soccer Williamsburg Brooklyn.

results.description:
Hello,

we need 3-4 players for our 7v7 game, 90min+, bring a white & black tee-shirt.

Don't be late, we start on time!


This long running pick-up plays in Chinatown and has a storied history. The game has been going 12+ years, and was born by a group of Irish, English, Scottish and German expats who needed a mid-week footballing outlet. The group has now expanded to include players from around a dozen countries.

The group is looking for additional players to complement the game. The match is played in a sporting yet competitive spirit. This is for seasoned players - NO beginners please.

A good attitude, positional sense and a preference for passing is a must. We usually play for 1.5 hours year round.


Someone usually brings pinnies, but bring a white and black top just in case.

Note: RSVP is required to attend the game. There are a number of regulars who attend each week in addition to the meetup list - not all players are listed on the meetup.

See you there.
results.name: Chinatown Pick-up Wednesdays @12:00pm

results.description:
Success breeds success. There is nothing like achieving a goal to make you feel good and want to achieve more.  Small action steps completed regularly will take you closer to where you want to be.  Will Rogers said it best: "You may be on the right track but you will get run over if you just sit there!" 

Toastmasters has helped over 4 million members in 116 countries improve their speaking and leadership skills. 

Toastmasters has helped us and it can help you too. Why not attend a meeting and see for yourself?

What's the biggest benefit you may receive from Toastmasters?

The ability to speak with confidence before a large audience

The ability to overcome nervous butterflies and focus on the goal of my presentation

I've learned how to conduct an effective business meeting

More confidence to speak in public, even in impromptu situations

More comfortable speaking in front of a group

Being able to more effectively share the things I've learned with others

Greater self-confidence because of Toastmasters' encouraging feedback

The opportunity to meet new people in a fun and friendly atmosphere

More confidence and a greater ability to think on my feet

A feeling of accomplishment by helping others

I have gained self-confidence and improved my performance at work

I'm a much better listener -- more attentive, patient and less judgmental

The ability (and confidence) to combine words with appropriate gestures for a better speech

A greater belief in yourself and your capabilities. 

The ability to speak in front of a group of people with confidence, conviction and certainty

Knowing that there are people out there that started out just like you and now they are good speakers. You can do this!

Realising that it is not all that scary to stand in front of a group of people and talk

Gain experience in an area of my life I always thought to be non-existent -- public speaking. If I can do it, anyone can

A noticeable improvement, week by week, in my writing and speaking abilities

Courage to put yourself in challenging situations.

Meet new people from many backgrounds and walks of life and hearing their stories. Everyone has something to teach.

build your self-confidence, meet new people and expand your social circle
results.how_to_find_us: Mountbatten Institute 20th Floor 50 E 42nd street, New York, NY 10017
results.name: Learn Public Speaking - New York City near Grand Central Station - Toastmasters
Scarsdale  Meditation Circle

results.description:
Student Testimonial:

"Bodhi meditation has a focus on healing energy, you can experience this at each session. Much higher level of meditation in group than I can achieve doing my own practice. I was very happy to find a meditation group that was focused on bringing together community members to practice meditation. Bodhi meditation is unique because they offer free sessions to the community. Nan is a wonderful teacher, and very compassionate person. You can sense that she has extensive experience in oriental medicine including acupuncture, herbal medicine, and energy healing,. Thank you Nan. ” Joe, Bodhi Meditation class Wednesday October 29, 2014 

"It's like looking into the eyes of Pure Love. I've been around meditation, acupuncture, and "Spiritual Healers" for over 20 years. In that time I've worked with several healers. Not until I had privilege of meeting Nan Ni did I experience a true healer. Having a session with Nan Ni or "Nan" is like looking into the eyes of Pure Love - the kind of selfless Love that you hoped was "out there", but didn't really expect to find. Nan has a profound sense of commitment to her patients and students. Her caring, genuine smile comes from deep within and warms you the moment that you meet her. Nan's healing, insightful ways never cease to amaze me and fill me with gratitude. Nan can look at you and know what you need. How many times was I shocked when, without my uttering a word, did she know exactly was what troubling me. I wish I were eloquent enough to express my sincere appreciation for the gift of meeting and working with Nan. Nan's answer to that would be to greet each and every person I meet with an open and loving heart. It is my hope that if you are searching for a healer and/or a meditation practice and come across these words, that you will know that you've found what you've been searching for. Thank you, Lynn" Bodhi Meditation Class Saturday March 14, 2014

 “ Very strong healing energy tonight. I got there feeling very tired. I had stomach pain all day, and during the first meditation of the evening it got a lot better. By the end I wasn't thinking about it at all. I left full of energy. ” Pam, Bodhi Meditation class November 22, 2013

“ I didn't realize I would be reaping the benefits of Bodhi Med so quickly after attending only two classes. After my second class I felt even more relaxed. I have insomnia, but after the second session I fell asleep faster and deeper which has not happened for a long time. ” Dee, Bodhi Meditation class September 18, 2013

It was enlightening!!! Every time I practice Bodhi meditation, it feels like my Chi increases more and more! Thank you everyone for sharing this to NYC." Javoski (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013) 

"Nan emits healing energy -- the meditation is wonderful" Linda (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013) 

"Very calming and energizing. I did not have any negative thoughts or worries last night in bed like I always do. I felt my mind was clear. I will definitely go to another class" Dee (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013) 

"I Walked In With Lower Back Pain, Listened, Opened My Heart And Relaxed My Mind And Walked Out Feeling Better Than I Have In Almost Two Weeks. Thank You So Much. Looking Forward To Friday's " Ed (Bodhi Meditation class Tuesday July 30, 2013)

--------------------------------------------------------------------


Come and experience how this unique meditation can help you purify your body/mind and unleash the creative power within you.

* Increase self-awareness
* Stronger emotional intelligence
* Greater mental clarity, focus and inspiration.

Bodhi Meditation Energize your body Strenthen your mind Bodhi Meditation is a form of energy healing.

Bodhi Meditation is unique in the following ways

1). It channels universal energy rather than working with what’s within one person. It transcends the genetic and physical limits of just one being by relying and drawing energy from the entire universe.

2). The entire human body is the receiver of this energy. The energy’s effects on the body do not rely on certain meridian paths or pressure points of the body, which are the common requirements for many types of the Qi Gong practices.

Students will experience two forms of Bodhi Meditation.

* Seated
* Movement

Your class instructor is Nan Ni Gilbert. Nan is a NYS licensed acupuncturist and Chinese herbalist. Nan is also one of the most advanced Bodhi Meditation energy healer in North America


Time:. 1:00 PM – 2:30 PM

 Day: Wednesdays 

Where: Room #102, 

Freeport Recreation Center 

130 E Merrick Rd, Freeport, NY 11520 

Contact: Nan, [masked], 

**The Bodhi Meditation classes at the Freeport Rec Center are free but all participates are required to have a Freeport Rec Center Activity Card. The cost is $5.00 for Freeport Residents and $10.00 for Non-Residents. It's a one time annual fee payable to the Freeport Rec Center. If it's your first class please arrive early to purchase your activity card.

-------------------------------------------------------------------

I leave you with Master JinBodhi's Golden Words:


(Editor's note: The following phrases were suggested by Master JinBodhi and subsequently introduced to his students as a daily practice. Starting your day by loudly reciting these phrases three times, either all of them or a select few, will bring you energy and joy. Give it a try and experience how uplifted you feel...)

1.Self-Confidence

I am most compassionate.

I am most confident.

I am most tolerant.

I am most courageous.

I keep my word.

I am most punctual.

I can do anything.


2. The Power of Knowledge

I am full of wisdom.

I am most knowledgeable.

I love reading.

I love observing.

I love listening.

I love thinking.

I take decisive action.


3. Life Purpose

I am a gift from the Universe.

I am most charming.

I am most talented.

I can sing most beautifully.

I like challenge.

I am responsible for my actions.

I will fulfill my life purpose.


4. Cause and Consequence

（not for reading loud）

What you give is what you receive.

Care for others, and you are taken care of.

Smile at others, and they will smile at you.

Treat others with sincerity, and sincerity will be given to you.

Make trouble for others, and trouble will find you.

Frequent generosity begets abundance.

Seek to give, not to be rewarded.
results.name: Bodhi Meditation - Freeport Long Island (FREE**)

I leave you with Master JinBodhi's Golden Words:


(Editor's note: The following phrases were suggested by Master JinBodhi and subsequently introduced to his students as a daily practice. Starting your day by loudly reciting these phrases three times, either all of them or a select few, will bring you energy and joy. Give it a try and experience how uplifted you feel...)

1.Self-Confidence

I am most compassionate.

I am most confident.

I am most tolerant.

I am most courageous.

I keep my word.

I am most punctual.

I can do anything.


2. The Power of Knowledge

I am full of wisdom.

I am most knowledgeable.

I love reading.

I love observing.

I love listening.

I love thinking.

I take decisive action.


3. Life Purpose

I am a gift from the Universe.

I am most charming.

I am most talented.

I can sing most beautifully.

I like challenge.

I am responsible for my actions.

I will fulfill my life purpose.


4. Cause and Consequence

（not for reading loud）

What you give is what you receive.

Care for others, and you are taken care of.

Smile at others, and they will smile at you.

Treat others with sincerity, and sincerity will be given to you.

Make trouble for others, and trouble will find you.

Frequent generosity begets abundance.

Seek to give, not to be rewarded.

Laser tag's fun. Laser tag with friends is even more fun. But unlimited laser tag with friends? Before you start wetting your pants in excitement, come join the Recent College Grads (21-28) for an action-packed day of running, ducking and zapping as you'll not only meet new friends but get one helluva workout doing so.


Be it a professional laser tagger or an FNG, all skill levels are welcome! It's not about who can get the most points here as it is about who can have the most fun doing so. So don't be shy and jump into the fray. We're all about acceptance 

Event Location:
Bowlmor Chelsea Piers
Chelsea Piers - Pier 60 
23rd Street & W. Side Highway 
New York, NY 10011 
Chelsea

Pricing:
General Admission: $15/person for unlimited laser tag (from 6pm - 9pm)
Bag Drop Offs: Free 

Nearby Train Stations:
- 23rd Street via C, E Train 
- 34th Street - Hudson Yards via 7 Train

Where to Find Us:
We'll meet by the pier in front of Bowlmor Lanes. If you get lost, contact us. Alternatively, you may jump into the water, splash around for help, gather a crowd and I'm sure one of us will notice you 

Contact Information:
If you have any questions and/or concerns, feel free to call/text Anthony at: (917)[masked]

Plan B:
Bowlmor is notorious for their inability to keep people posted. The only way to find out if the place's been booked out for the night is to call on the day of. Calling in advance yields no information and nothing will be posted on their website, Twitters, FB, etc.

In the event that Bowlmor decides to pull a Scumbag Steve on us, we'll head to Fat Cats as a group instead

"After Party":
For those looking to hang around after laser tag or those who can't make it before 9PM, we'll be heading towards Fat Cat NYC. If you're lost, contact us.

Facebook Group:
Want to become more involved?
Stay up to date with the latest events, polls or have a hand at leaving suggestions/feedback at our Facebook group. All applicants will be approved: https://www.facebook.com/groups/nycrecentcollegegrads/

results.description:
First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.  

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY


When: We usually climb between 6:00pm and 9:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 6:00pm. We will pair off around 6:15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).

results.description:
WEBSITE : TWITTER : FACEBOOK

Every Wednesday we bring some serious board game madness to Berg'n from 6:00 PM to 11:00 PM. They like board games; we like board games... it's a match made in heaven!

Just a quick reminder not bring in outside food and to patronize any bar that hosts us. Check out bergn.com if you want to check out their food and drink menu; they have a great selection.

We usually have many more people who attend than who RSVP. We try to adjust the numbers on the Meetup to reflect that, but we err on the side of lowballing. As of Nov. 2015 we are averaging out around 25 people throughout the night though for special events we've had up to 80.

HOW MUCH IS THIS EVENT?

There's no admission fee, but there is a two drink minimum* which you will be expected to honor.

* (or monetary equivalent in non-alcoholic purchases if you don't touch the stuff.)

WHAT TYPE OF GAMES ARE PLAYED?

All types. Real short bluffing games decorated with skulls and flowers. Cooperative games fighting horrible diseases. Classic euro games where you haggle over sheep and wheat. Whether you want to fight unspeakable horrors in Arkham or build railroads across America or rebuild your farm after the black plague (more fun than it sounds) you can probably find a game you would like.

Some games you might see are 7 Wonders, Settlers of Catan, Pandemic, Dominion, Dixit, Puerto Rico, Eldritch Horror, Ticket to Ride, Carcasonne among many others. You're also welcome to bring any game you want to play!

I DON'T KNOW THESE GAMES? IS IT COOL IF I COME?

We're very friendly and if you have no idea what the hell we're talking about just trust us when we say it's ton of fun. We'll have tons of games and we're very happy to show you the rules. Hang out, haves some drinks, and learn a new game.

Questions? Comments? Contact us at [masked]

results.description:
EVENT TYPE: Dining

DESCRIPTION:         

Fondue French pronunciation: ​is a Swiss, Italian, and French dish of melted cheese served in a communal pot (caquelon or fondue pot) over a chafing stand (réchaud) heated with a candle or spirit lamp, and eaten by dipping bread into the cheese using long-stemmed forks. It was promoted as a Swiss national dish by the Swiss Cheese Union (Schweizerische Käseunion) in the 1930s, and was popularized in North America in the 1960s.

Since the 1950s, the name "fondue" has been generalized to other dishes in which a food is dipped into a communal pot of liquid kept hot in a fondue pot: chocolate fondue, in which pieces of fruit are dipped into a melted chocolate mixture, and fondue bourguignonne, in which pieces of meat are cooked in hot oil.

MENU:

http://www.montblancrestaurant.com/DinnerMenu.htm

I'm loving the momentum of this group and witnessing how folks are improving their language skills and making friends. To me, it makes all of this worth doing!

So let's get ready for another great meetup! 

As always, first introduce yourself in the language you are studying. Then introduce yourself in your native language. 

Following that, we will dedicate 30 minutes towards helping those learning English, then 30 minutes of Chinese. 

Then we mingle again until its time to go. 

We are usually done by 8:30 but those that want to stick around or continue hanging out after the meetup (bubble tea, karaoke, etc) are more than welcome to do so!

Thanks again for your support thus far and let's have many more great meetups! 非常感谢大家的支持！

results.description:
Bring photos to share, look for an interesting article, or just come and listen! Need camera help? bring questions!


Our current topic is, "Photo as Memory." Bring a few favorite old photos (HARD COPY IS EASIER FOR THIS TOPIC). We will talk about photos and memory - do a little looking around on the Internet and/or write down a few thoughts to contribute.

Here's a dissertation I found on the subject (It's relatively easy reading):

https://www.academia.edu/5125449/The_Magic_Mirror_Reflections_on_Photography_as_Memory

We started discussing this at the "Thanksgiving Eve" meeting, and will continue for a while. Find an article, do some thinking, bring a few photos.

Our assignment: Take a photo that tells a lie. Think about the lies you see in family photographs and the generalizations you make based on a very small piece of information from within a very complicated situation.

results.description:
EVERY Wednesday Night!

New York City's hottest open mic in the heart of Queens' cultural mecca and in the homiest underground spot around - one level downstairs in the Q4 Hotel in Long Island City.

Produced by the long-running independent performance series, The Inspired Word (http://inspiredwordnyc.com), which has featured Grammy winners, American Idol finalists, Golden Globe Award winners, Emmy nominated actors, and HBO Def Poetry stars, this open mic is open to ALL types of performing artists - musicians, comedians, poets, fiction/nonfiction writers, playwrights, spoken word artists, storytellers, performance artists, dancers, etc.

20 performance slots, 6-minute time limit for anything spoken, 7 minutes for anything musical. **Note to musicians: If you have backing tracks, bring them on an mp3 player or smartphone. Note to piano/keyboard players: You must bring your own keyboard.**

We are dedicated to celebrating the best of Queens' performing arts and developing a warm local artistic community. 

NO AGE RESTRICTIONS.

*****

When: Every Wednesday Night

Where: Q4 Hotel
http://www.q4hotel.com/

29-09 Queens Plaza N.
Long Island City, NYC

Time: 7pm sharp

Admission: $7 online for solo performer or audience member, $10 at the door

This is a very popular open mic. You can pay online or at the door, but we STRONGLY suggest you purchase a ticket in advance to guarantee a performance slot.

*****

By subway, take the E to Queens Plaza, N/Q/7 to Queensboro Plaza.

*****

Produced by Mike Geffner Presents The Inspired Word

http://inspiredwordnyc.com

"It's not just a series...It's a movement."

#SupportLiveArtsNYC

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

6-7 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
7:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
7:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
8:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going!

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: David Rubenstein Atrium, 62nd and Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Please, come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

results.description:
Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! On Wednesday, December 2nd, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The December session of Cuban Salsa:

Wednesdays (December 2nd - 23rd):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino  - Level 1

This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner <a>safety in</a> an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 Classes: ONLY $60
that's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

LOCATION
Adelante Studios
25 West 31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor - Grand Ballroom (3,000 sq ft!)

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.
*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 16-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video link of our group doing Rueda de Casino
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class immediately following Level 1 on Wednesdays at 8:30pm.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (December 2nd - 23rd):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (December 1st) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

Location:

Adelante Studios
25 W 31st Street between Broadway and 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.

*Can't find our room? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

results.description:
Men's Pick-up basketball in Hunters Point, Long Island City.

The cost is $10.75 for this session. 

Once you RSVP to a specific session, no refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before committing to that session.

It is a regulation sized court, but we divide it into two games simultaneously with each playing 4x4. We will do our best to break up the teams evenly at the outset, after which it's the luck of the draw based on who's sitting and who shoots in from the losing team. There will be a sign-up list for each court, and players from the losing team must shoot foul shots to play next, not be chosen by those already sitting.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. No fighting, rough playing, or screaming allowed. You will immediately be asked to leave the gym.

No food or alcoholic beverages allowed into the school. Save it for after the game.

All games must end by 8:45pm

From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson. Walk straight back towards the River to Center Blvd(in the direction of the city).

results.description:
SLIM IT UP SANTA!!!

Come join us for our climbing Meetup SANTA STYLE - ALL PARTICIPATES ARE URGED TO COME IN FULL SANTA GARB! Or at least a hat :)

Dress up, have fun, climb hard, work out and check out the Studios, the only place to commit to those new year's resolutions of staying fit! We offer discounted memberships to the Studios for Rock Club Members and visa versa, ask anyone at The Rock Club front desk for more information.

SLIM IT UP SANTA! We'll be incorporating the Studios at Pine Brook Fitness into this event. Everyone can participate in some climbing specific fitness classes by our Fitness Director Steve DiDio and then we'll head back to TRC to climb! Take advantage of this awesome opportunity and get to know the new Pine Brook family as well as the Studios instructors.

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

1st time climbers at The Rock Club get in for FREE! All you have to do is rent a harness and shoes for $10.25 Returning Meetupers get a discounted daypass rate of $15. And be sure to have a look out at the gym for other special Meetup discounts.

We also host a special Meetup 101 class from 7:30 - 9pm for Meetup members only. When multiple people sign-up for the class you pay only $45 ($15 discount!).

Reserve your spot with the booking button and enter the promo code "Meetup" on the booking page.

IMPORTANT!!  This offer has restrictions. It is only valid for the Weds night Meetup 101 class, you must already be a meetup member and RSVP for the meetup as well (no guests).

If this is your first time climbing just come on in and join the group. There’s no need to take the class just yet. You’ll be able to join other Meetup members who already have their belay certification. This way you’ll be able to get up and on the wall right away! When you decide that you absolutely love climbing (which you will!), then you can sign up for the class the following week.

As a heads up, when you come into the gym, the front desk staff will get you set up with gear and get you in the system. There will also be name tags for everyone. Wear them with pride so everyone knows who’s a part of Meetup!

DETAILS - Please read carefully!

RSVPing and Questions:
If you're attending the belay course you MUST call TRC to reserve your space.
If you have any questions, please email TRC directly: [url][masked][/url]

Time:
The closer to 7pm you arrive, the better. The 101 class starts at 7:30 sharp.

Directions & Transportation:
Please save time and aggravation by getting directions from our website (BEFORE you call or email us for directions :-). If you're coming on Metro North as a group (2 or more people!) we'll pick you up from the train station. Use the message baord to connect with other riders.  Just give us a call to let us know when you'll arrive. Go to the taxi stand in front of the station building!

We're looking forward to seeing you soon!

results.description:
D&D Encounters is an episodic-format event designed to allow new players to join in and learn D&D in a casual, pick-up game. Seasoned players with erratic schedules can easily hop in and out of Encounters; unlike a traditional campaign, DMs and players will rotate, resulting in a dynamic game experience. We are using the latest edition of D&D (5e) and each session lasts about 3-4 hours, easily fitting into your work or school schedule, and presents a new and exciting challenge each week. The $10 fee covers your use of the playspace, though committing to 10 weeks grants the player a discount.


We're always on the lookout for DM talent for this season-- volunteers keep programs like this one alive! However, more important than veteran DMs, Encounters is a place where even new players should feel comfortable testing out the DMing waters. Every Saturday we provide our DMs with that week's "adventure chunk", a set of 2-3 encounters in one simple, easy-to-read packet. This bite-sized DMing format is ideal for new DMs and veterans who don't have the time to create an entire campaign from scratch, and allow lots of room for alterations and improvisations as the DM sees fit. DMs who volunteer their time do not pay the $10 fee, and receive a steep discount on our D&D related products.


For our first session, we will be creating level 1 characters and running a brief "test run" of our new adventurers as they get their footing the world of the Forgotten Realms. It won't be long before we're on the road to great deeds, so you won't want to miss this great opportunity to get to know your fellow heroes!

Please private message Timm with any questions regarding DMing, the event, or anything else RPG related!
results.name: Brooklyn Strategist Presents: D&D Encounters, Rage of Demons

results.description:
Our typical agenda: - We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives. - Then we meditate together by chanting mantra followed by the beautiful sounds of the gong - And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can.

Note that we meet every Wednesday, 7:00 to 8:30 pm, and every Saturday, 2 to 3:30 pm -- except for the first Saturday of the month, when we begin our meeting at 5 pm followed by an informal potluck social. If you are planning on staying for the potluck, be sure to visit www.perfectpotluck.com to enter your food selection. The website will help you decide what food to contribute to the potluck to make sure we have a healthy, balanced meal.

By the way, the meetup page may show only a few members planning to attend a particular meeting. That's because many people attend regularly and don't bother to RSVP for each meeting.   We never have only a few members at a meeting. A dozen or more usually attend each meeting. The special potluck meetings we hold the first Saturday of each month has an average attendance of two dozen people.

results.description:
Come on out and enjoy a night of food drink, conversation and a little friendly competition! Test your skills as New York Social Network Founder Dave Cervini hosts a fun evening that will have you thinking, laughing and learning about pop culture, music, TV, Movie, History, NYC and more.

Most questions are easy and others you may have to rely on your teammates for help. Come alone or with a friend. Even if you think you don’t know much trivia, it is still a great way to meet others in the group. We will have special sections set aside for NYSN members to meet and team up.  Pay as you go for food and drink. There are several rounds and prizes awarded for each round!

Can I come alone? Yes! If you do not know anyone there we will introduce you to others and make you part of teams.

What should I wear? Most come from work but The Firehouse is a pub with a very casual atmosphere.

Can I eat there? The Firehouse is known for it's wings. But they also have burgers, quesadillas, veggie sandwiches, salads, pizza, burrito's and more. If you want to eat with the group, plan to get there around 7pm.

How long does it last? We have 3 rounds of 15 questions each.  The trivia usually lasts until about 9:30pm.  After that some stayb and socialize and other head home.

How do I get there? It is near the corner of west 85th and Columbus Avenue.  The B,C stop a block away at CPW and 86th and the #1 stops at B'way and 86th.

results.description:
“…to be successful in life you need values, you need integrity, you need a vision, you need energy, and you need dynamism. And spirituality is the one thing that gives it all to you. If you are healthy, you can see better, you can eat better, you can speak better, you can hear better and you can run better. All this depends on just one thing. Similarly that which enriches your spirit is so essential to enrich all other aspects of life.” -Sri Sri Ravi Shankar, Founder, Art of Living Foundation

Whatever we do in life, it is all directed towards being happy. Why do we even do some service to somebody? It is because it gives some happiness to us. So anything we do in our life is directed towards achieving happiness, greater happiness, and even greater happiness. That’s how the mind goes. Yet, are we happy? Yes, some times. But often not!

This free seminar examines what comes in the way of our happiness. There will be a discussion on tools that can lead us to happiness – tools that every human being is privileged to learn and use. Come, relax, refresh and smile.

results.description:
Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10 pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

*A listing of contests and magazines to submit to can be found on our Discussions page

See you there,
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p.  

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]


Can't make this one?  Visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E

results.description:
This week, we'd like everyone in the meetup group to register their Maker enthusiasm by subscribing to our mailing list. (if you haven't already)

http://lists.islandlabs.org/mailman/listinfo/list

At some point, we may be forced to prune the meetup group membership in order to allow new members to join. If that happens to you, please don't be offended. You're always welcome to join us at our weekly meetings.

We don't know how long the meetup account will last but we aim to keep ourselves (and our mailing list) going "forever".


If you sign up on the mailing list, you'll get our weekly meeting announcements, plus whatever random stuff we might happen to talk about. And you can ask us questions.

This Wednesday's meeting will be our "Pre Christmas" meeting, where I imagine people will be talking about how awesome the latest Star Wars movie is.

At the last meeting:

Jesse did some more Antenna Folding and came to the determination that he wants his hand-built SWR meter to also have a hand-built PC-board based directional coupler. (very ambitious)

Jeff was doing his second day of assembly on a kit-built RC-car. (and sized it up for a LiPO battery)


James demonstrated a working display on his Arduino. I'm looking forward to see if (or how well) it works as a serial monitor device.

Jim and Chris were experimenting with using a ZFS filesystem (inside of a flat file) to transfer files between Linux and OSX computers.

I was playing w/ a new toy: The HackRF, which let me "see" the RF spectrum when microwave ovens clobber our WiFi signals. (it looks pretty cool)

Ariella grabbed a copy of the I-Con constitution, which is one (of many) documents that an Island Labs constitution could be based on.

There was some talk of HAM radio and "Disaster Communications".

James brought a "case" of tiny foam gliders, so there were a lot of little airplanes flying around.

Jesse described his latest FPV Quadcopter crash, which (Tree!) left him temporily "Quad-less".

..and there was some discussion of a movie-list that could be used for entertainment when we finally get to have a housewarming event at Louisa's new place.

As a pre-meeting activity, some of us visited the Long Island Maker Space in Plainview. Their holiday meeting was well attended and (as usual?) consisted of a tightly knit group of people in-front of laptops, working on designs for parts to be produced on their laser cutter.
results.name: Pre Christmas Mailing List Membership Update

results.description:
Mt. Beacon Fire ~Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE

 


 A steady pace all the way so we make the sunrise and can get to work after ,,,, not good for a first time hiker .


4 miles 

Hiking Poles are helpful


Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding look out point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area.


Distance: 4 miles round trip

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.
On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).

We leave right at 6:00AM.  Don't be late.

+++

results.description:
30 Min Tempo Run...    


Tempo Runs: This is a continuous run with an easy beginning, a build-up in the middle to near 10-K race pace (or slightly slower than your pace in a 5-K), then ease back and slow down toward the end. A typical Tempo Run would begin with 5-10 minutes easy running, build to 10-15 minutes at 10-K pace, then 5-10 minutes cooling down. You can't figure out your pace on a watch doing this workout; you need to listen to your body. Tempo Runs are very useful for developing anaerobic threshold, essential for fast 5-K racing

results.description:
Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"That was absolutely amazing! I don't think I have ever fully let go and quieted my mind like that before. I feel so inspired. By the end of the session I was filled with so much love - love for myself, for others, and love coming from Source. Unconditional, pure love. Thank you." C.L.

"Instead of the 'knowledge gained', I find it appropriate to give a 5 star to 'raising my vibrations' during the meditation.... the energy of the group was Amazing and ZINGING! Thanks... " - S

"Thank you Tracy for a wonderful start to the day. Amazing calmness capturing everyone's energy on the class. Look forward to attending the next on-line class. Thank you." - B.J

"Very enlightening and a positive way for those that can't make it physically to do so remotely.""Thank you, the second section moved me the most. I had a real moment of knowing who I was, am and always be. Also, I have in the past trained in yoga and meditation but not practiced for a number of years - I felt all the beauty of it flowing connecting through my source once again aaaahhh bliss." - A.S.

"Truly inspirational, loved it, thank you ." - Anonymous

"Really loved being able to just switch on and meditate." - L.M.

"So relaxing and cleansing." - T.H.

"Awesome meditation Tracy! One of the most powerful sessions I have ever had. Wow." - G.R.

"I absolutely loved the meditation. The music was one that I truly enjoyed. Thank you so much for this. Many blessings to you." - S.

FOR DETAILS OF ALL UPCOMING 'MEDITATION 101 LIVE' SESSIONS PLEASE CLICK HERE.

Follow Meditation 101 Live on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn.

results.description:
If you are alone on Christmas Eve... Don't be!
Let's come together and celebrate the holiday. Bring a dish to share, a snack or drink to share. I'll have coffee and tea and a few snacks for us to share. We can chat, watch a movie, eat some food or snacks and enjoy each others company!

Directions: 7 train to 90 st. station

Exiting  the train, walk to the left and then, make a right onto 89th street. You will walk straight down 89th street past four avenues until you reach Northern boulevard. 

As you keep walking on 89th street, you will pass a red Santander bank. My place is across the street from a small park on 89th street.

**Please note it is a 10 minute walk in total to my place.   
Please note I do have a cat named Chewy who looks forward to meeting you.

Press buzzer 23

Take elevator to 5th floor. Make a right through the grey fire door and walk to the end of the hall to apartment 510. 

There are other ways to get to my place but I think this is the simplest since you only take the 7 train and walk straight down 89th street to my apartment.
results.name: Christmas Eve get together

results.description:
Some of us don't care for the craziness of last minute Christmas shopping and family reunions, or simply do not celebrate Christmas all together. 


Whatever your reason is for not participating into the more traditional Christmas activities...join us for a leisure day at the museum.


Free gallery talk are offered every hour if you wish to attend any, or simply browse the many exhibitions the museum has to offer...alongside with quite comfortable couches and great views on most floors.

Tours: http://whitney.org/Visit/FreeTours

Exhibitions on view: http://whitney.org/Exhibitions

If there is interest, dinner or drinks will follow.  We can decide as a group what we would like to do afterwards, if anything at all.

For admission tickets and visitor info follow this link: http://whitney.org/Visit

READ CAREFULLY BEFORE YOU CHOOSE TO RSVP.

1. If you RSVP and DO NOT SHOW UP for TWO events, you will be REMOVED from this group.

2. If you RSVP and change your status to "not attending" AFTER THE RSVP HAS BEEN CLOSED, you will be marked as "no show".

3. We DO NOT WAIT for late people. If you are late, you will be marked as "no show"

4. If less than 5 people RSVP for this event, it MAY be cancelled.
If it is cancelled meetup.com will automatically send you an email to inform you of the cancellation.
Make sure your email preferences for this group allow for you to receive communications for "Changes to a Meetup I'm going to"
results.name: LAST MINUTE: TODAY - WHITNEY!

Please join us for today's Christmas Eve service led by Rev. Paul Dodenhoff. Christmas isn't merely about the birth of Jesus of Nazareth. It's about the birth of the Cosmic Christ spirit that lives within each of us and of which Jesus was one example. The Coming of the Cosmic Christ is an event that is always happening. We simply have to open our hearts to it.


Bring family and friends. We look forward to seeing you!
results.name: The Coming of the Cosmic Christ

EVENT TYPE: Festival

COST: Free

DESCRIPTION:
Please come join us for a spectacular Christmas Lights Walk in Bay Ridge. Starting at Bay Ridge at 86th St + 4th Ave, we'll take a stroll to a beautiful neighborhood of Bay Ridge that is renowned for its annual Christmas lights display. Besides Dyker Heights, this area also has some of the best Christmas decorations in the NY metro area. We'll mainly concentrate on the blocks between 80th and 85th St, and Shore Road to Ridge Blvd. Overall walking distance is about 3.0 miles.

results.description:
Growing up back in Ohio it was tradition to have an "open house" all Christmas Eve. My Mom would put out a spread and people would stop in all evening long to share the Christmas spirit and visit for a spell. It was nice to catch up with those we had spent a little or a lot of time with during the year past.


Well my mom has passed over a few years ago and it's been even longer since I was home for a Christmas so I figured it was high time I got back to tradition and I figured my meetup family would do nicely! 

Now I know a lot of you will already have plans and that's great but those of you who do not, or those of you who want to pop in for a bit on your way to or from something else please know that you are welcome. I also know that not all of you are Christian and that's fine, everyone is welcome as there's no service going on or anything just socializing, and perhaps some game playing.


I am going to make a ham and I don't know what else yet. Please bring something to eat or drink and post what you are bringing.


Hope to see you!    Love, Cassie 


*note* my house is small but I do not want to limit who can come as I don't want anyone to be alone who does not want to be so I will have candles and a fire out back so dress warm in case there is spill over

Menu:

Cassie: ham and rolls, Jann, Joe, and Fran/Cheesecake, Nancy/Lasagne

Items needed: bag of ice and bottles of soda, veggie platter, any hors-d'œuvre , fresh fruit platter, shrimp and cocktail sauce, wine


*if you can not make it no need to post why, we understand and will catch you another time*
results.name: Christmas Eve Open House

This month marks the five-year anniversary of a revolutionary spark that fueled a regional uprising known as the "Arab Spring."

For this meetup, we'll look back at the factors leading up to this historically-unprecedented event, as well as the fallout, failures, and many unintended consequences that have engulfed the region, including:

Tunisia (Tara)


Egypt

Libya (Marc)


Yemen (Piku)


Bahrain (Jessica)


Syria

----------------------------------------------------

One day prior to the meetup, all attendees with a confirmed "YES" RSVP will receive a direct message with the venue address.


We'll be meeting at the mezzanine level, as shown in the photo below:
results.name: The "Arab Spring" — a lookback after five years . . .
