results.description:
You are able to just come to our meetings as a guest and even join as member if you wish!
The name of the City Hall Toastmasters Club is only because of the location. This club has an open membership -- open to all in the community.
Anyone & everyone is welcome to come to any meeting and also join as a member.
Dress code is business casual.
We meet the 2nd and 4th Thursday of each Month so the next few meetings are

-- 
City Hall Toastmasters Club #735 - (Open to All ! & Feel free to bring a friend !)
Meets 2nd and 4th Thursday of the Month @ <a>6:00 - 7:15 PM</a>

@St Andrews Church  20 Cardinal Hayes Place(Centre & Reade St's)
http://735.toastmastersclubs.org
[masked]
Directions:  http://www.hopstop.com - Trains / Buses or http://www.mapquest.com
Hope you can make it to out next meeting & feel free to bring a friend! St Andrews Church
20 Cardinal Hayes Place (Centre & Reade St's) Lower Manhattan District, NY, NY, 10007, United States

Doors Open at 5:50 pm. Meeting begins at 6pm.

Meetings are held every 2nd and 4th Thursday of the month.

Walking East on Reade St., you will see St. Andrews R.C. church at the end of the street. That is our building. When you come up to the church, walk around the church until you see a black iron gated walkway. Enter the walkway and enter the door on the left. The door will be open and you can come right in. Please do not bother the church staff by ringing any door bells.

Thanks!

Everyone knows the Big Apple turns out some of the best pizza around. So how ‘bout a challenge? Here’s to YOU becoming the next pizza king of the city!

Join our class to learn the secret tricks behind making a killer, one-of-a-kind crust and then delve into the history behind some of the most popular pies at the top of Gotham’s list. You’ll also pick up a few bonus skills as we pair our pizza with a delicious caprese salad, drizzled with a home-made balsamic reduction that will put any pizza joint to shame.

Bring your friends and the drinks and we’ll share some of NYC’s best kept pizza secrets!

More info and tickets: https://goo.gl/BxDmZK

results.description:
This is an opportunity to practice Japanese conversation, and discuss and study the grammar, particles, Kanji, and culture. The topic varies among all these, according to what people are interested in talking about and the natural flow of conversation.

Members of all levels are welcome, from absolute beginners on up, and there is never a prerequisite. Native speakers are also encouraged to attend, both to lend their expertise and to receive the benefit of a look at the structure of Japanese from an outside linguistic perspective.

Here's a photo of the area where we meet, for reference:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The meeting is free, with no membership dues, hourly costs, or other expenses.

 

==> Learning & Practice RESOURCES

Various materials http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/thread/3199165/0#[masked]

KANJI http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1175397
KATAKANA http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1198386
HIRAGANA http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1198387

Please click over DISCUSSIONS ->Message Board, then select your favorite topic. Have a lot of FUN learning about Nihon & Nihongo! http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/
results.how_to_find_us: Look for me, with the pile of Japanese dictionaries at one of the tables in the Atrium, or one of the other groups speaking in and about Japanese.

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE INFORMATION BELOW CAREFULLY, ESPECIALLY THE BOLD TYPE AND TRANSPORTATION SECTION.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Thank you.

Bring comfortable walking shoes and EXTRA LAYERS OF CLOTHING.

We will be starting later, at 6:45 PM, for this holiday lights walk. On Christmas Eve, there will be a festive mood in these neighborhoods. We will see (and hear) some people singing Christmas carols and there will also be costumed Santa Clauses and other holiday characters around. 

This is a sociable walk along a very scenic route filled with interesting places. Although I will comment on some things (the background of some of the holiday lights displays) along the way, this is not one of my walking tours.

Some of the route will be different from last year's walk. There are also a number of new holiday decorations including an inflatable Santa Claus that is 2 1/2 stories tall and a virtual Santa Claus in a second floor window.

I also have scheduled this walk on Friday, January 1st and Saturday, January 2nd.

This walk is about 4 1/2 miles and moderate paced (not slow paced). If you think that you will be lagging behind with a moderate pace, then this type of walk is not good for you.

If you have any questions for me, please contact me through my private Meetup inbox. The organizer for this Meetup event is John, the event host, who is listed on the top of the "going list" with a photograph. Thank you again.

I also had planned to go to a spectacular holiday lights display in the neighborhood of Greenwood, Brooklyn but it is unfortunately not happening in 2015. Instead, the creative team behind these holiday light displays are too busy building a new sprawling 18-hold miniature golf course destination in Red Hook, Brooklyn.

Description: We'll first go past the "Blue Christmas house," where all the outdoor decorations are mostly in blue (not the traditional Christmas colors of red, green, and gold), which honors the divided household-a Christian husband and a Jewish wife. Inside, half of the house is decorated for Christmas; the other half is decorated for Hanukkah.

We'll also see an 800-pound robotic Santa Claus (he sometimes will have a conversation with you!), merry-go-rounds, Nativity scenes, stately trees bejeweled in colorful lights, inflatable figures, enormous wooden soldiers, dancing animals, candy canes, twinkling snowflakes, and much more.

One interesting house has holiday greetings illuminated in three languages: English, Italian, and Greek. On the side of the house, a large snowflake design periodically lights up as a Star of David. This house is incredible!

How the Dyker Heights' holiday light tradition got started:

In the mid-1980s, Lucy Spata started the tradition of the Christmas Lights. Lucy said, "when I first moved into the neighborhood, it looked like a funeral parlor during the winter." Lucy's neighbors didn't initially welcome her "over-the-top" holiday lights display. In fact, Lucy said that when one of the neighbors complained about the lights and traffic the lights attracted she told them either to join her with holiday decorations or to move out of the neighborhood. However, when another neighbor started to put up the flamboyant holiday lights to match Lucy's lights, this neighborhood tradition really took off!

We'll be finishing at about 9:30 PM near the "D" subway station at 71st Street and New Utrecht Avenue.


We'll encounter displays that are very bright (like blast or flood lighting), so bring your sunglasses just in case!

Cost: The cost of this event is $2 per person, which is paid at the start of the walk. This is for the organizer's Meetup preparation costs and fees.

Meeting Time: The meeting time is (after dinner) at 6:45 PM. Allow extra travelling time because the "R" subway train is a local train.

Meeting Place: The meeting place is outside of the entrance to Century 21 Department Store, which is located at 472 Eighty-Sixth (86th) Street, Brooklyn, NY. The Century 21 Department Store actually has three entrances (next to one another) on 86th Street. We'll meet in front of the first entrance, which is the entrance for Women's Outerwear and Handbags Departments.

Before the walk, restrooms are located downstairs in Century 21 Department Store (which is scheduled to be open until 7:00 PM on Christmas Eve). The restrooms are located downstairs near the Men's Suits Department. After we start the walk, we'll have very limited opportunities for a restroom stop because we'll be walking in mostly residential neighborhoods.

Public Transportation: Take the southbound "R" subway train to 86th Street and 4th Avenue. After getting off the train, go to the token booth level and make a left turn upstairs. At street level, walk east (on the southern side of 86th Street) for about half of a block to the entrances of Century 21 Department Store.

Driving Directions: This is a one-way walk, so we will not be going back to the starting point. If you want to take your car, you can park your car somewhere near the "R" subway train at 86th Street and 4th Avenue. At the end of the walk, you will have to take the northbound "D" subway train at 71st Street to 36th Street and then take the connecting southbound "R" subway train back down to 86th Street and 4th Avenue.

Finishing Time: This one-way walk will finish at about 9:30 PM.

Finishing Place: We'll be finishing near the "D" subway station at 71st Street and New Utrecht Avenue. (The "D" subway train is the only subway line that runs in Dyker Heights, and it cuts through only one corner of Dyker Heights at 71st Street.) At the end point, you could take the "D" subway train, and if you want, you can take the northbound "D" subway train to Atlantic Avenue, where you can then switch to another subway line.

I also had planned to go to a spectacular holiday lights display in the neighborhood of Greenwood, Brooklyn but it is unfortunately not happening in 2015. Instead, the creative team behind these light displays are too busy building a new sprawling 18-hold miniature golf course destination in Red Hook, Brooklyn.


Rainy/snowy weather or cold/windy conditions will cancel this walk. Therefore, if it is rainy/snowy weather or cold/windy conditions or the forecast is for rainy/snowy weather or cold/windy conditions, I will post a cancellation notice on Thursday morning. This walk will only happen in good weather conditions. If I don't post a cancellation notice, I plan to be at the meeting place. If I do cancel the walk, I will also post a cancellation notice on the Discussion Board.
results.name: Bay Ridge and Dyker Heights Holiday Lights Walk (Dec. 24)

group.name: NYC/NJ Walks: Explore Architecture, Art, History & Sculpture

results.description:
Since I am still always around on the Holidays I will be throwing my traditional Christmas parties to celebrate with old and new friends. 

Part one of the Christmas Dinner Party series (Christmas Eve)

For this dinner you will be asked to bring a dish characteristic from one of your favorite holiday movies. This can be a food that is in the movie or something that you imagine one of the main characters will eat based on what you know about them. 

To make it more interesting you must come up with three clues about your movie so that we can guess which movie your food is from. Person/persons who guesses the most movies correctly will get an extra kooky gift :-) 

I'll also be playing Bad Santa in the background because that is one of my favorite holiday films :-) 

We will also be doing a kooky gift exchange, participating is optional but encouraged if you don't want to be seen as the Grinchy one. All gifts should cost $15-$20 please let's keep it in that range to be fair. All gifts should be wrapped or in gift bags so that we can't see them. Your gifts should be kooky of course! 

So to recap: To participate you must bring at least one dish from a holiday movie. Please tell us what you are bringing, but don't tell us which movie it is from. We need to guess that. 

As always if you wish to drink with us please contribute a bottle of wine or cocktail.

This is a potluck party, but you may do finishing touches in the apartment. 

I have a small 7lb hypo allergenic Yorkie Poo named Pepper, he is really sweet and loves people, but if you have an issue with dogs please refrain from RSVPing to this event.

The fine print:


Please pick out what you would like to cook and confirm that you can make this event on the night of December 24th  Each cook may bring one non-cook to enjoy the meal!

Cancellations: Please be 100% committed to attending this event, and cancel 48 hours in advance. There is limited space and each member puts in a lot of time, effort, and planning into each of these events. Late cancellations affect the group as a whole. If you cancel with less than 48 hours notice, or are a no show you could be removed from the group.
results.how_to_find_us: Additional details will be sent to those who are attending.
results.name: Two Nights of Christmas: #1 Christmas Eve Holiday Movie Potluck & Kooky Gifts

results.description:
Nightshade grew up in NYC’s West Village,listening to Casals, The Stones, Ravi Shankar &Sly Stone. His family rented studio space to a 12-piece funk band. “I remember sitting in my PJs watching the neighbors dance all-night at band practices. I had to be a part of that.” As the dj emissary for Putumayo World Music Nightshade has been djing all over the globe. He has headlined at dozens of clubs in; Europe, South/Central America and Canada,The combination of his: fascination with global culture, deep interest in world music (Arabic, African, Indian, Balkan & Latin) music along with a genre bending Electro style have cemented his reputation as one of the best global dance 


DJs on the international scene.Nightshade is the consummate world music fusionist, his unique geo-musical perspective informs all his: live shows & dj releases, as well
as all his film & video game music work.
results.name: DJ Nightshade and Caridad Rivera Bellydancing

results.description: Kirtan is a form of devotional chanting whose roots go back over 500 years to India. It is a form of Bhakti Yoga (yoga of devotion) and has the power to open the heart. Musical instruments and rhythmic drumming accompany the singing and the attendees are encouraged to participate by chanting, clapping and dancing. You will not be able to resist the urge to join in! In its heartfelt expression, kirtan can induce profound states of meditation, bliss and ecstasy. There is a sweet sound vibration that permeates through all layers of coverings and makes God dance. That sound vibration is Kirtan. It is a mysterious connection that draws people to each other.
results.name: Kirtan! Mantra Meditation

group.name: Meditation & Kirtan: For New and Experienced - LES/E.Village

results.description:
Our amazing member, Cassie, is throwing a Christmas Eve party at her decked out house in Chelsea. Apparently, she has a backyard with a fire pit, so everyone pray for 70 degree Xmas weather. With the way things have been going so far, it isn't too far fetched, lol. Feel free to bring guests... and wine if you can :)


Also, I just wanna say thanks to all who have opened up their home to the group. Parties are so much fun. It's great way to meet a bunch of members at once, but in the winter, they can be very hard to plan, so I really appreciate those who graciously host these fun events!
results.how_to_find_us: Feel free to call or text me upon arrival 347-295-5810.

results.description:
Its Xmas Eve and you stayed in NYC!  Even if you're broke from Xmas shopping, you can still enjoy some Free laughs and hang out with some great people!

Come to the XMAS EVE FREE LIVE COMEDY SHOW

at the Village Lantern, right in the heart of historic Greenwich Village!!


Come with a friend, or come solo.

All comics performing on the show are professionals and have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Late Night TV (Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc) + MORE!!


Being just around the corner from the legendary Comedy Cellar, we regularly get special guest drop in's from some of the biggest names in comedy!!

The Village Lantern is located at 167 Bleeker St.

Trains Stations Nearby: W. 4th St- D/B/M/F/A/C/E, Bleeker St- 6, Christopher St- 1

Meetup and hang out in the bar area from 730-8 and join us downstairs in the Comedy Club at 8 for the FREE SHOW!!

The Lantern offers a full bar and food menu, including $5 Comedy Show specials including:

Drink:

$5 Can of Beer
$5 Well Drink
$5 Glass of Wine


** 1 item minimum for the show **
results.name: Xmas Eve Live Comedy Show-Free Admission!

results.description:
Hourly schedule of this event gives the opportunity to chose the time to visit and go or stay until midnight celebration.

First hour at 8pm - Akashic records about the birth of Jesus - storytelling hour presenting the channeled information about Jesus' story missing pieces. Brought to us by the modern day genius, Rudolf Steiner (1861 - 1925), it is the version worth pondering about.

Second hour at 9pm - Gnostic Christian Meditation. What is it Gnostic Christianity? How's it different from other
Christian churches?

Third hour at 10pm - Mother Mary Oracle - messages and healing from the Mother, nurturing, compassionate, wise…

Fourth hour at 11pm - Sound Healing, Om-ing and chanting. This is a continuation of the vigil - simple chants such as "Be still and know I am God…" with the sound of alchemical crystal bowls (for those who need to lie down and absorb the healing in a deep state of trance and even sleep, we'll have blankets and mats on the floor).

The midnight ritual - calling on the Cosmic Christ, the presence of that whom we understand in many different ways, whether influenced by our upbringing as well as through our own love and devotion… This is a sacred hour, a blessed time of Light and Love.

May this day and night stay within your Soul for the years to come… Be brave and join our celebration, even if you stop by for an hour or so. We welcome your contribution - members of the community and newcomers alike - bring yourself and your prayers for the world's pending issues. Be Awake, be a Healer… Become Joy in Christ Light. Amen
results.name: Vigilia - Christ Light Healing Ceremony

results.description:
Quicklink for Tickets: http://bitly.com/ball15tix  

For the first time in 15 years, we're combining all our December 24 Ball events (for ages 21-42) into one epic Mega-Ball 2015 at one "legendary" megaclub!  

“The mother of all Jewish Singles parties and the largest Jewish singles event in the nation." - TImeOut NY

“With an estimated 3,000 guests and music calculated to permit conversation, both the dancing and the flirting were said to have been great” - The New York Times 

“Matzo ball parties are Jewish camps all grown up… LetMyPeopleGo.com has been the grandest one of all, packing 'em in 3,000 strong, including Jewish jet-setters from London, Toronto, and Sydney. - Village Voice

This event is geared for ages 21-42. But The Ball Weekend doesn't stop there! We also offer: 

• The Ball for Ages 35-55 on December 25; and 

• The Yachtza Ball on December 26 (ages 20s-40s)

+++

The Nation's Biggest Jewish Singles Party for the Past 20 Years!

+++

The Ball in NYC on Christmas Eve has been the Nation’s Biggest Jewish Singles Event for the past 20 years (see our videos and our press and photos). Bigger than any Matzo Ball or JDate party in the country, The Ball may be the the biggest Jewish Singles party on Earth.

View 100s of photos from The Ball 2014 at Lavo, Tao, PH-D, Avenue & The Park!

+ + +

SPONSOR

Boost your career with an MBA – the QS World MBA Tour will be visiting New York on Saturday, January 23rd at the Millennium Broadway Hotel.

Register for free to take advantage of this great opportunity to speak with top b-schools admissions directors and get personalized GMAT prep advice

+ + +. 

ONE BALL TO RULE THEM ALL - 15 YEARS IN THE MAKING

We held the first Ball, in 1995, at the famous Palladiumnightclub. In the years, that followed we brought The Ball to many of the enormous NYC clubs of the day including the notorious Tunnel and The Limelight. But by 1999, the era of the NYC megaclub was over. Sad face.

With 3,000+ attendees and no large nightclub in which to entertain them, we began to host The Ball in as many as 5 venues at the same time and to provide complimentary limo service between the parties. We continued to do this for 15 years through The Ball 2014.


But now, with last year's opening of megaclub Space Ibiza NY  and the very recent opening of UNDR, the ultra-lounge adjoining it, we can finally unite 1000s of Ball attendees in one massive party - with a follow up Yachtza Ball After Party two days later (included with your purchase of a Jewniversal Plus Pass)!

The Ball at Space Ibiza NY and UNDR Ultralounge (Christmas Eve, December 24)

"This is huge. Both in the figurative sense and in the 20,000-square-feet sense. An immense warehouse of sparkling things and unabashed gyration by way of Spain." - UrbanDaddy"

It's about creating the Ibiza experience: beautiful people, a party atmosphere, lots of fun." - Antonio Piacquadio, co-owner

For over two decades, Space, on the Island of Ibiza, has been the world's most-awarded global nightclub. This Christmas Eve, you're invited to experience the first North American outpost of the world'-famous Spanish nightclub at The Ball 2015.

• We'll be taking over the entire enormous 20,000 square foot main space ("It's probably the largest single room I can remember being in a club in Manhattan," says Vice).And will also be taking over the adjoining, just-opened, 5,000 square foot ultralounge UNDR, too!

• Featuring" a dance floor big enough for everyone to do the shmoney dance" (Thrillist), overhead "disco balls that are alive- or at least they move all over the place," (UrbanDaddy), a $300,000 sound and light system, a lounge hidden in a cargo container and another 5,000 square foot one at UNDR, it's no wonder that "even Leonardo DiCaprio has been spotted partying there" (Thrillist) and Madonna has been spotted DJing.

• With two DJs, 2 lounges, and a massive nightclub that TimeOut terms "legendary," we're expecting an amazing, epic event! 

• Your Jewniversal Pass is now your Golden Ticket to this special event at Space Ibiza NY and UNDR on Dec 24. 

• Purchase a Jewniversal Plus Pass to also voyage with us upon The Yachtza Ball on Saturday, Dec 26!


Interested in bottle service? Email  [masked] for options.

We'll see you in Space!

And aboard The Yachtza Ball (Saturday, December 26). 

All the Details: http://www.YachtzaBall.com

</a>

<a href="http://nyc.letmypeoplego.com/events/ages-21-49/1243-the-yachtza-ball"> </a>

<a href="http://nyc.letmypeoplego.com/events/ages-21-49/1243-the-yachtza-ball">

</a>

<a href="http://nyc.letmypeoplego.com/events/ages-21-49/1243-the-yachtza-ball">

results.description:
Quicklink for Tickets: http://bitly.com/ball15tix 

For the first time in 15 years, we're combining all our December 24 Ball events (for ages 21-42) into one epic Mega-Ball 2015 at one "legendary" megaclub!  

“The mother of all Jewish Singles parties and the largest Jewish singles event in the nation." - TImeOut NY

“With an estimated 3,000 guests and music calculated to permit conversation, both the dancing and the flirting were said to have been great” - The New York Times 

“Matzo ball parties are Jewish camps all grown up… LetMyPeopleGo.com has been the grandest one of all, packing 'em in 3,000 strong, including Jewish jet-setters from London, Toronto, and Sydney. - Village Voice

This event is geared for ages 21-42. But The Ball Weekend doesn't stop there! We also offer:

• The Ball for Ages 35-55 on December 25; and 

• The Yachtza Ball on December 26 (ages 20s-40s)

+++

The Nation's Biggest Jewish Singles Party for the Past 20 Years!

+++

The Ball in NYC on Christmas Eve has been the Nation’s Biggest Jewish Singles Event for the past 20 years (see our videos and our press and photos). Bigger than any Matzo Ball or JDate party in the country, The Ball may be the the biggest Jewish Singles party on Earth.

View 100s of photos from The Ball 2014 at Lavo, Tao, PH-D, Avenue & The Park!

+ + +

SPONSOR

Boost your career with an MBA – the QS World MBA Tour will be visiting New York on Saturday, January 23rd at the Millennium Broadway Hotel.

Register for free to take advantage of this great opportunity to speak with top b-schools admissions directors and get personalized GMAT prep advice

+ + +. 

ONE BALL TO RULE THEM ALL - 15 YEARS IN THE MAKING

We held the first Ball, in 1995, at the famous Palladium nightclub. In the years, that followed we brought The Ball to many of the enormous NYC clubs of the day including the notorious Tunnel and Limelight. But by 1999, the era of the NYC megaclub was over. Sad face.

With 3,000+ attendees and no large nightclub in which to entertain them, we began to host The Ball in as many as 5 venues at the same time and to provide complimentary limo service between the parties. We continued to do this for 15 years through The Ball 2014.

But now, with last year's opening of megaclub Space Ibiza NY  and the very recent opening of UNDR, the ultra-lounge adjoining it, we can finally unite 1000s of Ball attendees in one massive party - with a follow up Yachtza Ball After Party two days later (included with your purchase of a Jewniversal Plus Pass)!

The Ball at Space Ibiza NY and UNDR Ultralounge (Christmas Eve, Dec 24)

"This is huge. Both in the figurative sense and in the 20,000-square-feet sense. An immense warehouse of sparkling things and unabashed gyration by way of Spain." - UrbanDaddy

"It's about creating the Ibiza experience: beautiful people, a party atmosphere, lots of fun." - Antonio Piacquadio, co-owner

For over two decades, Space, on the Island of Ibiza, has been the world's most-awarded global nightclub. This Christmas Eve, you're invited to experience the first North American outpost of the world'-famous Spanish nightclub at The Ball 2015.

• We'll be taking over the entire enormous 20,000 square foot main space ("It's probably the largest single room I can remember being in a club in Manhattan," says Vice).And will also be taking over the adjoining, just-opened, 5,000 square foot ultralounge UNDR, too!

• Featuring" a dance floor big enough for everyone to do the shmoney dance" (Thrillist), overhead "disco balls that are alive - or at least they move all over the place," (UrbanDaddy), a $300,000 sound and light system, a lounge hidden in a cargo container and another 5,000 square foot one at UNDR, it's no wonder that "even Leonardo DiCaprio has been spotted partying there" (Thrillist) and Madonna has been spotted DJing.

• With two DJs, 2 lounges, and a massive nightclub that TimeOut terms "legendary," we're expecting an amazing, epic event! 

• Your Jewniversal Pass is now your Golden Ticket to this special event at Space Ibiza NY and UNDR on Dec 24. 

• Purchase a Jewniversal Plus Pass to also voyage with us upon The Yachtza Ball on Saturday, Dec 26!


Interested in bottle service? Email  [masked] for options.

We'll see you in Space!

And aboard The Yachtza Ball (Saturday, December 26). 

All the Details: http://www.YachtzaBall.com

</a>

results.description:
Nightshade grew up in NYC’s West Village,listening to Casals, The Stones, Ravi Shankar &Sly Stone. His family rented studio space to a 12-piece funk band. “I remember sitting in my PJs watching the neighbors dance all-night at band practices. I had to be a part of that.” As the dj emissary for Putumayo World Music Nightshade has been djing all over the globe. He has headlined at dozens of clubs in; Europe, South/Central America and Canada,The combination of his: fascination with global culture, deep interest in world music (Arabic, African, Indian, Balkan & Latin) music along with a genre bending Electro style have cemented his reputation as one of the best global dance 


DJs on the international scene.Nightshade is the consummate world music fusionist, his unique geo-musical perspective informs all his: live shows & dj releases, as well
as all his film & video game music work.

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include... 

30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.
results.name: Hill Running Workout

Whatever it is you plan to do on December 25th, meet us at the Williamsburg Bridge on Friday morning for a deck of cards hills workout with a special holiday theme!

Meet us at the base of the Williamsburg Bridge on the Manhattan side ~ near the corner of Delancey and Clinton St. The workout starts PROMPTLY at 6:30 am ~ so be there at 6:25 to make a new friend and fuel up on high fives!

After the workout we'll grab coffee at Spreadhouse -- there may even be breakfast snacks for sharing!

p.s. Remember that public transit operates on a Sunday schedule on Christmas Day. Check out the MTA website for detailed information and to plan your trip, so you don't have to miss a minute of the best Christmas Day workout you'll have all year! http://web.mta.info/nyct/service/stationInfo_Christmas_Dec2015.htm

(2) Everyone is welcome.
(3) We will have fun.

results.description:
Beginners, new hikers, old timers, anyone interested in a hike filled with winter scenery- see photo (no snow) with some moderate uphill/downhill hiking, only 42 minutes from Grand Central via the New Haven Line- MetroNorth railroad, come join us. Bring lunch, dress for the weather and wear comfortable footwear.  Saxon Woods is an excellent park with great views and waterfalls. The park features many good hiking trails.  It's a real hidden gem in Westchester. Guests are invited. Joint hike with AMC.

Try and use restrooms on the train. Restrooms are closed at the station. We will stop at a local convenience store with restrooms on the way to the trailhead.

The town of Mamaroneck is known locally for it's diversity and large variety of ethnic restaurants. Mamaroneck is very scenic and situated on Long Island Sound and attracts many visitors. I suggest a walk around town after the hike. 

Public Transportation: MetroNorth New Haven Line from Grand Central leaving at 8:36 a.m. and arriving in Mamaroneck at 9:18 a.m. A return afternoon train leaves every hour from Mamaroneck. I'll be waiting for the arriving train at the northbound side of the MetroNorth station in Mamaroneck.

Driving Directions: Mamaroneck, NY MetroNorth train station parking lot. Meet at 9:15 am. No shuttling needed ! Free Parking Christmas Day.

Hike Leader: Steve Galla.  Text:[masked]-2222. Weather prediction says sunny and mild. Rain cancels. Stay in touch. Check the website frequently for possible updates.

<a href="http://www.meetup.com/Appalachian-Mountain-Club-New-York-North-Jersey/members/8227482"></a>
results.how_to_find_us: See Steve in the MetroNorth parking lot in Mamaroneck

results.description:
Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who <a>signs up</a>.

Here's what separates this group from many others:

• Chill, positive attitudes. (People without forgiving personalities don't last long in this group, let alone in a given game.)

• Good quality equipment: $145 match balls; solid small goals - not pop-ups!

• Freshly laundered, adult-size, pillowy soft pinnies.

• We won't ever over-crowd a game. The size of pitch we use is best suited for 7v7. We're happy to make the pitch smaller if numbers are low. But we won't make it bigger or allow more than 7 players per team. 


• The small fee we ask of each player (at least $3 per session) supports a non-profit that we created and run: a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!

• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED (for both real grass and artificial grass)! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No Permit but field is usually available for us at this time.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- JJ)

(Co-Leader-TBD)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME !! Game starts when we have at least 10 players.

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is canceled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change.

I'll make decision by Thursday night at 6pm so we don't cause people to mess up their plans. We need at least 12 players by then. We will attempt to play on the turf field at Dyker. This will not be a draft or specific team selection, we'll mix it up so that it's as fair as possible.

venue.name: Benches at entrance to Central Park on 5th Ave. between 84th and 85th St.

results.description: We'll visit the Obelisk, Turtle Pond, the Shakespeare Garden (with quotes and flowers mentioned in the plays), Belvedere Castle, with its panoramic views, and the Ramble (38 acres of winding wooded trails). Maybe a mile altogether at a very leisurely pace. We'll end up around 1pm with lunch at the Boathouse Cafe (reasonable prices). Bring your own or buy it there. Meet 11am on the benches at the entrance to the park restrooms between 84th and 85th Sts. and 5th Ave. Call or email to let me know you are coming and if you have any questions. No need to RSVP if you are not coming. Joint with other clubs. Bob Susser; [masked];[masked]-4371.
results.name: Some highlights of Central Park

group.name: Single Men and Single Women in NYC!!!

results.description:
FRIDAY, 12/25

1:00 PM

BRUNCH@ TRIPLE CROWN ALE HOUSE, 330 7th Ave. (between 28th and 29th St.) NYC

then:

MOVIE

Joy (2015)

SHOWTIME: 4:15  THEATRE: AMC LOWE'S 34TH ST., ON 8th Ave. and 34th St., 

PLEASE BUY YOUR TICKETS NOW!! THIS SHOW WILL GET SOLD OUT. IT OPENS CHRISTMAS DAY!! 12/25 

Plot Summary 


JOY is the wild story of a family across four generations centered on the girl who becomes the woman who founds a business dynasty and becomes a matriarch in her own right. Betrayal, treachery, the loss of innocence and the scars of love, pave the road in this intense emotional and human comedy about becoming a true boss of family and enterprise facing a world of unforgiving commerce. Allies become adversaries and adversaries become allies, both inside and outside the family, as Joy’s inner life and fierce imagination carry her through the storm she faces.

Cast: Jennifer Lawrence , Robert De Niro , Bradley Cooper , Edgar Ramirez , Diane Ladd , Virginia Madsen ,Isabella Rossellini , Elisabeth Röhm

Director: David O. Russell

Genres: Drama

Distributor: 20th Century Fox

Hey Annie, join the conversation!

<a href="http://www.meetup.com/NYC-SINGLES-over-40-MOVIE-BRUNCH-DINNER-CLUB/members/2815447"></a>
results.name: FRIDAY 1/25 CHRISTMAS BRUNCH@TRIPLE CROWN & MOVIE: "JOY"

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING A RED SHIRT AND A GREEN SHIRT

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Varies)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME !! Game starts when we have at least 10 players.

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2 - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.name: Merry Jewmas: Movie and Chinese Food

results.description:
Hey folks, let's celebrate Christmas Day....Jewish style!!! That means Chinese food and a movie. And no, you don't have to be Jewish :) There is a great Chinese restaurant on 15th St and Irving Place in Manhattan, with two large theaters near by. Union Square has the 2,3,4,5,6,L,R,N,Q trains, so anyone from Brooklyn (or Queens) can get there.

Here is the restaurant:

http://www.thecottagenewyork.com/

Then we will go see Star Wars!!!  its looking really good in the trailers.  Here's a link for tickets:

https://tickets.fandango.com/transaction/ticketing/express/ticketboxoffice.aspx?row_count=106470124&mid=169229&tid=AAJNK

Happy Christmas!!!!

venue.name: Prospect Park Parade Grounds

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****


Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 1:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for anyone wearing a orange or blue Pinnies.

The movie will start around 2.

Please RSVP so we can prepare!

results.description:
Hello all!


To celebrate the Holiday season, the Muslim Jewish Solidarity Committee is hosting a small Christmas lunch.  Come join us and reminisce as we give thanks to an "interesting" year, play some games, and enjoy a halal / kosher meal. 


Please note the following!

• We only have a reservation for 12 people - first come first serve.

To ease payment and tips, please bring cash.  Average price is $11-30.

•  Attendees are expected to pay for their meal. 

• The food is certified Kosher.

Please come at the restaurant at 1:45pm sharp!

The restaurant is very busy on Christmas Day! If you are not on time, you will lose your spot :-(

Please check the MTA for traffic changes so you will have a great moment.

Here is the menu!
results.how_to_find_us: In front of the restaurant !
results.name: A Halal / Kosher Christmas: Christmas Lunch @ Chinatown

results.description:
Come out if you have no Christmas plans and enjoy delicious French Cuisine.
Located in the heart of New York City's West Village, A.O.C. has become a part of the historic and beautiful neighborhood.

Our extensive menu is a collaboration of handed down family recipes from the chef/owner, Romain Bonnans, and classic French fare. Savor everything from Omelets to Feuille de Brique for brunch. For dinner you might try our Moules Marinieres (a favorite among our customers), a classic Salad Nicoise or a Lobster Risotto, all while enjoying the casual atmosphere. In the summer months, relax in our outdoor garden and experience a little bit of France.
http://aocnyc.com/
results.name: Christmas Brunch at A.O.C. (l’Ail ou la Cuisse)

group.name: Evenings & Weekends in New York City

results.description:
Ok the movie is going to be Daddy's Home, I got seats D5 & 6 for the 2:40 pm showing. I will arrive by 2:15 and be in my seat in the theater. Meetup in the lobby after to go to the China-Buffet

One of my favorite things to do on Christmas Day is go out to see a movie and then for Chinese food. It is something I have done with my social clubs many times over the years when I was not going home to family.

So this is the plan: We will go to our regular theater in Hazlet for a 2-3 pm approximate time show. I will select a movie and post it once the schedule is up. I will buy my ticket in advance and post my seat#.  That is where we will meet, not the lobby. You can go the the theater to buy your ticket but if you do not pre-order you may not get to sit with the group. Here is the link to the Hazlet theater: http://www.cinemark.com/theatre-detail.aspx?node_id=83854

After the movie (4:30ish) meet in the lobby and we can go up the road to the local China Buffet at 3005 rt 35 N. I spoke to them today to confirm that they will be open. The place has mixed reviews but my son and I eat there and are OK with it. here is the link: http://businessfinder.nj.com/288069/China-Buffet-Hazlet-NJ

So I hope that sounds like a good plan and that you can join me for a fun Christmas tradition!

Love, Cassie 


PS wear your S&L wristbands if you are single and looking this event is posted in multiple groups


if you can't make it, no need to post why. We understand and will catch you next time!
results.how_to_find_us: assinged seats
results.name: Movie (Daddy's Home) & Chinese Buffet

results.description:
Winner of the Grand Prize at the 2015 Cannes Film Festival, this acclaimed Hungarian drama, set in Auschwitz, is directed and co-written by László Nemes and stars Géza Röhrig as a member of the camp’s Sonderkommando unit (Jewish prisoners who were forced to lead fellow victims to the gas chambers). The film has been lauded for finding a shattering new visual and aural vocabulary for a subject that is excruciatingly visceral, yet so well-covered by other filmmaking ventures that audiences may assume, incorrectly, they’ve “already been there.” Critics in Cannes hailed the film as “galvanizing,” “strikingly formalist,” and “a powerful aural and visual experience.”  A Sony Classics release.  

"Son of Saul" is on the short list for the Foreign Language Film Oscar!


Instructions

We'll meet for lunch at 1:15PM at Grand Sichuan 15 7th Ave S. & see the 2:45 screening.  I won't be looking for people at Film Forum.  

This screening may sell out.  Please purchase your ticket by clicking here.

Participants are requested to be fully engaged in the meetup by refraining from all phone usage.  (Now please don't ask for my cell number.)

Please drink responsibly.

https://youtu.be/sWQTfbXLTHQ
results.how_to_find_us: We'll meet for lunch at 1:15PM at Grand Sichuan 15 7th Ave S. & see the 2:45 screening.
results.name: "Son of Saul" Cannes-winner.  Chinese & a Movie!

venue.address_1: 209 West Houston Street between 6th Ave & Varick
venue.name: Film Forum

results.description:
Winner of the Grand Prize at the 2015 Cannes Film Festival, this acclaimed Hungarian drama, set in Auschwitz, is directed and co-written by László Nemes and stars Géza Röhrig as a member of the camp’s Sonderkommando unit (Jewish prisoners who were forced to lead fellow victims to the gas chambers). The film has been lauded for finding a shattering new visual and aural vocabulary for a subject that is excruciatingly visceral, yet so well-covered by other filmmaking ventures that audiences may assume, incorrectly, they’ve “already been there.” Critics in Cannes hailed the film as “galvanizing,” “strikingly formalist,” and “a powerful aural and visual experience.”  A Sony Classics release.  

"Son of Saul" is on the short list for the Foreign Language Film Oscar!

Instructions

We'll meet for lunch at 1:15PM at Grand Sichuan 15 7th Ave S. & see the 2:45 screening..  I won't be looking for people at Film Forum.  

This screening may sell out.  Please purchase your ticket by clicking here.

Participants are requested to be fully engaged in the meetup by refraining from all phone usage.  (Now please don't ask for my cell number.)

Please drink responsibly.

https://youtu.be/sWQTfbXLTHQ
results.how_to_find_us: We'll meet for lunch at 1:15PM at Grand Sichuan 15 7th Ave S. & see the 2:45 screening.

results.description:
We had a great time last Christmas at Gore Mountain. Let's do this again. Check out the all the great reviews on Yelp.

Gore Mountain is an alpine ski resort on Gore Mountain in the Adirondack Mountains, located in North Creek, New York. The mountain is a popular winter destination, attracting skiers from all over the east. It is the closest large mountain in New York to the Capital District (Albany) metro area. Gore Mountain is one of the three ski areas owned by the State of New York; and is operated by the Olympic Regional Development Authority(ORDA), a state agency. Gore Mountain has 107 trails and 15 lifts (nine chairlifts, one gondola lift, one J-bar lift, one Poma lift, and one magic carpet), and one snow train. Gore mountain has a wide variety of alpine terrain catering to alpine skiers of all levels. Gore also has 12 Nordic trails for cross country skiing.

For this trip, we will stay at Super 8 Lake George/Warrensburg (Great TripAdvisor rating). Situated in Lake George, Super 8 Lake George/Warrensburg Area is close to Hickory Ski Center. A complimentary breakfast is served each morning. Complimentary self parking is available onsite for guests. This is a smoke-free property. The 32 air-conditioned guestrooms at Super 8 Lake George/Warrensburg Area include hair dryers and irons/ironing boards. Complimentary wireless high-speed Internet access is provided. All accommodations provide desks and phones; free local calls are offered (restrictions may apply). The hotel is located near the beautiful Lake George where we can hang out some nights.


*** Trip plan email will be sent out to everyone confirmed (including those paid by Chase Quickpay) via Eventbrite 2 to 3 days before the departure date providing trip logistics and details. ***


Depart Date: December 25th Friday. Please arrive 15 minutes earlier.


Depart 3:00 PM: (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel)[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map)

Depart 3:45 PM: (Garden City Deli) Northwest corner of 43rd St & 9th Ave New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Return: Depart from Gore on December 27th Sunday at 3:30 PM; arrive at NYC at 9:30 PM & Flushing at 10:00 PM.

Trip Includes: 2 days 2 nights ski/snowboard trip; 2 nights double occupancy accommodation at Super 8 Hotel (Two double beds in a room). 2 days all mountain lift tickets at Gore Mountain. Benz Sprinter van round trip transportation from NYC, daily transportation between hotel & ski resort, tolls, & parking fee if any. 2 daily breakfasts.


Cost: Early Birds (Includes Transport) $319 for first 15 spots; Regular (Includes Transport) $349 for last 15 spots; Self drive option will be added later.

Buy Ticket Here: http://dec2015goremountain.eventbrite.com/ You can also Chase Quickpay me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) If Quickpaying, please indicate your boarding location. Your spot is NOT confirmed until your payment has been received.


Additional Cost: 2 day equipment rental package (skis or snowboard) is at group rate $80. Packages above include equipment, boots, helmet, and poles if applicable. 2 days Learn to Ski/Ride for first timers (which includes lift, lesson & rentals) upgrade is $70. Class lesson for skiers and riders of all levels is $40.


Refund Policy:
* Full refund minus $30 processing fee if cancelled 30 days in advance;
* 50% refund if cancelled 15 days in advance;
* No refund for cancellation or no show within 15 days; however, spots can be transferred to your friends with $30 processing fee.


Pictures from 2014 Christmas Trip at Gore Mountain

http://www.nyskiclub.com/photos/26543462/

Video: Rumor - Gore Mountain

http://youtu.be/79zRJS3p5_w


http://youtu.be/79zRJS3p5_w

FB: https://www.facebook.com/nyskiclub/events 
Meetup: http://www.nyskiclub.com/events 
Eventbrite: https://nyskiclub.eventbrite.com 


By RSVP'ing "Yes", you and your guest(s) are accepting the terms to the Waiver & Release of Liability set forth by NY Ski & Snowboard Club.

Like our Facebook page, and get updated promotions/discounts.

results.description:
Marseille- Christmas Dinner
630 9th Avenue (Corner 44th Street)
Friday, December 25rd RSVP early
3:15pm optional drinks, 4pm Dinner
$87- 3-course dinner, gl of wine, t & t

We are membership only group, but you are welcome to come to an event to see our group. All of our events average 20-30+ members. You must prepay for this and all of our events, so that restaurants have an accurate head count. Please go to our website. http://thesinglegourmet.net/event/marseille/
Celebrate the Christmas spirit the French way at this popular French brasserie that according to Zagat, “feels like being in Paris”. Michelin Guide says, “Marseille marries the charm of a classic French bistro with the inimitable style of New York City and the skilled and truly professional kitchen prepares an impressive cuisine bursting with pronounced balanced flavors- Think Casablanca.” Marseille hails from the same restaurant group that owns Café D’Alsace, Maison, French Roast, Le Monde, Nice Matin, Pigalle and L’Express. Our meal last Christmas was one of the best of the year and consisted of braised lamb shank, roast beef rib eye, heirloom pork, honey glazed duck breast, Christmas turkey, grilled salmon, plus wonderful choices of French appetizers and desserts. Please RSVP early, the restaurant completely sells out every Christmas and this event will have limited seating.
results.name: Sold Out Marseille - Christmas Dinner

Typical Murphys Law. Judy cannot join us because her muffler fell off her van. I am getting over a migraine, so I will sadly miss the diner, but WILL be at the movie at 6:15 to the right of the ticket booth. Enjoy Gotham and see you later at The Big Short!  

Final Update:

So many movies are opening Friday, I am dizzy! Let's see a fun one on Christmas Day, The Big Short at 6:45. We can meet at Gotham City Diner at 4:00 for food and chat and then see the movie in Edgewater at 6:45.

Note: Gotham City Diner is open on Christmas only till 8pm click link below for address.

We are having 2 meetups, one 12/25 Christmas Day and one on New Year's Eve. 

Gotham City Diner    They have great food, we can be loud as usual and its open on Christmas Day, not far from the movie theater.

We don't need reservations at Gotham, but they need to know how many an hour before we arrive, so please RSVP if you are coming to this Christmas Day Meetup.

NO PLANS FOR XMAS?  COME ENJOY GREAT COMPANY AND TASTY CHINESE FOOD!

VP2 is a popular vegetarian spot in the Village.  (For those of you who are carnivores, they have many varieties of fake meat. In previous years, most people liked the food here, including meat-eaters.)

The restaurant's full regular menu will be available:

http://www.menupages.com/restaurants/vegetarians-paradise-2/menu


IMPORTANT:

A) Everyone pays in full for what they order, plus tax and tip.

B) There is a $5 event fee to attend, which must be paid in advance and is in addition to the cost of your meal. This prevents excessive no-shows, which would make an accurate restaurant reservation impossible, as well as disappointing the people who actually do come. The funds will be used to help cover the organizer dues that I must pay to Meetup to keep the groups going.

C) You will automatically be transferred to Paypal when you RSVP Yes. If this process does not work, please use the alternate link in item (D) below.

D) Confidential RSVP option - if you don't want your name or picture to appear on this page, then use this link to pay the event fee and do NOT RSVP on this page:

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=HT5RH2CECWUDS

Note: Please use one method or the other, not both.


HAPPY HOLIDAYS!!!

results.description:
Part Two of the Christmas Dinner Party series (Christmas Day)


For this dinner party you are required to show up in your ugly Christmas sweaters and you must bring vintage holiday food.

If you are wondering what vintage holiday food may consist of I have included a few links. Feel free to use any of these recipes or come up with one of your own. 

http://www.retro-housewife.com/christmas-recipes.php


http://www.buzzfeed.com/rachelwmiller/truly-horrifying-vintage-holiday-recipes#.qw6y24rPD


http://gramsrecipebox.com/vintage-holiday-recipes/


http://antiquealterego.com/2012/11/30/112-vintage-christmas-recipes-breads-cakes-desserts-cookies-candies-punches-from-1958/


http://westerndairyassociation.org/vintage-christmas-recipes/

We will also be doing a gifts fit for foodies exchange, participating is optional but encouraged if you don't want to be seen as the Grinchy one. All gifts should cost $15-$20 please let's keep it in that range to be fair. All gifts should be wrapped or in gift bags so that we can't see them. Your gifts should be foodie related of course! 

So to recap: To participate you must bring at least one retro dish Please tell us what you are bringing in the comments below. 

As always if you wish to drink with us please contribute a bottle of wine or cocktail.

This is a potluck party, but you may do finishing touches in the apartment. 

I have a small 7lb hypo allergenic Yorkie Poo named Pepper, he is really sweet and loves people, but if you have an issue with dogs please refrain from RSVPing to this event.

The fine print: 

Please pick out what you would like to cook and confirm that you can make this event on the night of December 25th  Each cook may bring one non-cook to enjoy the meal!

Cancellations: Please be 100% committed to attending this event, and cancel 48 hours in advance. There is limited space and each member puts in a lot of time, effort, and planning into each of these events. Late cancellations affect the group as a whole. If you cancel with less than 48 hours notice, or are a no show you could be removed from the group.

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001
results.why: I Meditate NY is a movement empowering New Yorkers to do more things they love by recharging through meditation, a practical way to refresh every day, invented thousands of years ago. Reinvented in 2011. Our mission is to recharge New York!
results.how_to_find_us: http://imeditateny.org
results.name: Breath To Happiness

results.description:
Join us this evening for a special meditation for Peace on Earth.

Drawing on the energies of this auspicious day, when so many of the people on our planet have let go of thoughts of war and strive to focus on love and peace, we will focus our own energies on healing the planet and ourselves.

"Let there be Peace on Earth and let it begin with me!"

All are Welcome!
results.name: Meditation for Peace

results.description:
Important Weather Update: It's going to be ridiculously warm this weekend; hence, giving winter hats, gloves and coats will be a waste of time. Please hold onto your warm-weather clothes and only bring food, toiletries, men's tube socks and/or money. 

2 years' ago on Valentine’s Day we had a blizzard warning which never came but I had to cancel my V-Day Singles Party anyway, bc no one would've come. It was going to be a frigid night and I still wanted to do something so at the last second I came up with the idea to Hand out Coats (and socks) to the Homeless on Valentine's Day and wouldn't ya know it, like 20 people came. It was like 18 beautiful women and 2 guys (hint, hint). It was cross-posted to numerous groups, but you can see the details of the event here. We all met up in the city with hats and gloves and toiletries and socks and a little bit of food and a few other things. The biggest “seller” that night was socks and a lot of people wanted food too, so this is what I'm thinking… 

Let’s get together and give to the homeless. Nothing feels better than giving to people that cannot give stuff to themselves + attending an event like this is the best way to meet other good people like you. 

What to bring? First and foremost, you should bring warm stuff like hats and gloves. If you have a warm coat or two you can spare, that would be great. Socks are a big hit too. They love socks. Men's tube socks are good for everyone in the winter. Ziplock bags of toiletries are good too (w/travel toothbrush, toothpaste, and baby wipes). If you would prefer to bring food, I recommend sandwiches and other foods that are convenient to eat. Fruit is good. 

Important Weather Update: It's going to be ridiculously warm this weekend; hence, giving winter hats, gloves and coats will be a waste of time. Please hold onto your warm-weather clothes and only bring food, toiletries, men's tube socks and/or money. 


After we're done we'll go get some food and/or drinks somewhere and bask in the warmth of our hearts. Isn't that sweet?  =) 

Rain Date: This is a rain or shine event. The majority if not all of the donating will be done indoors inside Penn Station so wet weather will not affect us. 

$0 - This is a free event hosted by Date Walking

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call.

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 

Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook­ | Twitter­
results.name: Feed/Clothe the Homeless on Christmas - Free Event - Age: All

results.description:
Important Weather Update: It's going to be ridiculously warm this weekend; hence, giving winter hats, gloves and coats will be a waste of time. Please hold onto your warm-weather clothes and only bring food, toiletries, men's tube socks and/or money. 

2 years' ago on Valentine’s Day we had a blizzard warning which never came but I had to cancel my V-Day Singles Party anyway, bc no one would've come. It was going to be a frigid night and I still wanted to do something so at the last second I came up with the idea to Hand out Coats (and socks) to the Homeless on Valentine's Day and wouldn't ya know it, like 20 people came. It was like 18 beautiful women and 2 guys (hint, hint). It was cross-posted to numerous groups, but you can see the details of the event here. We all met up in the city with hats and gloves and toiletries and socks and a little bit of food and a few other things. The biggest “seller” that night was socks and a lot of people wanted food too, so this is what I'm thinking…


Let’s get together and give to the homeless. Nothing feels better than giving to people that cannot give stuff to themselves + attending an event like this is the best way to meet other good people like you. 

What to bring? First and foremost, you should bring warm stuff like hats and gloves. If you have a warm coat or two you can spare, that would be great. Socks are a big hit too. They love socks. Men's tube socks are good for everyone in the winter. Ziplock bags of toiletries are good too (w/travel toothbrush, toothpaste, and baby wipes). If you would prefer to bring food, I recommend sandwiches and other foods that are convenient to eat. Fruit is good. 

Important Weather Update: It's going to be ridiculously warm this weekend; hence, giving winter hats, gloves and coats will be a waste of time. Please hold onto your warm-weather clothes and only bring food, toiletries, men's tube socks and/or money. 


After we're done we'll go get some food and/or drinks somewhere and bask in the warmth of our hearts. Isn't that sweet?  =) 

Rain Date: This is a rain or shine event. The majority if not all of the donating will be done indoors inside Penn Station so wet weather will not affect us. 

$0 - This is a free event hosted by Date Walking

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call.

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 

Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook­ | Twitter­

results.description:
Every Friday we have a causal gathering of open minded souls, who want to learn from Bhagavad Gita, the Vedic wisdom, and incorporate in to their life. We will be learning various fascinating topics like karma and reincarnation, Who am I, What is the real purpose of life? Who god is? material life, Consciousness, etc.
Mantra meditation is the process of bhakti yoga consisting of hearing and chanting the names of the lord on the beads, followed by melodious music to invoke lord's mercy. This practice has a powerful heart opening effect, which can be best understood through direct experience.
Come, relax in a warm and friendly atmosphere. Listen/observe or just chant with us or sing your heart out! Questions, personal realization, and discussion about the application of spiritual practice are welcome. 
Free Home made vegetarian/vegan dinner (prasadam) served

Admission to each meetup is free. Donations for meetups expenses are welcome.


1. Please RSVP. Location only given on phone [masked]

results.description:
Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. Every week we meet at someone's apartment, a park, or a bar. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee

[masked]

results.description:
Please join us for our weekly gathering!

Please enter the space quietly so that we can support the meditation of the prior class in session. Feel free to bring snacks for the after hours tea party.


We hope to see you there!

Typical evening schedule: 
20 Minutes Seated Meditation 
10 Min Walking Meditation 
10 Min Reading 
30 Min Sharing Circle 
Tea And Snacks till closing @ 11pm

We are a young adult group (Under 35) practicing mindfulness in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh.

results.description:
A Christmas Night Party in the Penthouse with the Tribe!

Quicklink for Tickets: https://ball3555.eventbrite.com/

+++

The 9th Annual Ball for Jewish Singles 35-55

+++ 

*This event is geared for ages 35-55.  We also sponsor The Ball 2015 for ages 21-42 and The Yachtza Ball (Ages 21-49)*

+++

This is the 9th straight year that we have sponsored a more mature version of "The Ball" for Jewish Singles 35-55. And we are again exclusively taking over the luxurious and newly-remodeled Empire Penthouse at 230 Fifth Avenue for this big event!

+ + +

SPONSOR

Boost your career with an MBA – the QS World MBA Tour will be visiting New York on Saturday, January 23rd at the Millennium Broadway Hotel.

Register for free to take advantage of this great opportunity to speak with top b-schools admissions directors and get personalized GMAT prep advice

+ + +. 

Enjoy breathtaking views of the Manhattan skyline, with a 'head-on' look at the Empire State and Chrysler buildings, the golden-domed New York Life Building and - in the distance - the Statue of Liberty.  


With no work the next day, we expect 400+ to join us!

Here's what to expect:

• Exclusive use of the Empire Penthouse from 9 pm - 2 am

• $6 beer, $7 wine & $9 cocktails (9 pm - 10 pm)

• Great music, DJ and dancing 

• An incredible evening of mixing, mingling, dancing and, of course, romancing 

We look forward to seeing you!

A Note: This year, for the first time, we are holding this event on Christmas Day, rather than Christmas Eve. We've made this decision to provide the opportunity for those of you who are "in between" the age groups ofThe Ball for Ages 21-42 on Dec 24 and this event to attend both events affordably, if you'd like, by purchasing our new "In-Betweener Ticket" that provides entry to both events. 

We hope you'll find this change helpful!

All Aboard the Yachtza Ball! (Saturday, Dec 26, Ages 21-49)

Set sail for Jewish Singles adventure the next night (Sat, Dec 26) aboard The Yachtza Ball!

Your ticket to cruise with us is only $10 if you purchase a Combination Ticket to The Ball for Ages 35-55 (December 25) and The Yachtza Ball (December 26)!

All the Details  http://www.YachtzaBall.com

results.description:
Christmas is this Friday and so is Salsa. Come learn, come dance, and come meet and greet. That's right, our usual party and class is still going on. Don't miss it :)

Class: The class is free with admission. It begins at 9:30pm and teaches you the basic steps, how to hold your partner, how to be on time with the music, and so on. You do not need to bring a dance partner since we rotate students so you get to practice with everyone else. But do bring your friends and have a blast. After the class, dance all night with all the people you met during the class. The instructor will usually be Silvio Neris.

Admission: $10. Note that this will be your only expense for the entire Friday night unless you buy a beverage. But you can also bring your own beverages if you want.

Time: The event starts at 9:30pm and ends at 2:30am or until the last dancers leave. Come at any time.

Location: Times Square 151 West 46th Street, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10036 (between 7av and 6av)

Dress code: Casual/comfortable. Bring shoes that don't slip out of your feet and do not have too much grip on the floor.

Salsa sample from instructor:

results.description:
https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xtp1/v/t1.0-9/11401142_1720823001478478_3682666258495805787_n.jpg?oh=6d3a52147bbb4787f69b1b492b283ec2&oe=56D0E6E4

Every Friday Night!
Salsa Dancing in Times Square is Back!
LA FAMA (151 W 46th St, 11th Floor) is a Latin Party that specializes in playing and dancing to Salsa Music. The event takes place where the bright lights are. That's right, Times Square. We have a nice floor, great ventilation, fun willing dancers, and your total expense for a Friday Night is 12.00

Mention Salsa New York at the door and it will be $10


You do not know how to Dance Salsa? No problem. We offer a Free Salsa class at 9:30pm every Friday. So come alone or bring your friends,. Either way, you are guaranteed to learn and have a blast.
You know what else is back? The music. LA FAMA is bringing the music back to the forefront. That's Right, DJ Mustachio will be in th building playing foot stomping flavorful Salsa songs to get those hips moving and grooving.

results.description:
Weekly Karaoke Fridays at Action Burger and $30 open bar night.  Bring your friends and bring your singing voice.  There will be random Anime on one television and Karaoke for the Xbox on another television (Karaoke revolution, American idol and more).  Below are the drinks available for the open bar.  

Open bar isn't required for meetup.  But a $10 minimum food or drink is required for each RSVP member. 

There will also be card games and board games available for members.  Some of the games:  Cards against humanity, Superfight, Monopoly, Scrabble, pie in face, chess, hungry hippo, uno, spades and more. 

Get a free shot for every two songs you sing.  


$30 open bar from 11pm-2am includes:


Unlimited 16oz:  Black Island ice tea, Chocolate mint, Sex on the beach, Watermelon paradise, Action Peach fuzz, Peach ale Martini, Orange Waves, Coconut splash, Raspberry ale, Rum & Coke, Vodka & orange juice, Cranberry & Vodka. Selter & Vodka, Selter & Gin, Ginger Ale & Vodka, Ginger Ale & Tequila, Coke & Whiskey, diet Pepsi & Tequila, pineapple juice & Vodka, pineapple & Rum. 

Unlimited shots (Rum, Tequila, Vodka, Scotch).

Food menu at Action Burger:

results.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8W9KPhmYYtg

Wes Craven's first film was a crude but shocking horror opus that, like George A. Romero's Night of the Living Dead (1968), became a grind house hit largely because it went much further than terror films before it had been willing to go. Often compared to Ingmar Bergman's stark medieval rape drama The Virgin Spring (1960) (though one wonders whether this was influence or just coincidence),Last House on the Left follows a group of teenage girls heading into the city when they hook up with a gang of drug-addled ne'er-do-wells and are brutally murdered. The killers find their way to the home of one of their victim's parents, where both father and mother exact a horrible revenge. Like Tobe Hooper's The Texas Chainsaw Massacre two years later, Last House on the Left was an unrelievedly dark vision of contemporary horror that inspired many future films which copied its effects without achieving its visceral impact.

results.description:
**The Seward Range**

Seymour, Seward, Donaldson, Emmons

This is a hard one day hike and very close to the shortest day of the year!! 

(Experienced winter hikers only)

Details:
Total Mileage: 21 miles
Total Elevation Gain: 4500'
Estimated Hike Time: 12 hours
Special Gear: winter gear including microspikes, crampons and snowshoes,. Headlamp with spare batteries, GPS, map, compass.  

Web links for additional information:

<a>LINK: AdirondackJourney</a>
<a>LINK: Andrew Lavigne</a>
LINK: SummitPost

These are long, hard hikes that will be done at ones OWN PACE , ADK Temps can be very cold and unpleasant. I do not expect faster hikers to wait for the group, nor slower hikers to expect it. Please know the routes, have a map, and be prepared to hike alone (I always say find a hiking buddy and agree not to split up...)

Trail Description: These are all ADK trailess peaks, with only the approach on marked DEC trail. We will go up Caulkins Brook to high shoulder of Donaldson. Out and back Emmons. Over Seward and and descend steeply towards Ward Brook lean-to. Out and back to Seymour. Then the long slog out..

Approach map - Parking is 3.3 miles up-road from the trailhead: (summer parking is usually still open at this time of the year)


Route map - red is the DEC trail and green are generally established herd paths:


http://www.cnyhiking.com/SewardMountainMap.jpghttp://www.summitpost.org/images/medium/136376.JPG


2012 Pictures:

Special regulations: The DEC limits hiking groups in the Western High Peaks Wilderness to 15.  If we have 16 or more, we will divide until at least two smaller groups that are at least 1 mile or 20 minutes apart.  The DEC limits camping groups in the Western High Peaks Wilderness to 8.  If we have 9 or more, we will camp in two separate designated sites, or find additional locations at least 150 feet from the trail, roads, and water sources.  Fires are only permitted in designated fire pits.

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back.

See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.
Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

results.description:
Welcome to Early Bird English, the fun and interesting way to improve your conversation skills early in the day -- without cutting into the rest of your weekend!

 Leader Eve will supply plenty to discuss, but feel free to bring along an English-language passage that you have enjoyed or found puzzling. We'll all take a look and discuss what it means.

 Early Bird English is founded on the idea that people learn best when they are enjoying themselves. Each session is quickly paced, friendly, and meant to challenge.

Eve charges a small, non-refundable fee for each session, which helps to cover the cost of the website as well as her preparation.   Please note that the $10 fee DOES NOT cover the cost of coffee!  Please also note that if only one person attends (in addition to Eve), the meeting will last one hour instead of 1.5.

http://thejoyofenglish.org/

When we learn with pleasure, we never forget.

-- Alfred Mercier

"Lenovo is one of a growing number of multinationals from the non-Anglophone world that have made English their official language."

-- The Economist, 2/15/14

"A strong vocabulary may be your ticket to side-stepping dementia," says a new study from researchers in Spain.  "...An ample vocab is an indication of robust cognitive reserves, a surplus of neurons that help the brain compensate for memory lapses..." 

-- Prevention, April 2015

"It might have been easier to learn a language years ago, but still, I'm having fun...I was heartened to see, just a month or so ago, a Penn State study suggesting that learning a new language can improve your brain function.  It can, in the researcher's words, 'lead to more graceful aging.'" 

-- Tina Hay, editor, The Penn Stater, March/April 2015

"The average American speaks one language.  Be more than average."

-- magazine ad for Rosetta Stone

results.description:
Join us at 8am for a run to Hoboken Pier A and back.
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/121375029

Yes, there is a waterfront route to Hoboken. Enjoy the fun of cruising around Hoboken Pier A; around the new park and children playground at Newport where you will feel if you are at the beach. Get inspired by the man made majestic views of Manhattan!

The mapped distance is approx. 5.88 miles. You may run less or more in that time. We turn back after running 30 min to be back at 9 am. Hyatt pier is .31 miles so a double loop gets some runners 6.5 miles on this run.

9 am we run to Liberty State Park, a favorite place to run for most of us. Run on!

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
